Reviews.Content: Our rooms were very large and comfortable; 2 queen beds and 2 sinks in each. 6 adults and 1 toddler could get together and not feel crowded. The staff was very friendly and the service was exceptional. We had breakfasts at the Terrace Cafe, lunch at Charlie's, dinner at Trellises and bought snacks and drinks from the Sunshine Deli; all were convenient and had excellent food. The resort is very "family friendly". We had a toddler with us and were always made to feel welcome. We used 2 of the 3 pools and enjoyed both. The conceirge was very helpful and we purchased tickets through her to Legoland, Sea World and the SD Zoo. The hotel is conveniently located to those attractions and within walking distance to the SD trolley and Fashion Valley Mall.

Reviews.Title: “SD Resort/Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: SimiDan
Reviews.Content: The Town & Country Resort is the best, particularly is you're going to an event at the Convention Center (on the property). The grounds are beautifully maintained and clean. The resort is huge and takes some time to learn how to navigate from point A to point B, but they have detailed maps of the campus that let you become a "local" after a day or so. Room service compares to Four Seasons. Parking is tough unless you park/stay at one of the towers - there is abundant parking and immediate access to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled with the quality of service.”
Reviews.Author: Julia H
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Town and Country Resort and Convention Center, we were greeted with a warmth that is rare. The quality of service was truly exceptional. With 4 restaurant options on site, 2 gift shops, 3 pools, a jacuzzi, excercise facility, spa and salon, there is something for everyone. Additionally, a wonderful mall and access to the trolley system is just a short walk across the foot bridge. When we met Katherine McCarthy, she further extended a warmth and quality of service that was amazing! Some additional staff that stood out as providing amazing service was Angelique at the Trellis restaurant, Brenda at the Terrace Cafe, and Aaron, one of the bellmen. I would highly recommend this facility to anyone traveling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: raylaw323
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels and this one is a little above average. The hotel is huge and is made up of many areas. We stayed in the large tower. The bad part is that it is a noisy area. There was some sort of convention of young people and they were loud and rude. But the hotel is not to be blamed. The grounds are nice. The internet was free (we got our special rate through travelzoo). The location is ideal close to the mall and other shopping/grocery stores. The service was good. The furniture is dated but rooms are clean and good. The bathroom was clean. We stayed in 1709. Overall a thumbs up if the price is about $120 or less a night.

Reviews.Title: “A bit conflicted--great staff & grounds, bad room”
Reviews.Author: lola19892011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the State Games of America. Check in was quick and efficient, and an extremely kind bellman drove us to our room. However, when you are told at check in that there will be no refunds for leaving early, it should make you wonder what you are facing. We were in the second tower, in a "nice room", that looked like my childhood bedroom from the 1970s. The comforters were very worn and stained, and the room was not sound insulated at all. You can't fault a hotel for its clientele, but many of these people seemed like they belonged on an episode of cops! Screaming and running down halls, dumping buckets of water off the balcony, people trying to come into our room--all made for an extremely uncomfortable experience. I will say that I was impressed with security's response to everything, but how sad that I actually got to know the security guard on sight. We had food appear in our room, then disappear. We had mysterious stains appear on the sheets. We had all the towels taken out by the maid, with only one usable towel left--the other had large black stains on it. We liked this resort just fine, so long as we weren't in the room. The grounds are gorgeous and probably the highlight of the resort, after the staff. We ate at one restaurant for the breakfast buffet and enjoyed it. Within walking distance of public transportation (so easy to use, thanks to the bell staff and concierge) and the Fashion Valley mall. Would I stay here again? Not sure, but I would lean towards "no" simply due to the numerous weird experiences with other guests and the strange happenings in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: txtvldude
Reviews.Content: The property is a bit dated but we were happy with our stay. We were there with the State Games of America group and check in was fairly quick. I did get a bundle on the parking & internet, $11.95 a day for both. We were not offered this up front but after asking about wifi, the front desk told me about the bundle.

Reviews.Title: “Great time. A good location for business and vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Celia V
Reviews.Content: Town & Country provides excellent service and is conveniently located to the trolley for public transportation. The food in the resturants are of good quality and if you are dining at the Trellieses Resteraunt Hopefully you will be served by Pati Muklevicz. She was an excellent server and personalble as well.

Reviews.Title: “Last Case Scenario”
Reviews.Author: erovic
Reviews.Content: This place is set back in time- late 1970's early 80's. The resort is divided into areas, towers, bungalow type rooms as well as motel type rooms. The decor is dated some pieces were showing so much wear and tear that they need to be removed and fixed. The quilt/bed cover was stained yellow and bed linens felt damp to the touch. The registers and returns in the room were laddened with dust and needed cleaning. Otherwise the floors were clean and the bathroom was straight as a pin. The grounds were pretty during the day and illuminated nicely at night, however walking alone on the grounds at night may pose a problem for some. The concierge and bell service was very helpful, but this was a one time stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could avoid staying overnight”
Reviews.Author: zippo6
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was good - the food, meeting rooms, staff were pretty good, but the room I had was a nightmare. To think it cost $145 a night - heck, I wouldn't even take money to stay in that room. It had a Murphy Bed (folding), with all the hardware exposed at the head of the bed. To top that off, the bed itself was the most uncomfortable I have ever been in - I would rather have slept on the floor, but didn't quite trust that. The furniture was stained, and the room was musty. When I went to the front desk to register a complaint, I was given the "We don't have another room" response. Stayed there 3 days, and in that time probably slept a total of 3 hours. I will say that the A/C was in good working order, which beat some of the other people's complaints I heard. If I had another choice, I would stay somewhere else (might do that next year, even if I have to pay for it myself). For $145, you think you'd get more than a sack of potatoes to sleep on. I can't give this higher than a 2-Star rating - after all, a hotel should provide a comfortable night, but to their credit, the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dime”
Reviews.Author: deancoug
Reviews.Content: Rooms dated and old, then they nickel and dime you to death. Fee for gym, fee for internet but a free newspaper! Friendly helpful people at the front desk. Free printing for the boarding pass...but watch the fees!

Reviews.Title: “Kudos from the General H H Arnold HS Reunion Wing Commander”
Reviews.Author: dougbrill
Reviews.Content: Hi all, I ran the reunion over the last 4 days of July and want to express my gratitude to EVERYONE at T&C Resort. I was totally impressed with the friendliness of all of the staff and the efficiency of the workings of the resort. The property is a little dated (maybe a lot - like Kelly's) and is a little tired but overall the experience was excellent. I'd like to point out 3 individuals directly, however. From the time my classmates and I arrived, I personally found Beth at the Reception Desk to be above and beyond the call of duty. At every step of the way she was courteous, friendly and just a smiling breath of fresh air for me in a fun but stressful 4 days! Keep that girl around, and Beth, thanks for calling me Doug! Without Kirk, this reunion would have been a disastrous event! While keeping up with all his other duties, he did some favours for me and my sidekick John by filling in when he could and just helping out doing things he didn't have to do - like offloading a special shopping run. Finally, Antonio G at the reception area, too. I've never been greeted anywhere with a friendlier person than AG! Watching him work the crowd - even when some of them weren't looking for help(!) - was a sight to see. My words are brief by my thanks immeasurable to all three of these outstanding employees! Oh, and let Ron at Kelly's know I enjoyed being the history teacher for a little while! It's in my blood. Keep up the good work. I know you'll make it through the AVID 4000 with flying colours! Doug Brill Reunion Wing Commander, Alumnus and Kentucky Colonel Recent Reunions Atlanta '00, St. Louis '03, San Francisco '05, Arlington VA '07, Louisville KY '09, San Diego '11 Next Stop: Colorado Springs, July 2013! General H. H. Arnold High School, Wiesbaden, then West Germany

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Amentities & Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: awesome14
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 4 different eateries, a humongous convention center, and a few great pools, not to mention the many other enhancements. The rooms are kept very nicely with soft carpet! We had nothing go wrong with our stay and I surely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I really do not know what to say. Twilight Zone?”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: This place is interesting. Not sure if I love it or hate it. Front desk. There was a 25 minute wait. Normally this would anger me. But I was strangely interested. The people were different. The furnishings were different. I was no longer in SD, but some alternate universe. Somewhere in the 60's? Strange. We drove to our bungalow. I was not surprised to see blue carpet or a chandelier in my tiny room. I smelled grandma. I smelled at least forty years of wear and tear. I loved it. I hated it. It felt, different. The walls were thin. Beds were so so. But that is of no importance! We were in a new world! A world were I fully expected to see the Brady Bunch strolling through the rose garden. Why? No idea. Just had that feeling. I felt drawn to something. Were there ghosts here? Duh. Of course! And I do not even believe in ghosts! I needed to walk. Walking around this place was like strolling through a time machine. A must at night. The year 2011 totally disappears. The year 2011 totally disappears! We walked around a bit during the day. Fun with toddlers. The place is huge! It felt like a back lot in a movie studio. When we returned to our room, the keys no longer worked. After 3 calls to the front desk and almost 30 minutes, they finally brought our new keys so we could enter the room. Too late, as our little guy already went in his pants. So much for customer care. We told them he had to go! Still, it took 30 minutes. I tried to find the history of this place, online. All I could find was what was outside my door. A strange, eerie world. We did not have a problem with parking. I guess we were lucky. Would I stay here again? Probably not. Should you? Once.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs, despite the cost”
Reviews.Author: himynamesnick
Reviews.Content: I hope that someday the Town and Country Resort's 3-star rating is reduced to at least a 2-star rating, or - at the very least- I hope that they are someday forced to remove the word "Resort" from their title. "Resort" is a word that invokes feelings of class and prestige, which is ironic because class and prestige are words that will never come to mind when I think back upon my stay. Upon arrival, we (my girlfriend and I) checked into the hotel just a stroke before midnight, and were informed that we had already been checked in. We both exchanged a few words of confusion, which I'll just assume the front desk employee didn't pick up on, and were handed keys and shown a map of where we were to park. The hotel is spread out over a sizable area, with a portion of the rooms being in a 10-story or so tower-like building and the rest of them being in what I can only describe as trailers. Not trailers like the on-wheels kind of trailers, I mean trailer park trailers. If a trailer park and an apartment complex had an illegitimate child, it would probably be called the Town and Country Resort. We ended up driving for 20-30 minutes searching for parking, as the parking situation is best described by the words "pure idiocy" and "moronic". The vast majority of the "streets" around the "resort" are practically one lane, leading to plenty of drawn out and awkward scenarios where you'll be maneuvering around another poor soul's car. Each set of trailers has it's own parking lot, only fitting about 20 cars or so, which is far too few. Around the corner is a two-story parking structure (one lane) and with a bafflingly low 6-foot clearance. In our search for a parking spot, we drove around the cramped structure only to reach the abrupt end of it, which is just a wall, so getting out of the structure (one lane, still) involves having to make your car shuffle into the opposite direction to leave, while hoping no one is coming in the opposite direction. We finally found parking in the back lot, which is much larger but has tiny parking spots and, again, narrow lanes to navigate. We got out of the car and spent 5-10 minutes walking back to our trailer style room, slid the key into the door, opened the door, and were greeted with a room with luggage and clothes strewn about, as it was already inhabited. We left and made management aware, who offered us another trailer room, which we dutifully declined, already angry that it was now pushing midnight and we just spent 20 minutes looking for parking just to turn right back around. Skipping all of the issues between, we were eventually moved to a room in the tower style building. Like the rest of the hotel, the room is disastrously dated. Don't let the photos online fool you, I am scrolling through their provided room photos now and none of them match the room we were in, which I'm assuming was a step-up from the trailer style room. The bathroom is small and the floor is made of dirty tiles, and (my favorite part) the shower head is about 5'5", so I spent a great deal of time trying to kneel down beneath it. I just grit my teeth and pushed through this problem though, as I knew that the quicker I got showered and dressed, the quicker we could leave this horrid place. I would not suggest this hotel to anyone, not even my worst enemy. I've stayed at plenty of hotels that looked cheap or dated on the outside, but had those stays redeemed by passable room interior- this was not the case. This is more or less a glorified motel/trailer park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds BUT...”
Reviews.Author: llussier1
Reviews.Content: This was a â€œTop Secret Hotelâ€� deal so unfortunately we were not able to read the reviews until we had already booked. Parking is indeed a joke. After 15 min circling the lot, we finally found a spot at the other end of the property and had to walk all the way back to the room. They also CHARGE DAILY for this parking, which is ridiculous. The room smelled musty/moldy, the bed was hard as a rock, and the pillows were the plastic hospital variety. The blanket on the bed was also covered with someone elseâ€™s hair. The TV was small and old, the ice machine was broken, and the coffee in the room wasnâ€™t refilled. The staff also acts like they are doing you a favor by checking you in/out. Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dated, pricey, don't leave anything in your room!”
Reviews.Author: LASTrafzer
Reviews.Content: If there's one thing that stands out about this hotel, in my mind, it's the dated decor (circa 1980), a loud burgundy and blue floral that is repeated throughout the hotel. And in every room there is a large and CREEPY picture of a young girl in 18th c. dress that seems to watch your every move. Who thought THAT was a good idea? Did someone get a discount on prints of ugly child pictures??? The entire resort needs an overhaul, especially given the price for the rooms and services. It's not unusual to be nickel-and-dimed to death in hotels, but this hotel is charging top prices for a hotel that's one advantage is its location: in Mission Valley, close to Interstate 8 and Fashion Valley Shopping Center, and minutes from the ocean, downtown San Diego, and Balboa Park. Aside from location, Town and Country "Resort" Hotel can't compete with other similar properties. It doesn't help that the staff is uncooperative and sometimes out and out rude. We come to this hotel annually for a convention (it's the ONLY reason I would stay here). One year, the hotel staff caused the convention to come to a stand-still by forcing participants to move out of their rooms immediately despite earlier approval of an extended check-out time. They literally threatened to go into the rooms and remove all items, placing them in the hallway or outdoor pathways. Again, this was after approving a late check out time. One year we left, and within minutes realized we had left an item in the room. We called immediately and was told Reception would have to check with Housekeeping. Subsequent calls were treated with shortness and simple "Nothing was found." This was truly one of the rudest Reception desks I've interacted with, at least in half the interactions I had with Reception employees. This hotel always seems busy. Some of the money coming in from higher rates and extra fees really needs to go back into the rooms and grounds. Planting rose bushes everywhere may make the grounds pretty, but it doesn't mask peeling paint, dated decor, and bathrooms that need a replacement of tubs/toilets/tiles etc. You can only pile on grout and sticky sealants so many times before it looks really tacky. If you are staying here by choice, rethink it. There are better values and better rooms in the same vicinity. If you are here for a conference, just be sure you don't leave anything behind and deal very frankly and firmly with the staff. It might keep your experience from disaster.

Reviews.Title: “worst place to stay in san diego”
Reviews.Author: newyorker56789
Reviews.Content: This is the first negative review i ever had to write. I stayed at town and country resort for ILCA conference. The first room they gave me had a strong smell of pee and old carpet and mildew. I had a hard time breathing, and called the front desk asking to move me. The had me on hold for 10 minutes, because they were busy. The room they moved me to was on the second floor and was less stinky, but it still stank of old carpet. The rooms are sooo tiny, i haven't seen such tiny rooms since i stayed in an inexpensive hotel in center of Paris. The furniture is very old. The TV was antique(maybe they tried to match the furniture). The blanket had a hole and a large dirty stain. The decor is very busy, and makes you dizzy, especially because the room is so small. The housekeeping wasn't great, but i brought it to manager's attention.Overall, you feel like you are in a 1 star motel. The grounds are large, and there are many rose bushes and beautiful trees. But i give this property 1 star for horrible rooms, lack of good housekeeping and snobish staff.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: mexicolindo2007
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at this hotel for a company convention. The cottage size room was very small and dated. The carpet was so dirty and the room had an overall bad smell. Finding parking next to our room was next to impossible. We had to walk about 10-12 minutes to reach our room. On the plus side, the poolside restaurant was pretty good and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good service”
Reviews.Author: Sky_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country during Comic-Con this year. I was there for a number of reasons - some business, some relaxation. I found the best rate in the area at Town and Country, and found it to be well worth the money spent. Despite the insanity of Comic-Con week, I found the staff to be friendly, helpful, and they delivered on their promises. Everyone smiled, and virtually all staff - from maintenance workers and front desk staff to maids, were friendly and accomodating. The property is a bit dated, and the rooms can do with some updating (old televisions, small bathrooms, dated interior design), but overall I found the experience to be well worth the money I paid. I liked the pools onsite, and the rose bushes, palm trees, and other plant life does give it a resort vibe. The property is spread out, but once you figure out where things are it's easy to get around. Town and Country is located on Hotel Circle, meaning it's about a 20 minute cab ride to downtown. There are plenty of transportation options available, though. This is a three star property that offers good value and service. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again in the future. I had other family members who also stayed at Town and Country and they enjoyed their stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved and will be back.”
Reviews.Author: humphry44
Reviews.Content: My sister, Linda Nimitz and her grand-daughter, Paris were in need of a personal vacation. I met with Ms Robin Davis, the person most responsible for my Rotary Club's weekly meeting at the Town & Country's Trellises Restaurant. She helped greatly in setting up a five day stay in a beautiful room, adjacent to the beautiful pool and wonderful restaurant. The resort is so centrally located that nearly anything in San Diego (downtown, beaches, oldtown, malls, trolly & bus stations, etc.) can be reached in fifteen minutes, or less. My sister and her grand-daughter had a wonderful stay and thanks to the T&C staff, the whole week was something they will always have fond memories. My sister told me she can't wait to get back to san Diego and will certainly stay at the Town & Country Resort. Thank you Robin and staff for a wonderful week and the perfect weather. James H. Kline, brother

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's gem!”
Reviews.Author: seajay11
Reviews.Content: We went here for a family vacation on the way to SeaWorld(which is just down the street. The place was huge, and fantastic! 4 pools one outside our door. They have several onsite resturants. We ate at Kellys and the food was excellent and the waitress was amazing! The rooms were small but quaint. We had a problem with a loud neighbor and security came right away and shut him up! On the night we came (saturday) they had a movie on the lawn for the kids with free popcorn, blankets and lots of snacks at a great price. The grounds were beautiful, 365 rose bushes, the place was great forme and my husband and for our sons who are 9 and 16. IThe rates were the lowest in town and theMGR even gave us a discount for our trouble with the neighbor. I loved it and want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible front desk service, totally un-informed staff, and rude”
Reviews.Author: Wendywooaz
Reviews.Content: Ugh, what a horrible surprise to arrive at your hotel that you booked 4 months in advanced only to find that they messed up your reservation and are unwilling and unable to fix it. The front desk staff was so unhelpful in regards to this huge booking snafu, that we had to turn around and stay at the Marriott Courtyard in Hotel Circle at the last minute. You would think that due to the competition in hotel circle the staff at town and country would try a little harder. But they don't. If you plan on just sleeping here, you might be ok. But if you need any kind of special service, this is NOT the right place. Staff is uniformed and untrained of how to handle unique guest situations and will be sure to disappoint you if you need any help from them. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we WILL be back!”
Reviews.Author: Michellesmom24
Reviews.Content: I would write the pros and cons of staying at this hotel, but there was nothing negative the entire stay (4 nights). The hotel is beautiful, the room was lovely and very clean. The maid service was even good. Our room was right next to one of the pools but was very quiet. The restaurants are good, the staff very friendly and helpful. Also, the parking was very close to the room. Like I said, it was all good, which is really rare for me. A special thank you to Robin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Conventions”
Reviews.Author: Patti099
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for conventions or vacation. The grounds are beautiful, roses everywhere. There are a variety of rooms to choose from and a huge complex. Convenient location, but make sure you have a GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Management turned it around for us and made it right”
Reviews.Author: Karen48372
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the hotel for several days with my family to attend the conference. When making reservations, I had called and a very pleasant, helpful woman helped me to choose the type of room for our stay. Upon check in, I found that the receptionist was not warm or friendly but rather short and unempathetic about the type of room we requested being unavailable (there are no guarantees). Our initial room was in a two story building above where the staff ate and socialized and was not well kept. Perhaps at some point in time the staff they lived on the grounds in that building. After such a disheartened experience I read on trip advisor the responses to the varying reviews and contacted Susanna Weber directly. We were moved to a Garden Room and the experience was wonderful! Main pool is really warm which is great for kids, other two are a bit cooler for those who don't like it too warm. The grounds are also beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Katie Wingo provided EXCELLENT Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: ThankY0uJeeves
Reviews.Content: This is our first time staying at Town and Ciuntry, and we were extremely impressed with Katie's friendliness, efficiency, and customer focused service!! I'm sure we will be repeat guests now ^_~.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl08079
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice rooms and beautiful grounds, however, it is extremely overpriced, there is additional charges for EVERYTHING, and when you have to PAY $14 per day for parking and they have an event happening and those people only have to pay $10 to park in YOUR spot is ridiculous. It took us over an hour to get into our parking lot and then there were no parking spots for us because of the even and we had to park far away from our room while having to handle two six month old babies. The staff are inconsiderate and are not nice. Every time we tried asking a question we were either ignored and or given attitude. I would not recommend this hotel at all. You would be better off at the Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “A bit quirky but admirably efficient for a business meeting”
Reviews.Author: travelwriterBoston
Reviews.Content: This place is a bit odd on first arrival, a conglomeration of buildings varying from rose garden cottages to 1960s style high rise in concrete. Rooms could use some major updates. However, numerous swimming pools and a convention center onsite make it a great destination for conferences and families. While it doesn't exude the atmosphere of a luxury resort it is difficult to fault anything specific and it certainly serves its purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PROPERTY AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: jmt3
Reviews.Content: I recently organized a meeting of the board of directors of a small non profit group. I contacted Town and Country who then provided rooms, a meeting facility, and golf reservations. My groups plans changed repeatedly but the staff dealt cheerfully with each change and made the whole weekend a seamless affair. The grounds of the resort are beautiful--mature tropical vegetation and flowers everywhere. The pool area and retaurants arre lovely. The participants really ejoyed tho eir tower rooms. The meetingt rooms are light , airy , and well stocked. I would recommend this resort to business travelers, organizations, and families.

Reviews.Title: “Poorest Customer Service I Have Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: Graham3025
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, as a manager you have one job, take care of customer issues. This place had no concern for the guest. Out of the 8 rooms booked, 5 had issues with the type of room. Non smoking put in really bad smoking rooms. When we confronted the manager, we were greeted with, "that's a request, not a guarantee.". Poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated decor, dirty bathroom, young/inexperienced staff at registration desk.”
Reviews.Author: SammiKat
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at this hotel. Our first encounter was at the front desk checking in. We were appalled to notice in plain sight (at the check-in counter) a 16-page document detailing names of hotel guests along with their room numbers and parking locations! When we let the staff know, she picked up the document and proceeded to move it to a different part of the counter (still in plain view). We finally had to ask her to remove it as it contains confidential information (!) Our room was outdated, with a tiny bathroom that contains a chipped tub, dirty caulking, and rusty toilet. The TV is old and has poor reception. $10/day charge for WiFi. The pool area is small and fenced in (think apartment complex swimming pool) which made it uninviting Not at all the "resort" it claims to be.

Reviews.Title: “The resort has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: gb333
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Town & Country Resort many times since the 1990â€™s for our annual Soo Bahk Do national tournament. In the past, my hotel experience was very pleasant and enjoyable. The front desk staff honored my 12 pm arrival and accommodated my request for late check out. It was much appreciated. However, during my last several stays, I've noticed the level of service, food quality and room decor deteriorate. I agree with other reviewers that the rooms are outdated and in need of renovation. I always stay in a Tower room (which was very clean). However, the king size bed and pillows were uncomfortable and the bedding old and worn. The TV, which is not a flat screen, had horrible reception. My first night there I ordered room service (Chicken tacos). The dinner arrived cold and didn't include the rice and guacamole as indicated on the menu. I called room service and was told that they were out of rice and guacamole. Really? How can that be and if so, why didn't they call to let me know so that I could have chosen another meal? I asked for a discount on the dinner and was told that they couldn't accommodate that request. They offered to send me soup or dessert free of charge. I chose a cheese cake, which wasn't very good. I would have preferred the discount. The food of the breakfast buffet for each four mornings that I ate there to be lukewarm. Aren't there food temperature laws in California? The selection wasn't as good as in previous years. Also, there was no toaster available to toast the bagels, etc. How about bringing back the toaster as part of the breakfast buffet? The coffee, supposedly Starbucks, was absolutely watery. The Sunshine Deli, with its friendly staff, had a good selection of cold salads, but the lettuce wasn't as fresh as it could be. For the prices charged, the food quality and coffee served there should be better. The first night (Wednesday) of my stay Charlie's was closed. Why?? We went to Kelly's for a drink and found the bartender and staff friendly and the drinks and appetizers good. However, the restaurant was really like stepping back into the 1960's. With a little bit of upgrading, it could be a great place instead of appearing old and sad. You can't exactly attract a younger crowd of people with that ambience. On Saturday night, our convention group went to Charlieâ€™s to celebrate. They tried to close the place at midnight despite that fact that we have a contract which that stated that they are to stay open until 2 am. We had to produce the actual contract to get them to stay open. Even then, there was some grumbling by the staff about having to stay open for a handful of people. We tried to order food before midnight and was told that they kitchen was closed. A group of us had to order delivery pizza to get food at that hour. Poor business. At least have the staff let its customers know that the kitchen is about to close. The general atmosphere at Charlieâ€™s is not friendly. As in the past, the grounds are beautiful and well maintained and the pools are clean. The Spa is excellent. It wouldnâ€™t take much to have the Town and Country Resort a four star accommodation rather than a three star. It is the little things that make or break a hotel. Some attention to detail is needed to make it the great place that it deserves to be.

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: dmello10
Reviews.Content: great time nice rooms fair rates the food was excellent and the kids loved the pool and free saturday night movie highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalDiner
Reviews.Content: Our breakfast at the Trellises restaurant recently was quite pleasant. The atmosphere was serene, the food was very good --- one family member praised the Eggs Benedict --- and the service by Pati Muklvicz was attentive and pleasant. The Trellises is our favorite breakfast spot in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel with some of that old school charm”
Reviews.Author: seldridge
Reviews.Content: Love staying at this hotel. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Patti Muklevilz was very nice and coming in from a stressful flight and travel in general she made me feel right at home. Kuddos to the management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion made awesome”
Reviews.Author: ylomello
Reviews.Content: We planned a surprise family reunion for my mother this past 4th of July weekend. Our group had 42 people attend, though not all stayed. We did have 14 rooms booked, including a suite as our gathering spot. From the moment we checked in, until we checked out, the service at this facility was flawless. The hotel even showed a movie for all guests out on the lawn, including popcorn. They have the BEST orange juice at the restaurant by the pool. I have never had OJ this good. The hotel is so conveniently located with a large mall behind it and the trolly to take you all over San Diego. We had the best time! Thank you town and country. I'll be sure to stay here again when I visit from Indiana.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel.................................”
Reviews.Author: ja_jacquez
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great service, the rose gardens are beautiful, the restaurants are very good and customer service is very good too. We'll definitely stay here again and I highly recommed the hotel

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Aohot
Reviews.Content: I'm currently at the hotel. The venue I am attending is here and supposedly we have discount rates. Found cheaper rates on the hotel web site. But no matter. I arrived about 3p today and was 2nd in line. Only one desk person and she was fairly grumpy. Within 15 minutes the line was 10 deep. No one else came to help nor did she call anyone. Sherida was oblivious to the folks irritation. Beware they charge $10/per device for each 24hrs!! Found several white little bugs on my bed after removing a soil comforter . Glasses needed washing. Room way too small for 2adults and one teen. Next time we're staying at the Best Western. Less money, friendly staff, affordable meals and well appointed rooms

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: shannenavila
Reviews.Content: The highlight of this hotel are the amazing grounds. It looks like a beautiful bed and breakfast on a large scale. There are roses, lush green plants, gorgeous trees, lovely pools, etc. The rooms are a bit dated, but who spends a lot of time in the rooms when you are in San Diego? The location is excellent. You are about 5 minutes from old town, Little Italy, Mission Beach, etc.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY but...not worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: kyene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Palm. It's a nice place, the people are nice too but the money spent is not worth it. The facilities are old, you have to pay for internet and parking. On the lighter side, you can just walk to the mall across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: marcandjess
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a very nice experience from beginning to end. The staff was courteous, warm, and inviting. We enjoyed our time here and can't wait to come back! One of the best places on the property is Charlie's Resturaunt. We enjoyed their food and the company of the staff. We want to give a special thanks to Gonzo, our bartender, for making us feel welcome and right at home even though we were thousands of miles away! The property was beautiful and full of fresh flowers. The pool was nice, too. Thanks to everyone for making our stay a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary a No-Go”
Reviews.Author: Ir0nb0y
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not honor their reservations, period. The receptionist first tried overcharging me for a room that didn't exist by about $40 and then said that the only room available had a sofa sleeper (no bed) and then I would have to wait 1 hour just to see if that "deal" materialized. Needless to say my anniversary was ruined, thankfully I didn't fly in, so I drove the 2 hours home to where my mother-in-law lives (yes, anniversary was totally ruined). If you are traveling long distance, please make sure you check in as early as possible before they hand your room over to someone just coming off the street. I definitely will not use this hotel again for any long-range plans.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory, Needs Some TLC and Attitude Adjustment at Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Treadaway
Reviews.Content: This was my third time in four years attending a conference here. There are many pros: great location near everything; an upscale mall and light rail both a 5-minute walk away; beautiful landscaping and rose gardens; free USA Today; a nice workout facility with a variety of equipment. The cons are that the infrastructure is showing signs of age, such as cracked sidewalks; tired, cramped bathrooms; inattention to exterior cleanliness (unswept sidewalks, steps, and driveways); room carpet coffee-stained; bathroom sink that did not drain properly and was not fiixed after it was reported; wifi that worked only about 25% of the time, and tech support is a call to Texas; daily charges for that wifi as well as for the gym; and snippy front desk clerks. I understand that their job is tough, but people should not be hired to work at the front desk if they are impatient and unwilling to deal with difficult people. Note to front desk clerks: Try looking people in the eye and smiling, acknowledging that they are (a) human beings, and (b) customers, without whom you would not have a job.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but you might get lost”
Reviews.Author: labdaddy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and was fairly pleased. The property is enormous, so I kept getting lost, which I don't normally do. The staff was pleasant except for one incident at a bar/restaurant where the waitress kept forgetting us and then gave us a bill with extra things that we didn't eat. The grounds are stunningly beautiful, everything was green and in bloom when I was there, you can tell they work hard at it. The rooms are comfortable but nothing extraordinary; they are showing a bit of age (I was in several). Three of the rooms (different buildings) did not have refrigerators, the suite did. Internet access was wireless, but lagged at times. It was difficult to get a cell phone signal in my room, it was courtyard-facing and blocked by buildings all around. An added bonus, the Fashion Valley Mall is an easy walk over a dedicated footbridge and they had several good places to eat if hotel food is not your thing. Swimming pools (at least three) looked great, but I didn't get a chance to try them out. If I came to San Diego again, I would definitely consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Mikicr
Reviews.Content: Loved almost everything about this place. The only criticism that I have is breakfast at the cafe was too expensive and not very good. But Charlie's (pub/food) was great. Nate (the waitress) was phenomenal! This was my first time in San Diego and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's good comfortable to get a rest”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Je
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cozy and comfortable to get a rest. In July, the weather is good and i could get the swimming in a pool. And near the hotel, there are Fashion Valley and MTS station. Then you can get a variety of food in the Fashion valley if you don't satisfy the meal at the hotel. Additionally, public transportation gave me easy to access downtown and Balboa park. When I was visited there i could refresh my mind. Even I went to there as a business trip, I wanna go there again with my family. I hope you also make a good memory over there.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING FACILITY AND STAFF”
Reviews.Author: ERINLAW
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in San Diego several times in the past. The Town and Country, in every way, has been exceptional, beyond the ordinary, with beautiful grounds, good sized, clean and modern rooms, excellent restaurants (from Kelly's Steak House to breakfast and lunch venues as well) and a staff that is outstanding. Not only is the staff helpful, they are professional, know their hotel, and facilities and have a genuine interest in caring for their customers. In particular, Sherida Green, the shift manager answered every question, provided helpful suggestions, knew her property and her staff. Johanna Nunez, the booking agent was prompt, courteous, thoughtful and helpful and offered to show us rooms before we checked in. Every detail was considered. Aaron Zuniga, went out of his way to show us various rooms and the advantages and disadvantages of various rooms and locations on the sprawling property. Waitresses in the restaurants, including Pati Mukzevicti, went out of their way to suggest menu items and provide excellent service. The price, for all the services and the outstanding facility was reasonable and the facility is certainly family friendly. The Best That San Diego Has To Offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay great service”
Reviews.Author: WhateverCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the TC for three days and the service was great. The room was quiet had a great view of the well kept hotel grounds. What really made the stay was the staff. I went to Charlieâ€™s, the property sports bar, and had a great time. The bartenders, Keith and Gonzo were great, as were the waitresses Chris and Heather. I had a good dinner there and the calamari wrap was excellent. Breakfast at Trellisesâ€™ was also excellent, pricey, but the service from Angelica was second to none. Dinner there was not that great. I purchased a necklace for my wife at the gift shop, Hazelwoodâ€™s, and once again the service was exceptional. Rosie did a great job of packaging and gift wrapping it for me. Over all the service was great, and that made my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: HoppyGirl
Reviews.Content: Booked a "garden room with patio or balcony" a couple months in advance. Given a 1970's motel room with a view of a wall. The wall did have some ivy growing on it. Nickel and dimed every time you turned around.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but, one very rude front desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: CSmitthRN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel because my company made arrangements for an excellent conference. I enjoyed my stay very much. I stayed in the Royal Palm Tower. It was a spacious room with a very comfortable king size poster bed. The bathroom was ample but had an extra sink and vanity area to dress after bathing. Tile/wood/carpet flooring No stains. No odors. Very clean. Housekeeping very polite and clean the room perfectly. I had a beautiful view of the pool and jacuzzi area. Lighting on the buildings and the beautiful roses, flowers, palms,and landscaping made my balcony view breathtaking. Meals at Trellises were wonderful. I ate there almost everyday for under $13.00. Excellent service. Angelica and Patricia were especially nice waitresses at the restaurant. I hope Town and Country is aware how these two ladies bring enjoyment to the dining experience. I can not say enough kind words about these two people. "Bless both of you" The shops on the hotel site are nice. A bit pricey. Personel staffing shop were terrific too. Conference room was good. Good lighting. Audio and slides were effective and conducive to learning. Snacks and beverages were delicious. Staff was very quiet setting up the tables. No distractions from staff while listening to speakers or lectures etc.. Only disappointment was arriving the night before conference on Sunday, June 5th, 2011 was the young man at the front desk. There was a mix up with billing and he basically told us we had to do what he said or find elsewhere to stay. He also stated we were taking too much time and needed to hurry up. We were an inconvenience to him. VERY RUDE FRONT DESK CLERK!! The Manager stood at far end of desk and did not assist us and allowed this young man to speak to us in a very inappropriate way.Needless to say, our company sorted all the discrepancies and I never had to interact with that young man again. Check out was fine Staff polite and professional. I would stay again and perhaps might do so this summer for leisure. Hotel close to local transportation, high end mall, and nice eateries outside hotel resort .

Reviews.Title: “It was great............in 1965”
Reviews.Author: Goldtress
Reviews.Content: I imagine in 1965 this was the place to stay, but in 2011 not so much. There is a multi-story building and also many bungalows. We were there for a convention and the first night we stayed in the multi-story building. While they claimed it was newly remodeled it didn't look it. The carpet was 80's Dodger blue with blue floral bedspreads on a low, very flat mattress. It was pretty clean except for the random hairs on the bathroom floor. The biggest problem is the old sliding glass doors that would not close completely. This allowed for noise and cigarette smoke to come into our room. Not at all pleasant. After an uncomfortable first night we moved our room to the bungalows which were a big improvement. The room, although still had the ugly blue carpet, it did have a better bed and more attractive furnishings. The grounds are also nicer and most importantly, quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: bfi_h_c
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention and it was very comfortable. Located in Hotel Circle, there are two types of accommodations: those rooms whose door face the hallway and one that face the street (like a standard motel). I stayed at the latter type of room. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were kept clean. There are rooms that are suites, but when I stayed there, our business used these suites as meeting rooms. There are several places to eat on the property. I tried the steak house and it was very good. Overall, this was a good hotel to stay at. The staff was very friendly and it's good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: KPE317
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a weekend trip to the T&C, and like usual everything was great. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly front desk agent. We were quickly checked in and while we were checking in I had some questions about the San Diego marathon, they were more than willing to assist us with every question we had. The grounds were awesome, we would spend our mornings and nights lounging in the pool or in the courtyard relaxing to the sounds and smells you experience here. We ate at the steakhouse, the service and food was good. I spent a couple of nights in the sports bar, cold beer and the bartendar and chicken wings were great. The location was perfect, we utilized the trolley, as well as the easy access via highway to beaches and downtown. Everynight was a great nights sleep, the rooms were nice. Anytime I am in SD I stay at the T&C.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledgirlus
Reviews.Content: Rude people in every department from sales (promised things he didnt deiver) to Trellises manager. Ghetto. Disgusting filthy rooms (roaches), tasteless food, outdated decor, uncomfortable beds with scratchy bedspreads, ugly flowered patterns everywhere you turn, musty smell, loud noise outside and paper thin walls. Should I go on? Overpriced rooms, charges for net, gym, fridge, food should be free for the horrible quality. Seriously would rather sleep on the street than stay here again. This place will not survive much longer without a few million to tear it down and rebuild. Oh and, dont let them fool you into thinking you will get a flat screen tv in your room. They are very deceptive.

Reviews.Title: “What a georgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: thedom1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at the Town and Country Hotel last weekend. The Grounds are impeccably maintained with the most beautiful roses you will ever see in one place. The Food and service at Trellises steak house was outstanding. Robin's staff was on top of their game and every detail to attention was there. The beds were very comfy and rooms spacious. Breakfast at the Pool cafe was very good and service was prompt. Hope you enjoyed it like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Partly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: STLCardinalFan
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are spectacular. When you first arrive, you honestly feel as though you're arriving at an upscale, 4 star resort. However, the workers at the front desk quickly dispel those thoughts. They are rude and very unhelpful They behaved as though they were doing me a favor to let me spend my $125 per night there. Then, they informed me that the room I booked was not available, and that it was a "first come, first served" basis on the rooms. Believe me, that was not stated up front. Anyhow, the room I checked in to was dated with 1970's Queen Anne style furnishings, complete with a little 25" square TV. The carpet is royal blue, and there were enough stains on it to make me believe it had once served as an oil change shop. I will say, though, that the rooms were clean. I promptly asked to be moved to a balcony room, which became available the second day of our stay (2 of 5 nights). My teenage son loved the heated pool, and the meeting rooms were very nice. So, overall...the grounds and the meeting space was great. The rooms are terribly outdated, and the customer service sucked. The location of the hotel is very good, and very convenient to the mall, restaurants, and the Trolley.

Reviews.Title: “More beautiful on the outside than inside”
Reviews.Author: wanderinggreek
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Town and Country Resort. We were placed in a garden room facing the parking lot. The room itself was small, the bathroom miniscule. There was hardly enough room to put your toothbrush on the bathroom counter. The corner of the countertop dug into my back everytime I used the commode and I am a petite woman! The room did have a small table outside the bathroom to use for your toiletries. That was the first issue we had with the room. The second issue was lighting. The room was very dark, it had one lamp on the nightstand, a small overhead light over the table and a candelabra style fixture mounted on the wall near the bathroom. The sheers could not be opened, making the room even darker. I could not do any work in the room due to the low level of lighting. I would have to sit on the doorstep, with the door open to be able to see my work. The third issue was the in room internet which we paid extra for its use. The connection was painfully slow and many pages would not load. The decor of the rooms is very dated. The carpeting was a dark blue and the bedspreads a loud floral. The hotel did have its pluses. The grounds are stunningly beautiful with thousands of flowering rose bushes and plants. It was a pleasure to take walks every morning on the property. The pool areas were attractive and well maintained, We enjoyed being able to sleep with our windows open and loved the cool weather San Diego was experiencing during our visit. Within a five minute walk is a very large mall with a food court and sit down restaurants. San Diego's light rail system is also located at the mall and is easy to use. We took the trolley to Old Town for $5 round trip. The hotel could really use a major overhaul of its decor, keeping in mind that they are a conference center and should address the issues that may prevent guests from performing work tasks in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awful and outdated...be prepared to step back in time”
Reviews.Author: Kzootravel
Reviews.Content: I don't use the term "dump" lightly. This place has many different buildings...good luck if you get stuck in one of the older ones. If you are under 55 and travel at all, you will be disappointed. Some of the words I'd use are old, tired, outdated, unkept and in major need of an overhaul. Who charges extra these days for things like wifi and the gym??? Only places that are in danger of going belly up is the answer.

Reviews.Title: “The place is old and creepy.”
Reviews.Author: Menglyk
Reviews.Content: Like scene from a 70s flix. Kinda creepy if you stay alone. The art on the wall with the girl is trippy.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: YorktownBob
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again even for a conference. The food on property is very low quality and expensive. We asked about local restaurants and nobody seemed to know where any were located. Our last night in the area we found a shopping area with numerous restaurants about 1.5 miles away. I really can't believe no one at the hotel knew about that area. As far as the rooms, they are reminescent of a failed motel--old furniture, woren fabric, and uncomfortable beds. The service was average to below average.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Peedee12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a meeting in May and enjoyed it immensely. The hotel staff was outstanding especially our breakfast waitress, Angelica Stephens, at the Trellis restaurant located on site. She was one of the best servers I've ever had. Cheerful and attentive, she was a joy to see every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Virgil00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at T&C over the weekend and fully enjoyed our stay here. The grounds were beautiful and clean. Yeah, the rooms might have been dated but we really enjoyed them. It would have been nice if the rooms had refrigerators in them and also more room in the bathrooms. They also made us pay for Wi-Fi, parking and the Gym. I am thinking that some of this should have come with the Room, seeing that we paid a lot of money for it. What would have been great is if they included Continental Breakfast also. Just some of the things that would have been the icing on the cake. We were in the one story rooms/Bungelows. We loved the atmosphere. The flowers and chairs/benches/tables all over the place. The plants were green, lush and beautiful. The pools were awesome, they had three of them. The convention center was big and nice and modern. Perfect for company conventions. The gym was actually well equipped and very nice. The only bummer is that we had to pay for it. All in all, it was a wonderful experience. Would have been really nice if it had some of the suggestions mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “A PROPERTY WITH LOTS OF CHARACTER”
Reviews.Author: trchocolatediva
Reviews.Content: These days, all hotels are starting to look alike, so it was quite refreshing to stay at the Town & Country in San Diego. The rooms are a bit dated, but comfortable; and the grounds are quaint with a rose garden not to be believed. The staff is attentive, particularly our bell boy, Adrian Zuniga. He went above and beyond for such a young pup! I am looking forward to returning for some old fashion hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: clutterstop
Reviews.Content: The Trellises Restaurant would be just another restaurant were it not for Angelica Stephens. She made you feel like you had come into her home and she was preparing a special meal for you. Whatever you wanted, needed, or desired was her pleasure to get for you. One of my colleagues just wanted coffee because she was in a hurry, and Angelica brought her coffee in a "go" cup, complete with sugar and cream to put in, if desired. My colleague had not asked for the go cup and was delighted that she could drink it on the fly. Whatever you do at Town and Country, stop in at Trellises and find Angelica. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Would only stay here again if coming to a conference at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: f8wins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 2nd time (because of a conference) and it's convenient because my conference is here and it's right across from the mall, but I would not stay here otherwise. It's not terrible but it's not worth the price. I stayed in the tower (closest building to the convention hall and the mall). THE PROS: -Very nice balcony overlooking the pool. -Beautifully landscaped grounds with roses, lush green lawns, and climbing vines - At least 2 pools with comfortable looking lounges and a large jacuzzi. -Several (average quality) restaurants on the grounds. -Good water pressure in shower -next to the mall -freeway close & central location (between beaches and downtown) -Have a "green" program so change towels if on ground & sheets if leave card on bed THE CONS: -The room is very dated, with no fridge/mini bar or microwave -Furniture is worn/chipped/scratched/stained -Pillows are uncomfortable - flat and hard. -Thin walls and construction going on in a room 4 floors below me in the afternoon sounded as if it were coming from right next door. Also they did not mention that this would be going on during my stay and completely ruined any chance of afternoon naps, reading, or any quiet activity in the room. -They nickel and dime you to death (internet $10, gym $5, parking $14, check out earlier than initial check out date after you check in and you have to pay for a FULL night - even if it's with 6 days notice, .50 per local call) - apparently you can get a "bundle discount" for internet, parking, and gym but they don't mention it when you check in. -Room smelled like smoke -Shower head only good for short people (luckily I'm short but for anyone over 5'3" it could be a definite negative) -Phone was old and had bad reception (even for local calls) The hotel is fine if you have a conference on the grounds here - if not DEFINITELY stay somewhere else where you will get more quality and some of your basic amenities included!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you got money to burn”
Reviews.Author: groves_six
Reviews.Content: Good: hot water, nice flowers, most of staff is friendly and helpful. Bad: dated room decor, Wifi, parking, gym extra. No refer in room. Constant noise hammering and sawing all day. Trying to get out of parking lot is a joke. Complained to manager but no help. If I had read online reviews, I would not have come.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Stryker743
Reviews.Content: The service at the check-in was superb. Johanna Nunez was extremely courteous and assisted us with getting a nice room in a good location. Parking was readily available, and the room was very well appointed and spotless. The service in Charlies was excellent, the room service was quick, and well prepared. Very nice low key resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...bad beds!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrikaka
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a pretty good time. With the exceptions of a few things. The first night we were woken up by people next door that were partying then soon turned to fighting between the hours of 2 am-4 am. The hotel staff were very accommodating and we moved rooms the next stay. The beds were not that comfortable and need to be replaced. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! Wonderful service, ammenities, & convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: SicilianaDLG
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful. We like the rooms and the location in Mission Valley is perfect for accessing things all over San Diego. We come here often and have a great experience each time!

Reviews.Title: “Service needs to match the product”
Reviews.Author: KKAAWW
Reviews.Content: The T&C is a beautiful place, with endless detailed attention to botanicals all over the charming property. It would be helpful if the in-room amenities would match that level of commitment. Yes, shower cap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner are appreciated and expected. More than 1/2 teaspoon of fake cream (real would be nice) to go with that in-room coffee; 24 hour access to the laundry room, more horizontal surfaces in the bathroom. Hard to get dressed when everything winds up on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Trellis Restaurant - Town and Country Resort, San Diego CA”
Reviews.Author: Cathysmith2008
Reviews.Content: A little oasis in the middle of the city. Quaint little resort. The staff at all of the many on site restaurants do a great job satisfying my every whim. All greet you with a smile and an Ola. Pati Muklevicz served us this morning at breakfast at the Trellis restaurant. Made it a great start to our morning.

Reviews.Title: “It is 2011 not 1981... it's time to update.”
Reviews.Author: AConferenceAttendee
Reviews.Content: The Good: It was right beside an amazing mall that had 4 anchor stores and every store you would want. Also had The Container Store. Since those are few and far between, that was a big pull. Josie at the Front Desk and EVERY BELL MEN = amazing staff. That was all. I know others had a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE with their check-in and front desk. The conference rooms were big and roomy. The Bad: The room was a bad 1980's dream (I was there I lived through that era). Royal blue carpets, not clean under beds (I always check that) and skimpy on amenities (coffee was hideous). The Ugly: thought most things were dated and for the price we could have stayed at the Mariott and had a modern room. Having only one bartender to serve 100s of conference attendees was RIDICULOUS (that says they were either unprepared or understaffed or both). The price of conference/room only included lunch and a few finger foods at two cocktails, no dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Hotel a great value!”
Reviews.Author: catherine30196
Reviews.Content: Terrific place for a convention. Lots of restaurants on the beautifully manicured property. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. There was no need to leave the resort unless you wanted to see San Diego. My only complaint was the $10 daily charge for wi-fi. A great place to eat is Trellises. Pat Mukzevicz is a fantastic server and knows how to take care of her guests. I highly recommend Town and Country Resort and Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or your money”
Reviews.Author: easilva
Reviews.Content: Oh, where to start. The ONLY redeeming feature of this hotel is the staff. They were attentive and prompt. Otherwise, I would describe this hotel as dated, over-priced (in every respect) and terribly located. To start with, the entire complex seems to have been designed and built some time in the 80s, and from the stains on the carpets and drapes I assume there has been no renovation since (never mind the creepy print of the little girl hanging in the room). This place will also nickel-and-dime you to death. They charge for use of the fitness room, parking (specially DISCOUNTED rate of $8 per day -- usually $16 for guests), and $10 per day for very patchy and painfully slow internet. What is it about the inverse relationship between the rate you pay for a hotel and the likelihood that internet will be included?!?! They have plenty of on-site restaurants that provide service with a smile (again, the only redeeming quality) but you'll end up paying way too much for really mediocre food. The location doesn't help -- it's in a wasteland surrounded by highways. The five nights I spent here were among the most unrestful I've ever had... and I'm into backpacking. To starte, the beds were terribly uncomfortable. Every night some time between 1 and 2am we were disturbed by loud conversations from people returning to their rooms; it seems to me that a complex like this should really have a designated quiet hour. Bottom line: the management of this place is incredibly negligent. Save your money and go to a Days Inn -- it'll be just as clean (and maybe cleaner), the food will be better and you'll probably have parking and internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service and location!”
Reviews.Author: jenisej
Reviews.Content: It has been a really, really long time since I have stayed at a hotel with this type of customer service. The concierges, Antonio and Jill, were great at helping me book a tour for my free time and even helped check me in for my boarding pass when I was unavailable to do so myself. The location is great, you can walk across the street to Fashion Valley mall, its close to the Airport and Old Town. The bell staff can run you to closeby locations, such as Old Town, when available, depending upon what else is going on. I ate at the onsite restaurant twice (I think it is named Charlies) and found the food reasonably priced. The rooms are adequate and clean. They are missing some amenities you might find elsewhere, such as a mini-fridge or microwave, but in San Diego, you are not in the room much anyway. I found their customer service to be so superior, their hotel would be my first choice for another trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “As always, had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasBaseball
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy staying at Town & Country. Has all the amenities and within proximity to all the areas we visit. Would like to be able to bring my small dog.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Needs Updated”
Reviews.Author: pamd30
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip in March for a conference on the resort â€“ the grounds were beautiful and kept very clean. The pool (heated!) and hot tub areas were large and well equipped with towels and sitting areas, which were also kept tidy and clean. The room itself was OK, but should really be updated. There were odd paintings of ducks in the room, an old navy blue carpet, and very odd bathroom doors that slid open like a closet door. The beds were not very comfortable and the air conditioner would not cool below 70 degrees in the room. The hotel is located next a large outdoor shopping mall, which is very convenient if you need a shopping fix. The train to downtown is right by the resort as well, so you are not far from mass transportation. I would suggest staying here to anyone in the area â€“ although the rooms are outdated and a little chic, the location and amenities are worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust004
Reviews.Content: Room was in a bungalow posh Butlins style. Well layed out in very large open grounds with palm trees everywhere. Very comfortable with well appointed room and all the facilities which business travellers need. Did not like the room as very dark with dark wood furniture and deep blue soft furnishings. Breakfast very enjoyable in the restaurant and staff very accomodating. Would stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Charming resort”
Reviews.Author: DDTSarasota
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 3 night stay at this charming resort in beautiful San Diego. I attended a medical conference here and what a wonderful facility. Everyone was very friendly from check in to check out. I ate breakfast and lunch at the lovely Trellises Restaurant, Pati Muklevioz recommended the wonderful Eggs Benedict for breakfast and for lunch awesome fish tacos, Pati was so friendly and she made me feel comfortable eating alone. The resort had beautiful landscaped grounds, just strolling through the resort grounds was so enjoyable. The guest rooms are a little dated but very clean and comfortable with large flat screen tv. Bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows which I appreciate. Towels were nice and fluffy of good quality. Walked over to the fashion mall which had wonderful department and specialty stores. Overall I would highly recommend the Town and Country Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Time - Great City!”
Reviews.Author: mike2659
Reviews.Content: My trip was planned to spend "quality" time with family and friends in the San Diego Area for a perid of 10 days. From the moment I arrived on site at the Town and Country Resort in Hotel Circle, my experience and contact with the various employees at check-in, parking lot attendees, coffee shop and other areas visited/solicited was nothing less than outstanding. Respectful. Courteous. Smiles. These infectious attributes, coupled with the quality room care and appearance, helped make my stay much more enjoyable. The ground maintenance and overall cleanliness add the glamour to this remarkable hotel. The hotel is conveniently located (walking distance) to two major malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference venue”
Reviews.Author: rkumarael
Reviews.Content: Great place for a conference located in the Hotel Circle area in san Diego located in a several acre sized lot. Several large meeting areas and rooms Good restaurants and a short walk to the Mall in Fashion Valley

Reviews.Title: “The sta ff and facility exceeded all my expectations and the conference we attended seemed perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Janradford2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have maintained leadership roles in many large conferences the past twenty years. I serve in the hospitality industry (for seniors), as does our son. I was particularly awed by the peace of the servers as they waited on us ( over 1,000 attendees) twice daily. Both professionals and volunteers (80% women) who participated in this conference commented on the "cared for feeling" they experienced, the eye contact each waiter made, and the use of the names of those who were served. Mark Yonker "wowed" us daily providing for some unique gifts such as special wines, appetizers and dietary requests. Katherine Westcott-McCarthy assisted with all the details exhibitors and registration managers requested. My husband said he had never relaxed so much at a conference as he did at this one last week. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to have a breakfast meeting.”
Reviews.Author: PhilipTeyssier
Reviews.Content: We had a breakfast meeting with about 10 persons. Service was great and so was the food. Very friendly staff, easy parking. Low key, perfect for a breakfast meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Excellence”
Reviews.Author: frommontana
Reviews.Content: I met Terry Sobkowiak (?) and see told me about some great places to visit that were close since I did not have a vehicle. Even told me about a scrap booking store close by! Service was excellence....needed some extra towels and they were brought right up! Little chilly for pool but I enjoyed it! The grounds are beautiful and very clean! Thanks to Barbara too! Called to say what a great time I had and she was very polite! Next time I come, guest told me to stay at the Kona Kai (?). I guess it is a sister hotel? I enjoyed this so much......it is worth the try there too!

Reviews.Title: “Great conference!!”
Reviews.Author: BryonGarner
Reviews.Content: On behalf of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc., Western Region, I would like to commend the staff of Town and Country for their excellent service during our 2011 Leadership Conference from March 10th - 13th. In particular, I would to especially commend Katherine Richardson who tirelessly attended to every detail - solving our challenges and problems - at all times. Without fail, I knew that I could always rely upon her. I would also like to commend the following for their outstanding service: Jonathan Myrha Sara Ramirez Lauren Petersen

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away”
Reviews.Author: LTA_11
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went away for a "girls" weekend. We had specific plans and places to visit. Town and Country was the PERFECT location for all our plans. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful right from the start. The room was a great size and very clean and neat. I think there was a convention of some sort going on, so it was a bit loud with people laughing and playing in the pools at night, but we were on vacation and it lent to the fun atmosphere of our trip. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Older property loaded with character and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jenazz
Reviews.Content: I attended the same 3200-person convention someone else mentioned below. While a lot of our people stayed at nearby hotels, most of us were here and everyone attended sessions and meals at the T&C. With one exception, every interaction I had with staff was excellent - the service was generally what I would expect at a much more luxurious (and expensive) place. It's an older property, made up of many one and two storey buildings sprawling around a large campus, filled with pools, gardens and courtyards, plus a couple newer towers at the back. The usual amenities in the rooms, several restaurants, gift shops, day spa etc. A nice big convention center unobtrusively on one side. Pros: - The afore-mentioned service. Every staff member was friendly and pro-actively helpful, whether I was in the coffee shop or taking a short cut and getting myself lost in the bowels of the laundry. :-) - Everything was spotlessly clean, everything worked, and everything looked nice (no mean feat in an older property). No broken blinds, crumbling sills, spotty showers or threadbare linens to be found - full marks to housekeeping & maintenance. - We ate all our meals in the convention center, and for having to feed 3200 in about an hour per meal (plated meals each time), I was extremely impressed. (Except for breakfast. Oh well.) Fast, quick, friendly and even tasty, too! - Well-located and easy to find. And just a 5minute walk across a footbridge over the river to a mall, should you want more dining options etc. - A lot of space, if you're booking for a group. Nice convention center, and a host of smaller ballrooms and meeting rooms, as well. Many of them have nice views to gardens, pools, etc. - Staff will drive you around in a golf cart if you need it. - Character! Peace and quiet. I took some free time one afternoon and just wandered around the gardens and courtyards. I'd much rather stay somewhere like this than a high-rise block that could be anywhere. Cons: - Well, for those who don't appreciate that character...It is older, which in many areas means "smaller". I think I was in the "Traditional Accommodations" - very small room. (We referred to it as the "European section".) If you need your space, or have more than two in a room, ask for one of the towers. (That said, I found the room charming.) - Some people might not like the size of the resort - it's very spread out, and can be hard to find your way around. - No free wifi (per my roommate). - Parking was $10/day Issues: - Any 3200-person group will have them. One of our rooms was given away - we were told the previous guests had decided to extend their stay. Our couple was offered a "parlor" (the sitting/dining area of a suite - it's a separate connecting room, and wasn't in use) and rollaway beds. While it worked out for them, I was shocked the hotel allowed the previous guests to stay on like that, knowing the property was fully booked out. That issue aside, I was really impressed. I'm keeping it on my list for my next San Diego trip.

Reviews.Title: “Katherine Richards”
Reviews.Author: Var13
Reviews.Content: ConDor Convention was held at the Town and Country February 25-27, 2011. During the course of the event, there was heavy rain causing some flooding in our Merchans Room. Katherine Richards and her team did a great job in cleaning up before the room was due to open to our membership. Katherine went above and beyond to the point where she carried a mat across the hotel complex to cover a power cord that couldn't be taped town due to the damp carpet. I would work with her any time!

Reviews.Title: “The location was nice and service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: billseto
Reviews.Content: Our conference was 3200 people strong and the hotel accommodated our group without a hitch! The food was fair but the service was excellent, especially to the people with special diets. The staff was cordial and nice at every turn. I would recommend this hotel. I defintely

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest service ever (spoiled us); very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Anna41601
Reviews.Content: Being our first time in San Diego, we were convenient to everything. But, especially, after doing all the tourist sites and being gone all day, we loved the fact that we could just come back and relax at our own hotel for supper: once at Kelly's and at Trellis another night. Both places gave us the best service on a 9 day trip from Az. to San Diego to Palm Springs to Vegas. Wait Staff I must mention are: Pati Muklevicz, Angelica Stephens (who even called her husband on her cell phone to give us directions to Palm Springs, and Miguel Velazques. All of the above went above and beyond. The only negative was the bathroom was very small. You can tell it was an older hotel due to the bathroom, but the hotel was very well maintained and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Narcisses12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel which was hosting the Â«Plant and Animal Genome conferenceÂ». Is is a big complex with hundred of rooms in different buildings. The location is really nice with many pools and lots of flower beds. Some rooms have their private outside terrace. The rooms are perfect and well soundproof. The employee very polite and pleasant. There are a few restaurants on the site but they are not all open in the evening, which can be a pain. The location of the hotel is far from the beach, the downtown San Diego and tourist attractions. However, there is a City train station nearby. If you have a car it will take you less than 10 minutes to get to the beach. The taxi fare is not too expensive (11$) to get to the airport, to the Â«OLD TOWNÂ» and to the Â«BALBOA PARKÂ».

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: koekeloerusrups
