Reviews.Content: We had excellent support from the whole staff. Reception, parking watch, concierge etc etc. The Spa was excellent. The park felt like a tropical island. Only the morning travel to the convention centre took a little long. Not enough restaurant choices near the Hotel. Still plenty reasons to return. Our breakfast girls Pati Muklevic and Angelica Stephens were very warm and helpfull. Yesss good value for money and absolute candidate for a revisit.

Reviews.Title: “a Bit run down”
Reviews.Author: hcii
Reviews.Content: the resort has probably been a nice place. 25 years ago. now however it is pretty run down. could need a lot of polish. we got stuck in the elevator when we arrived. rooms are clean and convenient, shopping mall is very close and good stuff. drawback is the location far away from the city center. you can't just walk out I. the evening (ok, a rather european thought ;-) taxis to hillcrest under 15$ to city center about 25$

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost....”
Reviews.Author: Judyi333
Reviews.Content: For the price...okay for any price, this place was just bad. We asked for extra towels and hangers and it took them over two hours to get them to our room. Rooms were very 1983 in decor. Door between bathroom and room was a pocket door that constantly rattled. TV had the worst reception I have seen in a hotel in over 20 years. You must pay to park and for internet. Driving around the facility nothing is clearly marketed and their staff could not direct us where to unload for the trade show. Even though you prepaid for the internet, the connection was poor and extremely slow. Resturants were also poor. We ate at Kelly's and it smelled like a nursing home and the food was terrible. Went to Charlies for drinks and was impossible to get service. Decor was also terrible. Save the money and stay at another hotel nearby!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little vintage oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: AC619
Reviews.Content: Kristen was very helpful setting up our stay and letting us know about all the amenities at the resort because the grounds are huge. The decor was very 1950's colonial and the surrounding ground is a tropical paradise, perfect for relaxing with a tropical drink. The rooms are good sized with a balcony that overlooked the pool but the rates are pretty economical. We are hoping to talk our family to coming to San Diego for our next reunion and this would be the perfect setting.

Reviews.Title: “Best Valentine's trip ever”
Reviews.Author: AJFdpm
Reviews.Content: Left Chicago for sunny San Diego with my girlfriend for a valentine's to remember and could not have been more happy with our stay at the Town and Country. Check in took two minutes, check out took one. Our room had a gorgeous panoramic view of the pool and palm trees that line the resort, as well as the hills beyond. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the amenities couldn't be beat. Lunch outside Charlie's was great and dinner at Trellises was fantastic. All in all one of the best trips i've ever been on.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: dna940
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Town and Country when we went to San Diego to attend a business meeting and also to visit our daughter. We found it to be not only a great value but very nice and comfortable and up to date. Our room was great with a good view of the area. Each morning we had the buffet breakfast that was included and there was a good selection of all types of breakfast foods and we saved a lot by not having to go to a restaurant to eat. The pool area was also nice and we enjoyed the hot tub as well. For us the location was good because it was easy access to the city and not far from the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: misskitty6
Reviews.Content: Loved the Town & Country Resort. Held a special event there.Staff is superb, amenities great. I highly recommend convention planners to strongly consider the Town & Country Resort & Conventin Center! No complaints, just compliments. Thank you Town & Country!

Reviews.Title: “The staff has gotten to know our group”
Reviews.Author: chadmoos
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Town and Country Resort Hotel for several years to conduct training with our organizations supervisors from all over the country. We have noticed that the staff as well as our contact person, Ms. Erin O'Connor-Miller, has taken the time to learn the needs of our group and always improves and anticipates our needs. They always make sure that the items we need are convenient and available for our use. They treat all of our participants very well and we have never had any complaints from our supervisors about the accomidations or the service received from the hotel staff. The hotel grounds are beautiful and a tremendous site for business conferences. The grounds have been in top condition during every one of our stays. I think the best part has to be the size of their property. It is big enough that you would never have to leave. There are several pools and several restraunts. If you do have to leave the property, the San Diego Metro Trolley System (SDMTS) has a stop directly behind the hotel. It is so convenient to get anywhere in the city. I strongly recommend you consider Town and Country for you next conference or visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice service at the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Mick089
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to San Diego on business and stayed at the Town and Country hotel. We were pleased with the service at breakfast at the Trellis restaurant. Pati Mukzevics was our server, and she made us feel right at home. The eggs benedict were excellent, too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect a Hot Shower!”
Reviews.Author: Rockshire
Reviews.Content: During our three night stay, we got lukewarm to downright cold showers. Maintenance attempted to address the issue but did not solve the problem. We were given the option of changing rooms but everyone in our party of ten were having the same experience in various sections of the property so changing rooms would not have helped. We were staying in what the resort coined as the country bungalows. Another way of saying the rooms were musty and dated. The grounds were beautifully landscaped with trellises, patios and greenery. Several restaurant options were available on site. The lounge/bar was taken over by children that were there for a gymnastics meet so it was not to be enjoyed. Noise was an issue. You could hear guests in neighboring rooms and people moving along the walkway outside the room. You need to be prepared to do some walking to get anywhere. Golf cart bell service is provided to get you to your room with your luggage. If you are willing to wait I guess they may pick you up at other times also. Internet is not provided free of charge not even in the convention meeting rooms. This was by far the worst accommodations I have ever had to endure.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks!”
Reviews.Author: Kaihonu74
Reviews.Content: Nice grounds. Thats it. Choice of room decor is not good. I asked for a King and only had smoking even though the rez was made months ago. Away from any decent dining. If I knew, IÊ»d stay at the Courtyard across the street and walk to the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location in resort style San Diego hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoBS1
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location adjacent to Fashion Valley mall and trolley system. Very pretty grounds and long serving, friendly staff. Personable and friendly service from Margaret Kennedy on sales staff.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthann52
Reviews.Content: I won a silent auction on two nights and all the food at the Town and Country Hotel. Time was running out to use and I called the Management office to see if I could get two rooms for one night so we could take the kids. They made the adjustment easily. Since we live in SD, we weren't all that excited about going somewhere near home, but thought we'd make the best of it. Well, it was WONDERFUL! We were upgraded to a suite that looked like a millionaires home, treated like royalty even though everyone knew we were staying there essentially free. We ate dinner at the Trellis restaurant where our waiter Miguel was one of the best waiters ever! He made wonderful suggestions and didn't hurry us or worry about teenagers in their nice restaurant. They even accommodated my gluten allergy, making special meals for me and my daughter who also has the allergy. The food was wonderful. The staff was great and the manager Michael Orantes was the best. I would never have stayed there or eaten there without the charity event, but it will tops on my recommendations to friends coming to stay in SD or for a great dinning place here inSD.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: socal2ma
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches were literally coming out of the woodwork in the bathroom, and there was mold on the bathroom walls & ceiling. The manager at the front desk was not very helpful or polite. I wouldn't choose to stay at this place if it had not been the location of a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: teacherkse
Reviews.Content: On their website they claim they will not disapoint. They have their work cut out for them if that is the case. This was one of the worst rooms I have ever stayed in. The room I stayed in had a shutter-style window, so the window doesn't actually close. This gave me the opportunity to hear everyone as they walked by my room and the freeway. What a horrible design idea. The room has three "porno" style mirrors on the wall in front of the bed. Apparently, I was not the only one who thought that, which was evident by what I can only imagine were bodily fluids on the mirror. Whoever picked out the artwork for the room needs to find a new line of work. There was a picture of this creepy looking vintage-style girl on one wall. If you ever stayed there you know what I'm talking about. If you ever stay there you will know what I mean. Bring something to cover the picture. On another wall was a latin-inspired print and colonial style flowers on another. I have no idea how they thought that matched. The bathroom had close to no room to put anything on the sliver of a counter they offered. Of course you wouldn't want a big counter since it would make the child-sized toilet look even smaller. The ironing board had years worth of crud on it that I feared would get on my clothing so I opted not to use it. I wont even bore you with my comments on the bedding, but enjoy. It's 2001, upgrade your 19 inch, broken, tube television. I ate one of their sandwiches they had for sale in the deli. If you get one of those, be sure to order two drinks so you can use one to soften the bread. I went to Charlies which is their pub style restaurant. Their food was actually okay. Their employees were appalling. I was the only customer when a group of ten people showed up and decided to eat outside. The entire staff made inapropriate comments about those customers. I know everyone jokes, which is fine, just don't do it in front of other customers. The resort will continue to fill their rooms since employers will continue to send employees there for conferences, which was why I was there. If your employer hasn't paid for your room and you don't require the convenience of being on the grounds for a conference, stay at the Double Tree. I always stay at the Double Tree when I am in that area and will continue to do so. Hey Town and Country, reinvest some of the money into the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Rollercoaster Ride - beware conference attendees”
Reviews.Author: UPLNCRN
Reviews.Content: The one thing I will say about this hotel is that they go above and beyond in customer service to fix the MANY complaints that you will have. I stayed here as part of a very large international conference. Our first room was like motel-hell and was way overpriced for what you get. The second room was much nicer, but I don't want to know what they are charging for it, as I might pay the "C" class rate for the "A" class room I was upgraded to. (might). The rooms are clean and they don't smell. The tower room that I was upgraded to was very quiet - definitely a huge plus for me. As I mentioned, we were here for a conference, so we had limited amount of time to eat lunch before we had to go back in for the afternoon sessions. We sat at Trellises for at least 20 minutes (I think it was closer to 30 but I'm trying not to exaggerate anything in this review) without anyone taking our order. Thus, we didn't have time to eat, especially since we had to go back to our room which was the first one and was approximately 5 minute walk (one way) from the conference hall. I complained, and they offered a free meal, but I asked for the upgrade to the new room instead. So, as you can see, they make concerted efforts to make up for the issues. Service was also extremely slow at Charlies. I didn't attempt to have lunch there but it's a good thing we didn't have any sessions after dinner because I think we might have missed eating entirely. Good things: If you are on the correct side of the property, the mall behind the hotel is a very short walk (shorter than the walk from the conference hall to our old room) and there is some decent restaurants there. It's saying something that we had more time to walk to the neighboring mall and eat in the restaurants there and walk back then we did to eat on the hotel property. And the food in the mall is better. The landscaping is gorgeous. Finally, I know I'm picky about internet but the wifi was worse than usual. Sometimes you can get on, sometimes you can't. When you do get on, it's so slow I could run down and get a latte and come back only to find the website timed out. Don't expect to be able to work while you are here. I could go on, but I will summarize to say that we had a lot of issues and complaints but the hotel did their very best to make up for them. That's the only reason they even get a 2/5 rating. I would recommend staying offsite and driving a car or taking a taxi back onto the property for any conference you attend here.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms desparately need updating; exterior beautifully landscaped.”
Reviews.Author: ponygirl87
Reviews.Content: I have actually never left a review before but I felt that this place warrented one. I traveled here for a conference, and while the hotel was beautifully landscaped there was nothing else to compliment- especially at $130-150/night. I tried to check-in and the front desk said that the reservations I had made in October had been deleted 2 days before my check-in (This also happened to one of the colleagues I was travelling with). I had the paperwork from my original reservations in hand so they finally relented and gave me a room. My colleague was denied a room and ended up at the Marriot across the highway (much nicer and newer anyways). The hotel is very spread out, and I dragged my luggage to a two-story building in the center of the "resort" - there were no elevators so I had to carry everything upstairs myself. I found an extremely dated room that looked older than I am. The room was a decent size but the walls were thin and I could hear my neighbors. Cracked tiles in the bathroom, hair on the bathroom floor, the tub handle came off everytime I tried to turn on the shower and the toilet rocked. My closet doors didn't shut all the way, and there was only one available power outlet in the room, unless I wanted to unplug the lamp in the room. The bed was hard and the comforter was so old that it was covered in fuzzies/pilled spots on the fabric. The tv was old and only got a few channels and I got to use the internet for 5 min one day out of the 6 I was there by walking to someone else's room. The hotel has wireless but it is EXTREMELY spotty and will cut off in a few minutes. The maid staff seemed nice, but were never consistent in what they left me- one day they took the bar of soap I left by the sink and never replaced it, somedays I had plenty of towels, somedays there wasn't a single washcloth in sight. I tried the Sunshine Deli, The Cottage Cafe, Trelisses and Charlies. The staff and food at the Deli were great- they had amazing chocolate chip cookies. The Cottage Cafe was okay, Charlies was completely unaccomadating to food allergies and food allergies were hit or miss at Trelisses. We had lunch at Trelisses and had a rude waiter named Jesus who did not even try to accomadate my food allergies (no acidic foods- ie no tomatoes/citus/bell peppers- I just wanted a plain salad) he completely ignored our table and I actually had to find another waiter to get our check (I used to wait tables in college so I am usually very understanding if servers are busy or such). We went back to Trelisses another night and had a server named Jamie and she was great. I wasn't the only one who had problems- one of my other colleagues went 3 days without hot water before they would move her into another room and she missed several parts of the convention trying to wait for the maitence staff. If you want to use the gym it is $5/day and the sauna and hot tub are $25/day. We went to the concierge several times with questions, and everytime were given answers- ie. whether we could print boarding passes, get a ride somewhere, etc. I think that the only reason this hotel still gets business is that there is a conference center located on the property so it is convient for that. But you are MUCH better off simply renting a car or taking a taxi the ~1mile across the highway from the Marriott everyday to the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Like a 1980s retirement community”
Reviews.Author: eruditetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention and left early. If you've read other reviews then you know that this Hotel is very old and needs updating. The best way I can think of describing it is to say: "Think of staying at a 1980s retirement community." The grounds are nice and there are people driving around in golf carts (because the place is so spread out) but the furniture is old and looks like grandma has been using the same bedspread that your mom grew up with. You check in at the lobby then walk or get a golf cart escort to your room. I had reserved a King room but was given a double (not a big deal). The rooms have very old decoration, old TVs (cathode ray tube), fuzzy reception on several channels but are otherwise very clean. The mattress on the bed felt old and stiff. I could feel individual springs through the sheets. Internet is provided by ATT-wifi (daily fee) and is spotty at best (can check an email or two before signal is lost). I called to ask where the best place in the complex was for a good signal and was told "outside." While this may be accurate I don't feel that it's an acceptable answer. The conference facilities have been fine so far and I think that's why this place still operates. I ran into several other conference attendees who were also a little surprised by the hotel rooms as well. I'm not really a hotel snob but if I'm paying upwards of $150 per night for a hotel I expect something better than what Motel 6 offers. If you're old this place will probably remind bring back memories. If you're under age 65 I would recommend looking elsewhere. I was able to check out early. They were nice enough to waive the $50 per night fee it would have been to check out prior to my scheduled stay. I haven't seen this policy at other hotels so it leads me to believe that the situation has come up more than once at this place. I had some pretty bad experiences with the parking lot attendant and security guard which are likely isolated incidents related to personalities and led to me leaving the hotel early so that's why they waived the fee. Pros: Clean Landscaping with lots of flowers and trees Several restaurants on site Good for old people Friendly front desk staff Cons: OLD OLD OLD beds and decoration Very hard old mattress Old cathode ray tube TV with fuzzy channels on 1/2 of my stations Spread out - everything is a walk from your room. Wi-Fi internet - poor signals throughout, unreliable, not for business traveler Beware of angry security guy and parking lot attendant. Let's say you book for a week but need to leave early, you are charged $50 per day for the remaining days on the reservations that you didn't stay. Not good for young travelers. If you have to attend a conference at this hotel I would recommend booking at the Courtyard Marriott (where I fled to) across the Interstate (about 1 min drive) or one of the others next to it.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: fitzN
Reviews.Content: The Town & Country is set in beautiful garden atmosphere. Roses/flowers/palm trees/shrubs are throughout the entire property, with swimming pools in several locations. A very quite place to stay, great place to rest and relax. The restaurants are great, food very good and service always prompt. Kelly's Steak House has a wide selection menu with most reasonable prices on everything especially their steaks. Excellent place for a family to dine. From check-in, to bell service, to house keeping and beyond, a most professional staff. Their training shows in the performance of all the employee's. The Staff on the front desk could not be nicer and more efficient. Even with the lobby full of customers waiting to check in, they all maintain an alertness while handling your details and make every effort to make your wait as short as possible. I have been a customer for some 25 years at this fine hotel, and it just gets better with each year. The upkeep of the property is ongoing, and it seems every effort is being made to upgrade the rooms and in these economic rough times that's a gigantic undertaking. The grounds are impeccable and certainly gives you that home away from home feeling. Large upscale shopping center within walking distance. Public transportation readily available right at the rear of their parking lot. Close to many family attractions and in fact you can view the fireworks show at Sea World every night right from the property. Room rates are very competative with the surrounding properties and many times are lower. Hugh Convention Center facilities available for groups wanting meeting space and not having to leave the property during their stay to tend to business. Absolutely a great property to stay, with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best Pumpkin Latte in all of CA”
Reviews.Author: BevTrips101
Reviews.Content: My company has organized the PAG meeting at this location every year for the past 19 years and Mark Yunker & his staff are always exceptional. However, this year I met Bridget at the onsite deli and she encouraged me to try the pumpkin latte. I was very happy she did. It's the best latte I have ever had, and coming from New York I have had many a latte. The following day I went back for another but Bridget was off an a nice young man made it for me but it wasn't the same. I think it's Bridget's wonderful personality which Bridget, going forward I will be judging all latte's by your standard.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, good service, great location but a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Franco77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town & Country Resort & Convention Center for 4 nights while in San Diego for a conference. This hotel complex is very beautiful and it is maintained very well. I stayed in one of the rooms in the single story section of this complex. The room was nice but the TV and reception were not as nice as I would have expected. I guess you donâ€™t go to San Diego to watch TV though. I would have liked to have seen one of the rooms in the Royal Palm Tower on-site though. I imagine they would have been a little nicer, albeit a little pricier also. On-site I ate at Trellises Garden Grille, Kellyâ€™s Steakhouse, and the Terrace CafÃ© & Deli. I also stopped in one evening at Charlieâ€™s (a sports bar on-site) to relax and have a few drinks. The gentleman who managed Charlies (Iâ€™m sorry his name escapes me right now) was an extremely nice guy. I had a very pleasant time while there. Pati M. was one of the waiters/waitresses that was at the Trellises Garden Grille and she provided very nice service. They had excellent (also a little pricey though) breakfasts. Everyone was very courteous and pleasant there. The hotel complex is almost like a botanical garden. To top it off, the Fashion Valley Shopping Mall is right across the walk bridge from the hotel complex. It was a great place to shop. I would recommend that you seriously consider staying at this hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Palms Tower rooms & hospitality suite are top of the line!”
Reviews.Author: mmbhh
Reviews.Content: In February 2010, we arranged a great price of $99 per room for a minimum of 10 rooms, including a hospitality suite, through Kristen Warnken for the LEAGUE OF EXCEPTIONAL GENTLEMEN (LEG) group to celebrate New Year's Eve. She also arrange free parking for our group which we appreciated. She then arranged for me to work with Sarah Ramirez to maintain an accurate count of everyone who booked a room(s). Both Kristen and Sarah were easy to work with, and very accommodating; it was a pleasure to work with them. In addition, Katherine Richardson also accommodated us by ensuring the hospitality suite was adequate. The hospitality suite was marvelous; it was beautifully furnished and had everything we needed to host a pre-New Year's Eve party for our group of 25. Everyone loved it. Everyone also loved their room which were also beautifully and tastefully decorated and, again, had everything you needed. They were quiet and very comfortable too. We all had a fantastic New Year's celebration there.

Reviews.Title: “A large hotel with lots of pools in sunny San Diego”
Reviews.Author: buddyroopdx
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not take my breath away, but it also didn't disappoint. I stayed her with several friends in a few different friends for a conference. I would not stay here outside of some special event. The room was average in the far tower. It was nice to have a balcony and convenient parking.

Reviews.Title: “the service and rooms were superb”
Reviews.Author: guero59
Reviews.Content: Barbara Whitlock was very professional with setting up my reservation....Also, the service and food at Kellys Steak House was Great!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: trigeekgirl236
Reviews.Content: I had heard unfortunate things about this hotel from a colleague and from other Trip Advisor reviews, so my expectations were pretty low. I was very pleasantly surprised by my stay as a result. The grounds are beautiful and I enjoyed eating breakfast and lunch outside. My room was older, but it was very spacious (probably because I got an accessible room for some reason). The architecture was unique, rather than being a hotel that could have been plunked down in any city. The staff were helpful and funny. The chintz-explosion decor was not to my tastes, the Internet was so slow I didn't even pay to use it for most of my trip, and the rooms could use more power outlets in better places, but overall, the hotel was comfortable and quiet, the staff was excellent, and I had a wonderful few days in San Diego as a result. Tip: Walk over to the mall via the footbridge. From there you can catch public transport, watch a movie, have a meal, or just walk around and windowshop.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: PVL-trav
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! It's centrally located. The grounds are clean and beautiful. The rooms are well-appointed. The bed was just heaven. The staff went out of their way to please us. Breakfast the next morning in the restaurant hit the spot. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel... Even more amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: mserrano619
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Town and Country for our 1 year wedding anniversary. Our room was absolutely breath taking and it was so peaceful. We were able to relax and enjoy each others company. The manager Tisha Williams went out of her way to ensure we had the best experience possible. Her extra efforts and great customer service made for an even more memoriable anniversary weekend.

Reviews.Title: “I had so much fun, everyone was nice and helpfun! I loved the gounds!”
Reviews.Author: SDGARCIA
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel last weekend and I had a blast. Everyone was so helpful and took the time to answer all my silly questions. The grounds were beautiful and made a great background for some great looking pictures of me and my family. At check in and check out it was quick and painless. Tisha Williams the manager was such a great help with the everything. It was a lot of us staying there so we needed a lot of help and she went above and beyond her duties. I cant wait till my family and I return!

Reviews.Title: “This place is great”
Reviews.Author: 32655Barry
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times when visiting family and the Hotel Circle location is very conven ient to everywhere. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms, whether in the high-rise or in the rose garden cottages, are very comfortable. And the beds and the staff are the BEST. Barry Parker

Reviews.Title: “STAR Quality Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Denny1958
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed only one night, it was a delightful experience. Check in and check out was by Donna...very pleasant and efficient. She greeted me by name upon departure and was very thorough. Ordered room service and "Alvaro" (I think) delivered the food. It was delivered quickly and the quality of the food was terrific. Alvaro was very professional and personable. The room was spacious and clean and the room was quiet. The National Sales director, Margaret Kennedy, assisted me with the reservation and she is the consummate professional and quite charming. She answered all the pertinent questions I posed. I would recommend the hotel to anyone that is visiting America's Finest City.

Reviews.Title: “Great time - 90 year old mother had a great birthday.”
Reviews.Author: moncinna
Reviews.Content: Returned to Las Vegas after great stay at Hotel. took 90 yr old mother for her birthday. She really enjoyed sitting on balcony in morning and evening. Very conveinient to get around town as entrance to I-8 close by. Shopping mall next door was enjoyed by mother and wife. Walking distance. Eat at steak house very good. Everyone smiling and cordial at the Hotel. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “charlies restaurant and Gonzo our waiter”
Reviews.Content: Myself and a large group of colleagues were lucky enough to have Gonzo as our wait person. The food was good, but the experience was truly brought together by the presence of Gonzo! He helped point us in the right direction to best serve our group and wasn't shy about grabbing a camera and helping us capture the moment. The experience was truly a memorable one, all thanks to Gonzo. I hope you are lucky enough to have Gonzo as your server. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “First class dump”
Reviews.Author: 67vert
Reviews.Content: While the grounds are nice, that does not make up for all the faults of this so called resort. Think large scale motel 6 with flowers and restaruants. Lights in the room were not only dusty they had cobwebs on them. The bathroom floor towel/mat was so old it was thread bear had holes in it. I have seen plates in the hall of other hotels when people put them out after getting room service however they do not sit in the hallway for 5 days, Service in the restaraunts is terrible, ask for a refill on my drink 3 times no refill. After you get the food you are ignored. The food is subpar and expensive including the hotel catering. Internet bandwith is so bad it makes the internet useless and it will only cost you 10 bucks a day for that. The hotel must beleive in hiring people who will do the jobs americans won't do. So language could be an issue, if you ask an employee for directions or help. If you like sleeping on the concrete then you will love the hard beds I would recommend you stay at another hotel and walk or take the trolley if you have a confernce here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, lovely grounds, but hard bed, lacks security”
Reviews.Author: Sometimestravler
Reviews.Content: Positives: Clean room, beautiful grounds, friendly staff, no "building noice" such as plumbing sounds, pretty good location. Negatives: The bed was hard as concrete which is the reason for the low sleep quality rating. The decor was 1980s. You pay extra for the well-maintained grounds. The biggest issue is the lack of security. The complex has two large hotel buildings plus multiple smaller units. I stayed in the largest of the hotels. It had an open-air entrance so anyone could walk in. The registration desk is in another building on the opposite side of the complex. In the large hotel building, you get off the elevator onto an open air walkway. The doors to the rooms are accessed from this walkway. It did not seem at all safe, Anyone could walk onto the grounds, walk into the hotel, and be hiding in the dimly lit open-air walkway. I did not see any security cameras or security guards.

Reviews.Title: “Veeeery old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller_EUR
Reviews.Content: Stayed @Town & Country for the second time for a convention. The venue has a nice flair and its outdoor attractions are likable. The walking distance to the attractive shopping mall across the street is a value add. The real drawback is the rooms' quality. Some very few are acceptable but most are begging for getting a complete overhaul. They are clean though but the corridors frequently smell badly and so do the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy a healthy breakfast with personable staff”
Reviews.Author: AlexQT83
Reviews.Content: Down there for a week for a convention in late October, our days were quite full and we ran out of time for having lunch everyday... Fortunately, this hotel counts the best and richest breakfast I've ever eaten in California, healthy enough to survive in good shape until the dusk ! Teh very personable staff, and Pati Muklevicz is an excellent ambassador of them, makes the experience even greater and makes you eating like a king ! Alex, France

Reviews.Title: “3rd world Setting”
Reviews.Author: Pyropenative
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you miss the Tijuana setting... My room was in the tower on the 4th floor and working hammers were banging away below me @ 8A.M. My view was that of the S.D. Newpaper plant shop & below me was the junk yard... oh excuse me; the maintance yard. Carpets are even old... even the soap & shampoo was very 70s. The 300 s.f. room had a 25 inch TUBE televison. Whats up with that... ???? and the local reception was snowy... At the OCT 2010 price of $168.00 per night... the Marriott across the street is THE BETTER DEAL!!! No comp breakfast, no comp van pick-up to OR from airport. Had to rent a car because nothing around to do on the grounds... even the "lobby" for drinks SUCK!!!!! $15.00 for a sucky breakfest... STAY AWAY.... you have been warned

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: poncho525
Reviews.Content: I don't remember the room number, but the thrid floor room I was in had bed bugs - that I didn't discover until the next morning when I awoke with bites all over. The hotel was old. There was a stain on the floor that looked like a former crime scene. The TV was fuzzy and had poor low-def reception. There was hair on and around the toilet, in the tub and on the bed sides. This is more of a 50-year old motel, with a nice pool, than a "resort." The staff was nice the the food was acceptable. If you stay here check for bed bugs first. The matterss is ancient.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Egg Benedict at Trellises Restaurant served by Pati Mukzevict”
Reviews.Author: SherriJohnstone
Reviews.Content: Large air conditioned rooms and fabulous cookies. The plants give the place a peaceful feel. It is a large resort and I never managed to go to Trellises the same way twice.

Reviews.Title: “Trap”
Reviews.Author: txacolis
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews here before. Once you check in there is a trap of $50 if you want to leave. Believe me, they need this trap to keep you here. Old mattreses smelly rooms. A resort room should not look like an old third rate motel. Go elsewhere, do not book in advance or you are trapped!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Grounds and Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: taconista
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the grounds are like something out of a movie set. The gardens are quaint and delightful, full of flowers and hummingbirds. The place is a bit of a maze to navigate, but if you have time, that kind of wandering is relaxing and gives the feeling of being lost in your own world. The staff are amazing. I was there for a week-long business meeting. Staff were always right on the ball when we needed something, even if it was a crazy last-minute request, like a surprise lunch for 40+ people. They were really friendly, too. Every last staff person that I bumped into had a smile and a hello. That made such a difference during a stressful meeting. I would love to go back and spend some actual time relaxing there!

Reviews.Title: “I should have taken my girlfriend!!”
Reviews.Author: juerro
Reviews.Content: Having to drive a truckload of my daughter's stuff to San Diego wasn't fun, not to mention my baby moving away to college, and I needed a place to stay and park the truck (and it's contents) overnight. I was referred to this hotel by someone in my company familiar with the area, and he definitely steered me the right direction! By the time I got there, I had lost my marbles, and everyone put up with me quite well; exhibiting a great deal of patience through my lack of brain function; they were all very nice, and polite to the finest detail. The grounds were nothing short of a garden; palms, roses, etc., and meticulously maintained. From my balcony, I looked down onto a clean, clear pool and yard. The elevator was fast and smooth. The door lock functioned just fine, and I walked into a room with a four-post king size bed. The slider opened out onto a balcony that looked out across the Hotel grounds, across to the nearby hills, and yet still seemed private. The tv was neatly hidden in an armoire, and there was a gaming control tucked in there as well, although I didn't get into that. The room was clean, bathroom and shower as well, right down to the vacuum patterns on the carpet. I actually took photos with my phone and sent them to my girlfriend, just to make her regret not coming along! Even the evening guard/ lot attendant was great! I apologize as I do not remember the gentleman's name, but what a great guy; knew the area, was very personable, and was happy to offer suggestions and directions. My daughter and I dined at Trellises, and we both just sat and relished in what we had requested of the chefs. The service was both fun and attentive, all the while professional. I will never again be able to have that moment with my daughter, that last dinner out together as she grows from being Daddy's lil girl into an independent young woman, and Trellises created nothing short of a perfect setting. Thank you, to the staff and crew of Trellises restaurant and Town & Country Resort Hotel, for what you do everyday is now a memory and moment in time that I, and my daughter, will always have. When I come back to visit my lil girl, I will be sure to bring my girlfriend, and hopefully we will stay a little longer to enjoy your hospitality! A weary traveler and Dad

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a resort”
Reviews.Author: BigBear2000
Reviews.Content: We booked into the town and country for a conference in April. One of the more interesting facts is that when you check in you sign an electronic register that announces that there is a $50. per day / per room fee for checking out early. No mention of the charge when you book with their online system or with thirdparty web providers. The place was such a dump that we did check out after the first night and moved to the Marriott property just across the highway which was $50. per night less expensive and was far nicer, no ridiculous daily parking fee. If you are expecting a "resort" and the 1960's were a fun time for you, Town and Country is the place for you. I'm amused to read all of the rave reviews for one of the little overpriced restaurants. If you took those restaurant reviews out of the hotel list, you'd probably end up with two stars. I'd give Town and Country one star, just because there were no bedbugs in my room.

Reviews.Title: “This place is garbage. For the price you...”
Reviews.Author: Travelmatt86
Reviews.Content: This place is garbage. For the price you pay, you would expect some luxury or clean rooms.. Everything is old and outdated. Bathrooms are tiny. When i got to my room there were dirt smearings on the wall and i'n the bathroom, and an old dirty washcloth hanging i'n the shower. They need new cleaning staff who actually clean, and i found hair i'n my sheets that was not mine. They rip you off with every service, the only good thing about this place is the palm trees. This shouldn't be called a resort, it should be called a fat rip off enclosure you can sleep i'n. i wish i would have stayed at marriot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: netzie1948
Reviews.Content: The service we received while having a business breakfast in Trellises Garden Grill was excellent. Our waitress, Ms. Pati Muklevicz was delightful and took care of us in a timely and professional manner. The food was great and the overall experience keeps us coming back. Employees like Ms. Muklevicz are rare and a tremendous asset to any business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in the Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CorkyL
Reviews.Content: A friend, whom I had not seen in 25 years, and I had lunch in the Trellises Restaurant in the Town & Country Hotel, San Diego, CA. We lingered a long time over lunch. A most delightful lunch was enhanced by the superlative service from Ms Pati Muklevicz. She was patient with us, yet quite attentive. Her polite manner and frequent attention to our needs as we discussed old times were much appreciated. Thanks to Ms Muklevicz for making our lunch even more memorable. Glen Lenox, San Diego, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff. Great day...”
Reviews.Author: satomiy15
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly staff. Great day spa and salon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad as I thought”
Reviews.Author: mzthng
Reviews.Content: Before traveling I always read the reviews. After reading reviews for this hotel, I went into my travels negatively. I traveled with my hisband for a convention and thought that I would have rather stayed at a Marriott property. This was an older property, like some others spoke of, but It did have some charm. It was quiet and after staying there for about 5 days, I completely felt safe. We stayed near the pool and I had no problems at all. There were no roaches or bugs like other reviewers spoke of. There was always complete quietness and I was able to relax at all times of the day. Though I feel it is unnessary to charge for internet and the gym, like they did, I found other ways around it. As for the internet, I used my blackberry and as far as exercise, the property is safe. Town and Country is in the hotel district which includes a series of other properties closely bunched together. I ran daily for blocks and there was never a problem. I saw people - old and young and no one seemed to be worried about a stranger lerking in the area. The property is also close - walking distance is about 5 min. It is close the to train station - which could have been unsafe, but I didn't have any problems. All in all, it was an enjoyable trip and the housekeeping staff is excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Forrestal Reunion”
Reviews.Author: SunnySanDiegoMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week long trip to the Town and Country Resort. Everything and everyone went out of their way to be helpful, accommodating and make sure our stay was the best it could be. The rooms were very comfortable, slept like a baby! The grounds are amazing and many of our group thought they were in Hawaii, but without the humidity. We can't give the hotel enough kudos for the facility, banquet, and just the friendliness they gave our group. They even offered a shuttle vehicle for those wanting to go around the facility or even to places nearby. T&C certainly knows how to treat company...we were treated like royalty. Thanks everyone at T&C.

Reviews.Title: “No customer Service except Bell service”
Reviews.Author: SingleWomantraveler
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping and front desk was uncaring and inadequate. The room(3557) has stained seats on the chairs. The carpet in front of the sink was discolored and stained. Housekeeping had just stuffed the partially used cream and sugar packages from the previous tenant, for me to have the first morning, for my coffee. The front desk did not think this was important enough to correct. The second day of my stay, the room was not cleaned at all except, clean towels. The used bath mat was thrown on the side of the tub and used glasses were where they had been left. When I checked out, the front desk did not want to hear about it. The womenâ€™s expression did not change. There was no concern. I would not stay again at any price

Reviews.Title: “Just checked out today. IMO, this is a 3d...”
Reviews.Author: uclabruinn
Reviews.Content: Just checked out today. IMO, this is a 3d world resort in San Diego. I've stayed at many hotels for conventions and would not consider myself a picky person. To begin with, the customer service is horrible. I called for the location of the gym and was not told that there is actually an extra daily charge to use it. I found out when I arrived. The gym was not worth the extra cost. I asked for a small fridge for my room and was told it would entail an extra charge as well.Â Also, I was charged an early check out fee even though I explained to the manager it was a mistake, but they still refused to waive it. The parking attendants ate slow and inefficient.Â The rooms are dated, small and dingy. The walls and windows allow tons of sound In and out. In short, even if there for a convention, stay at a neighboring hotel at all costs. I for one will never be back. If I could give this hotel a zero, I would.

Reviews.Title: “1950's Retro Resort”
Reviews.Author: TF66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort on the recommendation of the lovely but elderly lady at the S.D. tourist information â€“ we were tired and it was cheapish at $100. We booked for 4 nights and got locked in by agreeing to pay $50 per day for parking if we left â€“ (watch out for that as itâ€™s a trap) as is the $10 extra for internet, no fridge and $10 extra to use the gym â€“ all annoying stuff as were the rude check in staff. Anyway were initially horrified but the fact it was miles away from downtown and that we had landed in a dated 1950â€™s movie set - it was the oddest place we have ever been â€“ I think Americanâ€™s call it Victorian â€“ we just thought it was odd and kind of amazing as its so retro. Itâ€™s set in massive grounds and I think at the time we were one of 5 cars in a parking lot for 2000 â€“ QUIET yes. However after a few days we go over the shock â€“ used it as a base to sleep , appreciated that there are a lot of workers that spend a lot of time and care tending to the place and discovered a fantastic retro bar/restaurant onsite "Kelly's Steak House" We ended up there twice and both times had a fantastic time with the staff. The know how to mix a mean cocktail and are very friendly and genuinely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well Managed & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: rrooyal
Reviews.Content: Town & Country on Hotel Circle is well managed and most convenient for its guests. This large property has different style rooms from those in smaller buildings to a ten floor tower. It has a bridge at the rear of the property to the great public service trolley and mall. Within the property are pools, restaurants, and gift shops. There are 350 rose bushes in bloom as well as other flowers and palm trees.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, serene, beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: fitzN
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this resort for years and it is a gem. Very quiet, beautiful, well maintain grounds with one of the most professional Staffs anywhere. From the Executive personnel, front desk, bell service, to the restaurant wait servers, and housekeeping, they all provide the very finest customer service possible. Above and beyond, making you feel right at home. The person responsible for training certainly performs a first rate job, teaching what customer service is and should be when staying at a resort like the Town & Country. There are tower rooms and cottage's available. The cottages are located within an area almost botanical garden like, yet only a short walk to the pools, restaurants and gift shops. Very quiet areas for those seeking such. The tower rooms are well appointed and contain balconies which look out over the garden like grounds, pools and with wonderful views. Parking areas are close and adjacent to the location you are generally housed. Public transportation is a short parking lot walk from your door. An upscale shopping mall also a short one block walk. A golf course is directly across from the hotel, thus adding to the quietness of the area. The restaurants range from casual to a fine steak house, with prices most reasonable and the breakfast buffet is a bargain, being located right near a pool. Those with families will enjoy this resort and they even have movies on the week ends, shown on the lawn with popcorn, drinks, and all that goes with family enjoyment. There is a large Convention Center right on the property. Certainly one of the best resorts in San Diego and the rates are very reasonable with a Staff that puts Customer Service first and makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and beautiful gardens”
Reviews.Author: Jacquez2
Reviews.Content: Came to San Diego to visit our daughter and grandchildren. Our grandkids came to stay with us at the hotel. The room was very clean and big enough for all of us. The grand kids loved the pools and jacuzzi. My wife and I loved walking around the beautiful gardens, very peaceful. The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. We ate at the sports bar and the cafe and both were very good. Overall a very good experience- we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was incredible- location, surrounding gardens, quiet rooms --Just BEAUTIFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lauraasutton
Reviews.Content: The Town and Country was one of the most beautiful stays I have had. Not only was the location perfect, close to the beach, concert venue and shopping, the room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Most amazing was the surrounding gardens with fountains patio tables and chairs for guests and pool access made the experience like a fantasy. A place I would love to live all the time! I am looking forward to making the trip again!

Reviews.Title: “family oriented”
Reviews.Author: mommykleib
Reviews.Content: enjoyed stay. kids loved the pool .I enjoyed the senery. close to mall and shops. would return in a heart beat. rooms very clean felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Zero star dump!”
Reviews.Author: eddie7224
Reviews.Content: I recently had the displeasure of staying at the â€œresortâ€� when my association decided to skip all the other wonderful places in San Diego to stay, and choose this Victorian Shangri-La! Where to begin? First off the sleeping rooms are cramped, old and reek of mold. The sink leaked about a gallon of water a night and the carpeting looked as if it just came off Lollapalooza, gross! Although the roach I shared the room with the first night seemed like a nice enough character. I complained about the condition of my room to my association and I was told, to â€œget in lineâ€� as many of the other attendees were complaining also. Also, $10 a day for in-room internet which performed subpar was a rip-off. The grounds are nice, but very dated and boring. There is nothing to do on the hotel property (sorry â€œresortâ€�). It is walking distance to a mall, but you can only window shop so much. I asked the front desk for fun things to do in the area and they kept insisting I stay on property and hang out at one of the restaurants. After 2 days of hearing this I finally gave in. Mistake! The food is bland, over priced and unless you like hanging out in a lifeless, barfly setting, not the place to be. English is also obviously a problem here, because unless you are inside the hotel building (sorry â€œresortâ€�) finding someone on property to speak the language is equal to Indiana Jones finding the Lost Ark. The meeting rooms themselves are very old, offer NO modern amenities, have very poor lighting and in 2 of the rooms a house sound system that kept breaking up. The common areas of the place look as though they were decorated by a grandmother. Gaudy, out of date dÃ©cor, like what youâ€™d find at a garage sale and never buy or buy as a joke to give to friends. I travel a great deal and this was one of the worst experiences ever. If you have a say, stay away! However, if you are unlucky enough to have to come here, across the street there is a new Marriott, which I ended up staying at on my own afterwards, way better! FYI, the golf resort you see in the brochure is across the street and has nothing to do with the hotel (sorry â€œresortâ€�).

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel atmosphere.manager Sherida...”
Reviews.Author: tmac02
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel atmosphere.manager Sherida Green was very helpful, courteous, and went above and beyond to help us with all of our needs

Reviews.Title: “Great lOCATION AND LOVELY GROUNDS”
Reviews.Author: scooplady
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and had no problem checking in early and the staff at the front desk were very nice,very helpful. We stayed in the Royal Palm Tower on the property,which is huge. What a beautifully landscaped Hotel grounds,pools are lovely! I felt relaxed and in a little peace of heaven. We stayed 4 days,our convention was on site and again well organized. Staff at the Sunshine Deli on site were so helpful and friendly. We stopped by each night to have a treat and a coffee,always friendly and big smiles on the staff,who had very busy days. I had read negative things on this site,so was a wee bit worried... but found nothing to worry about. In fact it was quite the opposite.... just a great holiday place,if you like lovely grounds and fabulous pools, this is the place. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel grounds are beautiful”
Reviews.Author: pjdoll
Reviews.Content: Employees are well trained. Check in was so quick considering how busy they were. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. They have a great piano bar. The only downfall of our stay was parking. If you're going in and out late at night the parking can be scarce. The hotel location is close to everything. Has easy access to freeways and beaches. Can walk to shopping mall or catch the trolley. The rooms were a little small and would have been nice to have queen beds and a sofa. The price I got online was great. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to get Home!”
Reviews.Author: Simply_Ses
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Diego, hope next one is better. Hotel was dirty, smelly, old and just way overpriced. Rooms look nothing like advertised on website. Front desk personnel were rude, however bellboy and restaurant (Trellises) staff very nice. 50+ dollars for room service which amounted to "NOT" fresh squeezed orange juice, chicken mcnuggets, fried chicken and cold fries. Front desk in dire need of Hotel manager or supervisor, as a whole lot of employees standing around doing a whole lot of nothing. Outdoor area well manicured and cleaner than the rooms maybe the landscapers should take over housekeeping. Small business center amounts to a pay to print console and 3 computers with internet access at 12+ dollars per 1/2 hour. Fitness center offered at the Bella Tosca Day spa and salon for a fee. High speed internet available in the room for a fee etc... I read another review and it's true this place will nickel and dime you to death!! Use of the Pool was free! Daughter and I had to make the trip for spine surgery and hotel staff was aware that we were checking in post op for some recovery time. We were checked in to an end unit facing the freeway underpass and hotel parking, it was almost comical how much noise and traffic was just outside our window. The up side is that we know where not to stay for our next post op visit.

Reviews.Title: “Injoyable”
Reviews.Author: David6505
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest places I have stayed. Front Desk Ms. Sherida Green could not do enough for us. The Bellman Kirk went above the call of duty. The Concierge Ms. Jill Moniz had a basket of fruit sent to our room it was our 44th wedding anniversary. From the gardner to the maintenance, housekeeping anything we ask for we got with a smile. Food was a little pricey

Reviews.Title: “BUGS----DISGUSTING, FILTHY, SICKENED, OVERPRICED”
Reviews.Author: flower12345
Reviews.Content: Wow. I just came back from a conference in San Diego. We stayed in the Royal Palm Tower at the Town and Country Hotel. There was a bug (looked like a bedbug) in the picture frame--stuck between the glass and the picture. There was a toenail on the lamp. The room smelled moldy. The rugs were stained. I don't care about the decor of the room, but I do feel that cleanliness is very important. It was not a clean room. There were pubic hairs in the bathroom on the sink and on the toilet. The glass that they give you to drink water out of was filthy. It was a really dirty hotel. It is extremely overpriced. I didn't have to pay, so I'm not on here complaining because I got ripped off. I truly just want people to know that this is not a nice hotel. I would make sure (if you decide to stay here) to check your bags for roaches before you leave, because they can crawl in your bag and come home with you. Also, check the mattress for bedbugs. The restaurants were overpriced. The people at the front desk were a bit unpleasant, but I would be too if I had to work there. Oh, the housekeeping women were very nice, but as I said, the room was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hyprrn
Reviews.Content: What a nightmare. I have a large family, there were 9 of us, and I booked 2 rooms 4 months ago for our family vacation in July. We arrived only to find out that "the hotel was oversold" and for the 9 of us the hotel gave us one room with one queen bed,,,and the other room with one fold out Murphy Bed no bigger than a queen! I had booked two rooms with 2 queen beds each room! When I complained I was told that they would provide "fold outs," Are you kidding me? It would have been spatially impossible to fit enough fold outs in those little rooms to sleep 9 people, not to mention a fire hazard. We were farmed out to two separate hotels for the duration of our stay. Yes. packing , unpacking 9 people over and over again is loads of fun. The Town and Country Resort was, of course, supposed to pay for these hotels. Right...No, I just had all the money from the last hotel we stayed at taken out of my bank account. Apparently Town and Country Resort never bothered to send over the appropriate "walk over" paperwork. After, yet again, tons of hassle, I am waiting for a refund and the management of Town and Country Resort is soooooooooooooo sorry. GRRRRRR. I will NEVER stay there again and do NOT recommend this place in the off or not so off chance they "over book again. \] /

Reviews.Title: “Jordan Gandara, bellman extraordinaire, was helpful, friendly, and went out of his way to assist me/all guests.”
Reviews.Author: CortneyAM
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Town & Country Resort Hotel, I needed medical attention and was concerned about getting to and from the hotel to an urgent care facility. Jordan Gandara was kind enough to help me locate the closest facility as well as drive me/pick me up so I didn't have to worry. He was kind, helpful, and compassionate to a traveler who was new to his city/hotel. I am very grateful for his kindness and help.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive, old rooms, nice staff, good parking, funny smell”
Reviews.Author: goober5555
Reviews.Content: Been placed in this motel twice as a result of convention booking. Looks nice, pretty grounds, convenient parking (but $15.00 per day for guests) -- But, old rooms, funny smell. Old bathrooms, no hair dryer in bathroom. Rooms basic and kind of small. Old, small tvs, certainly not flat screens or larger sizes, but most people are not spending a lot of time in rooms. Check in staff was friendly enough, but not great. However, expensive and over priced for what is provided. If it was much cheaper, would be okay, but really not acceptable for $200 a night. (plus $15 a day for parking ,plus $10 a day for internet, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled and Dimed to death.”
Reviews.Author: TeachingStudents
Reviews.Content: This is a very expensive place to stay as they charge for everything. From parking, to internet, to outrages fees to use their exercise room. The rooms are dated and the beds are uncomfortable. The resort houses an enormous convention center. The only way I would ever stay here again is if I was attending a conference that was using the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches at Kelly's Steak House!”
Reviews.Author: JDinCdA
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the positive reviews but they must have been from short-term conventioneers because this is NOT a resort! It is old and dirty, overpriced on food and a front desk manager who could care less. The HSIA does not work and I was presented with a roach at Kelly's stead house which is advertised as fine dining. It is NOT. Oh and it's an additional $14 per night to park your car there! Hotel Circle is dead - go someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Meeting Planning”
Reviews.Author: myrevue
Reviews.Content: Having planned many conferences and dinners over the past 30 years, I recommend the Town and Country to any planner who needs assurance that the hotel staff is willing to work with the planner to do what is best for the organization the planner is representing. The director of catering, Felipe Ortiz, is the most responsive hotel representative I've ever worked with. He is thoughtful to the client, asks good questions to help lay out the details, and then actually remembers the details! Mr. Ortiz's attentiveness is shared by others in the convention planning department. Conference planners: Check out the Town and Country as a site for your next conference.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel/ Poor Quality and Service”
Reviews.Author: bmoe6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very large, kind of hard to navigate around. But they did have maps in parking lots. The front desk was very friendly. We ate Dinner one noght in the Sports Bar and Grill and I have never been treated so rudely by a waitress. Very unfriendly, did not smile once, never came by and asked how our food was or asked for drink refills. We asked her a question about the menu and we received a very sarcastic attitude back. then the room we stayed in was nice it had a door with access outside to the pool. But the A/C and heater unit had no knob to choose air or heat, so u just turn it on and all night it gets really cold then really hot. Every morning me and my daughter woke up with stuffy noses and sore throats. It was very uncomfortable. Addressed my concerns to the Front Desk at check out but they just seemed to brush it off. So for the price per night which was $129, was very overpriced. Definitely would not stay there again. Very disappointed, especially saying that we stayed there 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feeling about this place”
Reviews.Author: MonicaInToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the T&C Hotel for a conference in May 2010. I drove from Vancouver, BC and I was so excited when I went to check in. Unfortunately my smiles and enthusiasm were not returned at all when I got to the front desk to check in. I noticed on her name badge it said she was a front desk manager. Being a Hospitality Management graduate myself, I couldn't believe that she could not even put one smile on her stone face, considering that is the first rule of any guest service interaction. The grounds are beautiful and yes even though my room was a bit dated, it was still mostly tasteful, clean and bug free. I didn't like that I couldn't work at my table and be able to watch the TV at the same time. The housekeeping staff were all very helpful, friendly and attentive if you needed anything. My experience with the servers and bellboys were good too. One night they drove us and picked us up in Old Town San Diego. I had a great night. Unfortunately my health turned for the worse and I had to call an ambulance one night and be taken to hospital. When I was discharged at 4am I phoned the hotel to ask if someone would be able to pick me up. They said no and that the bellboys were busy. I had to take a cab. I didn't understand that since they drove me and a couple of convention mates to Old Town San Diego the previous night, and seeing as the hospital was the same distance away - quite close. I found that was a bit of BS. Don't understand what the problem was but they wouldn't do it. The restaurants are pricey and the buffet breakfast wasn't great. Eggs and sausages were cold. If you want a good breakfast, walk on over the The Travelodge on hotel circle north across the way and eat at Adams Steak and Eggs. Much better tasting and price. I must say though that the Town &Country makes the absolute best Pico De Gallo ever. I wish I had the recipe. On my final night's stay (may 26) the concierge working that evening was very helpful to me in arranging AVIS to pick up my rental - had to fly home because I didn't feel stable enough to drive back after the hospital. She was a blessing and I wish I remembered her name. The whole exchange was over the phone so I can't even describe what she looks like. How unfortunate. All in all, aside from the stone face FD "manager" I had a good stay, just a very expensive one even though I had a group rate. They nickel and dime you for everything. OH! one other thing, even if you purchase the internet for $10/day, you can only use it in your room. When I took my laptop to the conference centre I expected my internet to work on the account I purchased but it would not connect at all so it was a real waste of time and money for that, and of course I couldn't get WiFi with my iPhone because that would be a seperate $10 purchase. In this day and age, I do expect WiFi not to be a charged anymore. I will stay at the Travelodge next time. Free parking, wifi, and cheaper good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, outdated facility”
Reviews.Author: Legalease88
Reviews.Content: Came here on business attending an industry conference and as I pulled up from my shuttle, I thought it didn't look too bad. I entered to see a frantic and understaffed front desk that wanted to make me wait for 3 hours because my reserved room wasn't ready. I asked to be switched and they put me in a part of the hotel that was so outdated, I literally expected the guy from Fantasy Island to come out and greet me. All jokes aside, when I got into my room, it was filled with a musty and unpleasant scent, and had this creepy painting that just seemed... well a strange choice. The redeeming qualities could be found in the friendliness of the staff, from the Trellises and the responsiveness of the event AV guys during my lecture. All in all, however, if my conference is booked here again, I will be phoning in my portion.

Reviews.Title: “A little expensive for the quality”
Reviews.Author: mehudson1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice location, but expensive compared to the nicer nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant, nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: RafaelBenatar
Reviews.Content: A special mention to waitress Angelica Stephens. Her kind attention, care, and desire to please made me come back again and again for breakfast. She's an asset and deserves an award, if there is one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Great Service”
Reviews.Author: rastamo
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to come down from Pasadena to watch my son speak at his high school's graduation ceremony and stayed at the Town and Country. The staff was very helpful and the room was great with an exceptional view looking out to Mission Valley. I love all the flowers around the hotel and the way the property is beautifully maintained. There is a great tram/shuttle service that took me to Old Town and shopping. The location is just right because you can get to all the shopping very easily. My son and I had a wonderful brunch at one of their restaurants on the patio. There were many flowers, great food and a very friendly waitress. I would really recommend this hotel especially if you like a peaceful setting with access to great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: wernermaus
Reviews.Content: Town & Country Hotel in San Diego is an outstanding Experience. Excellent rooms, 4 pool and ! ! ! one of the best service teams we evver had. The Trellisi restaurant is the choice for really fine dining. The whole site is perfectly gardened. Roses nd roses everywhere! Wow! What a hotel Special thanks to Robin Davis, Pati Muklecicz as well as Angelica, Jose, Jesus, Jacinto & Lucis from the Trellisis Site

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful facilities, great location, beautiful outdoor areas for dining and recreation”
Reviews.Author: djs3612
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities were wonderful with plenty of choices for all meals of the day. The food was delicious and a nice variety. We could always find a quiet place to sit outdoors or around one of the pools, even though there was a large YMCA group there at the same time. Our room had a catherdral ceiling, which made the room feel spacious. The beds were so comfortable, we had a good night's sleep every night. One day, we needed to call maintenance and asked one of the cleaning ladies for help. She graciously called maintenance for us and then she checked back later to make sure they had come. Maintenance also responded very quickly, even though it wasn't something that needed immediate attention. Also, the concierge was very helpful when we had trouble printing our boarding passes for our return flight. Jill went above and beyond what was expected to help us. The location of the hotel was convenient for our other activites that were planned and also close to the mall, which was an added bonus. We loved taking walks around the gardens, enjoying the beautiful landscaping, even though there were a lot of guests in the hotel, it did not feel crowded. The only item we can think of that we liked least is that we would have preferred better lighting around the mirror outside of the bathroom to use as a makeup area.

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises Good or Bad”
Reviews.Author: Butchboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Town & Country for 6 days to attend a YMCA Gymnastics Tournament. Because the tournament was held on the T&C grounds, it was very convenient. The Room The room was just fine. As many have mentioned before, the room and grounds were very clean and tidy, and yes, a bit outdated. We had a standard room (2 queen beds) and it was roomy with a private balcony overlooking the pool area. Other families had a smaller room, so it may be just a matter of luck. And yes, we did have the weird picture of a young girl staring at us while we were in bed. My kids were freaked out, but it didn't bother me at all. The only complaints I have is that the showerhead is about 4 feet off the ground, so I had to bend over to get my head wet. Also the bathroom door is a sliding door and has no lock. My kids thinks it's fun to walk in on daddy during his "private" time. The Facilities The restaurants are great, but are way overpriced -- actually expensive. The deli sells Starbucks coffee at about double the normal price. The kids spent a lot of time in the pool, especially at night because it was heated. Bathrooms on the grounds and in the different buildings were hard to find and when found, they were very small (1 or 2 stalls) -- causing lines. A nice mall is located just behind the hotel with a walkway connecting the two. It was a great place to eat (decent food court) or to kill a few hours here and there. The Amenities Town & Country does charge you for everything. The rooms have no mini-fridge ($10 extra per day if you want one) which for an extended stay, causes a huge inconvenience. Internet access is another $10 per day. Fortunately, Town & Country uses AT&T for its internet service. So since I have an AT&T DSL account, I was able to access the internet for free. Internet service however was spotty and slow and there were times when I could not even connect. Parking was another $8 per day for hotel guests, but since I was with the YMCA group, I got a discount to $3 per day. Still, I'd rather pay zero. The convention area (where the gymnastics events were held) was nice. It was very spacious and clean. My only complaint about this area is that we were not allowed to bring food or drink into the area. The events were about 4-5 hours long and being able to snack on something would have been nice. Much to my surprise, there are no guest laundry facilities on site (just a dry cleaning service). The desk told us to go to the Best Western down the street to use their laundry. Instead, we googled for a local laundromat and went there since that would allow us to use multiple machines at once. Overall, my experience was good. With the YMCA group discount we paid about the same as we would have paid at the Holiday Inn. So all-in-all not bad.

Reviews.Title: “the rooms are just so tiny and outdated....”
Reviews.Author: ilasik
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at Town and Country since they were hosting a large sports competition on the grounds so the location was quite convenient. OK, the few good things.. 1. the grounds are pleasant especially with blooming roses in June 2 the food in the breakfast/lunch place was fresh and quite tasty 3. the staff are helpful esp when we would get lost multiple times navigating the large property with many buildings Now for the bad.. come on, people, the rooms are really unattractive, old and very cramped I visited many rooms in all different buildings (other athletes staying there) and they were all sort of falling apart. Many of the other families (let's just say, all the ones that did not need to stay at that location to continue competing) checked out early and moved to other facilities. We stayed in an older building that had the rooms coming out directly onto the street. There was no sound proofing whatsoever!! People would laugh, talk, walk right underneath our windows till after 12am keeping us up! The bathroom was miniscule, barely a place to put a makeup bag, the linens very washed out and rough with unpleasant blankets. Yes, it is conveniently located but no one can possibly feel comfortable in those rooms. We stayed our allotted three nights & breathed sigh of relief when we left. Again, outside the rooms - not bad, but inside.... Only stay here if you have no other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and the service was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: tophcluxc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the perfect location. You can jump on the trolley right at the hotel which allows you to explore San Diego without the headache of parking. Their employees were friendly and always willing to go above and beyond, especially one employee, Lauren Peterson who assisted in making our reservations and making sure everything we needed was taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Very courteous staff and wonderful gardens”
Reviews.Author: rfewel
Reviews.Content: We were here to attend a conference for four days. My colleague has trouble walking and the staff bent over backward to accomodate her (AJ and other bell men). They were always on hand within 5 minutes or less to pick her up at the door of our room and take her around the resort, to the nearby shopping center, or even down into Old Town San Diego. They were courteous to the max and made us feel very spoiled. I also had my hair cut in the salon and got a new style from Patti, which I like very much. There was another Pati who served us lunch at the Trellis restaurant who was very gracious. I really like the gardens with the variety of roses, foxgloves, etc....beautiful flowers and plants throughout the site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: biotch
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Town Country for a conference, I was amazed on the service I received from the front desk staff, especially Jill the concierge, she not only help with getting around town but she personally walk me to a meeting that i would have been late for.the grounds are amazing, I love the trolley system, I am looking forward to my next conference there

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Nanette08
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Town & Country Hotel in San Diego this past weekend and had a fantastic time. The hotel was centrally located so we were within minutes to Sea World and the SD Zoo. I would totally recommend this hotel; we were greeted extremely well on arrival all the way down to the crib in the room (thanks Barbara Whitlock). It was truly a wonderful weekend, thanks Town & Country!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: tomcataiken
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed staying in San Diego for years but would never again stay at this place. It is a money-hungry, low quality resort. We have to walk miles to get anywhere. When we do come to our building, we have to walk down a passage through all the maintenance area and I don't even feel safe. There is no bell-hop service to be found. We bought a package that the front desk was inclusive of internet, fitness AND SPA and parking. Turns out the Spa was closed two out of the four days we paid for and the package didn't include the spa (at least according to the spa). Also when my husband and I went to the fitness center together, they told us that the package was for one person only. In short, this is one of the most disappointing hotel experiences I have ever had and we plan to check out early. I would rather just stay at a Red Roof Inn, where the expectations are low!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful lunch at Trellises Garden Grille at the Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: nancyzac
Reviews.Content: We just had a delightful lunch at Trellises Garden Grille at the Town and Country Hotel in San Diego. Wonderful food and great outdoor atmosphere in a garden setting. Flowers and plants everywhere. Our waitress was Pati Muklevicz, who tried to UNDERcharge us, but we caught the error and everyone ended up happy. Try the Chocolate Macademia Nut Ice Cream Cake.

Reviews.Title: “Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: ericjdonovan
