Reviews.Content: I first heard of the Town and Country via a friend whom I asked for an affordable hotel recommendation. Our friend recommended contacting Barbara Whitlock at T&C. Barbara was fantastic in booking our hotel room and was able to accommodate several room/date changes on our end. My girlfriend and I were in town for the San Diego Rock and Roll Marathon (She ran, I cheered). We had a great time in San Diego and a great experience at the Town and Country. Check-in was incredibly quick and easy (no line or wait). The rooms were simple yet very clean. For us, the best part of the hotel was the convenience (less than 5 minute walk) to the Trolley which provided us with easy access to Old Town, the Convention Center/Race Expo, and the Rock and Roll Finish Line. I would definitely stay at the T&C again.

Reviews.Title: “wonder, restive night!”
Reviews.Author: woolyone
Reviews.Content: I went on a spur of the moment trip to San Diego. My sister reccomeded this place to me and I went sight unseen. It was a wonderful evening. I would plan on spending more time here next visit. The resort is centraly located and and nearby to so many great attractions. I have breakfast in the cafe and the buffet was delicious. The gounds are lovely and I enjoyed an evening stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: dispensing
Reviews.Content: I was here last year with my church group but I didn't get the same service that I got this time. When I check in at the desk I told Lisa I didn't get the room that I wanted last year, so she apologized to me and she went to get the manager Nancy to find me a nice room. It took Nancy almost 15mins to get the room that I want, I really appreciated. While I was waiting for my room, I found that the front desk people are very friendly and pleasant, they all try to ask me if I am waiting for help. Leah, Jamie and Donna, they all look so professional with their smile on their face. I had been to other hotel that charge me more but I never had this welcome feeling like in Town and country. Even my hotel room is quite far away but I don't mind to walk because every single corner I walk by, I see pretty flowers and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: No1HoneymoonPlanner
Reviews.Content: While attending a conference at the hotel, I thought I had lost my anniversary ring in the narrow space between the vanity and the wall. After searching everywhere, I finally asked for help from the maintenance staff. Even though I was not absolutely positive the ring had fallen into this space, the crew (thank you, Katie, Marcus, Greg and Jose!!) cheerfully spent hours searching and eventually removing and replacing the whole fixture. They knew I was devastated, and Katie kept my spirits up and vowed not to give up looking. Unfortunately, the ring was not found. But Marcus even checked with me the next day to find out if it had turned up. The attention and concern of this crew was above and beyond expectation and I was touched by their kindness. Oh, and the ring? I had left it at home! The Town & Country is very pleasant resort with beautiful grounds, and our conference facilities were excellent. But it is the staff that will bring me back to visit and to recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hard as a rock beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: losdukes
Reviews.Content: I got to say, I was getting away from the LA buzz for a weekend with my family. I booked this hotel, thinking that it was going to be a good relaxing experience. We checking in on Saturday. I had booked two queen-size beds. When we opened the door, it was a one king size bed. I called the front desk and was told they would provice a roll-out...'free of charge'...hahahha. I would have appreciated them telling me that they had given me a different room and they were going to adjust the price. But I had to find out for myself and they didn't even offer to reimburse the difference. They though I wouldn't have noticed it!!?? I wanted to watch the Lakers game, but my TV would not turn on!. Called them again and someone came by within 10 minutes changed the batteries on the remote and it worked. The picture was fuzzy. Had to go to the sports bar to watch it. After paying over $50 for a kids pizza, salad and wings, which by the way were horrible tasting, I went back to the front desk. Luckily, the people in front of us in line had the same problem. They booked a room with a king and got two queens. So we talked and agreeed to exchange. Room: Bed was hard as a rock! woke up with a stiff neck. Roaches on the bathroom. I could hear the pipes from other rooms fluching their toilets... TV:Not have good reception. Internet was $9.95 for 24 hrs, where other hotels is free. Parking: Well, we had to park somewhere and the only place was inside their property which they charge $14 per night. It's not like I had a choice to park outside or on the street to avoid the charge. The people were friendly. Food: overpriced. The only good thing about it was the mall within walking distance and the heated pool and the friendly workers (maids, maintenance, etc). I would only recommend this hotel to someone I was trying to get back at. I couldn't even take any towels cause they were stained!...darn

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip”
Reviews.Author: fsfss
Reviews.Content: As always we had another great experience except for my check out at 6:30 AM Sat May 29. People at front desk notified person in charge that I needed to check out and I waited about 5 minutes before she would come out and check me out. I was the only person at the desk and in a hurry. One thing for sure is the Trellises restaurant food was excellent and Robin and her staff make the dining experience pleasant. Rooms are always very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Signless and Clueless”
Reviews.Author: horseracingabroad
Reviews.Content: This is a very large property spread out over quite a few acres. About 1/2 of the property is one and two story older motel style rooms and the remainder is in two connected high rises. The grounds are very well maintained with palms, roses, other plantings and walkways. There is a problem with signage and room numbers. Each day in the afternoon there are scores of people walking about pulling bags looking for thier room. They give you a map at checkin but don't put up street signs or room number signs anywhere. I got lost, and so did three others of my group of six. It wasn't just me, I met up with at least 20 others who had had the same problem. The solution is simple - Put Up some Signs with street names and building numbers. The room in the motel style part of the property are very typical of their date, the 1970's. They are large, mostly two double beds and a large but somewhat dated bath. The TV's are very out of date, 19" and really only viewable from one of the two beds. Very clean but certainly showing a great deal of aging - two sitting chairs with dirty and threadbear arms, stained and thinning carpet, fixtures showing considerable wear and tear, a bath with very little water pressure and no fan (there was a window that is left openned that is 1 foot from the opposite wall,) My stay was on a Friday and Saturday night. On the first night it was very quiet but on the second night, the Saturday, the hotel, which appears to host a great deal of group and convention business, was having an incentive event on a central plaza, next to the pool. The event looked to be set up for a large outside group and included a DJ complete with six foot high speakers. He started to play 100dba music about 8:00pm and it could be heard in all rooms in the hotel. Although my room was not that close to the pool I was totally unable to hear my TV with the door and windows closed, nor could I have attempted to sleep. A call to the front desk let it be know that the group had booked until 12:00 but that the group would turn down the music at 10:00. At 9:45 I walked to the pool to view where the noise was coming from. To my surprise the DJ and his equipment was playing for a group of two people. The other six people at the party were inside a building WITH THE DOORS CLOSED. The property could have done much to mitigate this serious annoyance. Move it inside - move the location - not agree to 100dba music after 9:00 - This hotel did nothing, He, the DJ thought that soft music wass Micheal Jackson - "Beat It" was his quiet song at 11pm. The hotel has five restaurants - gives away two free drinks per person per day as well as a free buffet breakfast. I tried four of the five - the buffet breakfast was just plain awful, poor quality food, cold hot food and terrible service, although it was listed at $14.50 per person it would not have sold any if not given away free. The Trellis restaurant was better for the next breakfast with so so food but good service. I had a pizza in the sports bar which was a heated frozen one and my other dinner was in their steak house, not worth much at all except with both dinners I had my free drinks. The level of service at both was good - the quality about as bad as it could have been. The hotel charges $8.00/ car /day for motel style parking away from your building - a serious rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hospitality and service”
Reviews.Author: LizC_2010
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego from overseas for a conference. I received great hospitality at the hotel. I especially received great hospitality from Steve and Jordan from the bell desk, who gave me tons of information on where to go and what to see locally. Steve, in particular, was great about giving an out-of-towner great local information and making me feel at home. And every morning, my colleagues and I ate at the hotel restaurant, Trellises. I highly recommend the fluffy eggs and California eggs. Also, at the restaurant we had great service from Pati every morning. I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and colleagues. The service and hospitality was great and great resources within the hotel compound!

Reviews.Title: “Room to relax, yet close to it all.”
Reviews.Author: daniio
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at the Town and Country Resort and Convention Center to be more than I had anticipated. Besides excellent rooms and a wonderful restaurant (one of several to choose from on the property) the flowers on the grounds were outstanding. I like staying at a roomy older property that gives me some breathing room from the city and traffic. It suited me just fine, the rooms was comfortable and in some down town I walked across the parking lot to a shopping mall to people watch. I willbe staying there again on any return trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted a place to relax and find peace and quiet for a couple of days.”
Reviews.Author: dpartridge20
Reviews.Content: And I wanted to be able to eat good right there at the hotel, and I did! I work for a landscape co. and the grounds were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Elks”
Reviews.Author: jaytay12
Reviews.Content: Every other year we come to this hotel for the Elks convention and I have never been disappointed. The rooms are always clean and the property is just stunning. From start to finish I was very well taken care of, especially when booking my room. The reservation woman that I spoke to, Pesey or Piesy, made the whole booking experience nice and simple. Before getting off the phone she made sure that every detail was correct. I will definitely look forward into coming back in 2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Highest Marks for Service!”
Reviews.Author: runner1948
Reviews.Content: i have been coming to Towne and Country especially Trellis Restaurant where consisentcy is the key word. Warm, friendly wonderful sevice in a quiet and comfortable environment. one of the main reasons i go is the high level of personal attention of one of the sweetest servers Patti. SHe greets you with a smile and a hug and always has that "first nights performance". I recommend T and C and especially Trellis regulary vs the other noisy and over priced places to entertail my clients. Bravo to Patti, her staff and Town and Country. WIn Englebert Security Business Bank San Diego, California

Reviews.Title: “Town & Country's Lovely getaway!”
Reviews.Author: bettymalaska36
Reviews.Content: Well I wanted to share a bit about my stay at the Town and country resort hotel. In San Diego CA, One good thing first of all would be the location its Great. Also with my stay the greeting for front desk could not have been better, employees at the beggining of my stay seemed happy and ready to work. Walking thru the hotel property was like walking thru the Secret Gardens I think that was my favorite part. I have been thru the Secret Gardens in Vancouver BC and it reminded me so much of that secret place. Pools were great, kept up,clean, and very relaxing. We had a wonderful breakfast at the Terrace cafe seemed like to us it was a cafe from somewhere in the north part of France it was such a cute setting and the employees were outstanding full of energy. Over all would highly recommend to stay at this resort. We plan to go back as soon as we can. Hope you enjoyed this review cause you will enjoy your stay and feel just as we feel sending this message to you all!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely overpriced and underwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: imjustpassingthru
Reviews.Content: The only things saving this hotel from being rated "terrible" are its proximity to the conference center, the beautiful grounds, and the friendly, if completely incompetent, staff. That being said, here is a taste of our stay at the T&C: 1.) Internet Woes: Upon checking into our room, we were unable to access the wireless internet (which you had to purchase for $10 per computer per day). We called the wireless company service number 3 times during our 4 night stay, and we were always told the hotel was working on the issue. Despite reporting the issue to the front desk 6 times, we were always told by the person we spoke to that the hotel was unaware of the problem, but now that it had been reported, it would get fixed. Long story short: no internet for the entire stay. We were there for a conference, and having access to the web was a priority. The staff were also unable to suggest a nearby location with internet access, even though we found out the mall behind the hotel offers free wireless. Also, we were charged for internet access each day of our stay; they removed these charges from our bill upon 2 FURTHER explanations that they did not have working internet service. 2.) Dry Cleaning Nightmare: In preparation for my colleague's presentation, she sent her new, expensive sweater to be dry cleaned the day before. When it hadn't returned by the next evening (night before presentation), she called the front desk. The staff member informed her that her sweater was nowhere to be found and there was no one to call at the Dry Cleaners until 8am the next day. Her presentation was at 9:15am. The hotel refused to send someone to pick it up before her presentation, and in fact, did not locate it at all until 10:30pm the following night. She had to wear a long-sleeved t-shirt to give her talk in. They then included the dry cleaning charge on the bill (removed after another explanation). The concierge did provide us with 4 free breakfast buffet passes. When you are staying at a hotel for a business conference, you expect some basic things, dry cleaning and internet access among them. The friendly cluelessness we were met with by each staff member was astounding. Each person was able to speak with us kindly and yet provide no answers or real apology for these shortfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: dmclabaugh
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Town and Country while attending a conference. The staff were very attentive and helpful. We especially enjoyed the Trellises Restaurant which we frequented daily and Kelly's Steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: lonnie14189
Reviews.Content: Went for breakfast at the Trellis restaurant and was served by Pati. She was amazing. Not only did she put me onto an art exhibit that was only in town for the weekend; but she found me tickets; and helped me find excursions to take in the area. Pati - you are amazing. Thanks for making my trip!

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SDSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: As a local industry professional, we utilize our hotel and lodging partners for meeting space quite often. For this particular appointment, the meeting was scheduled at Trellises, a restaurant on-property at the Town & Country Resort. Not only was I pleasantly surprised by the rich decor, but also by the phenomenal service provided by our waitress. Pat Muklevicz ( I intentionally asked for her name before leaving), attended to our table as though we were her only customers, and of course we were not. There was never a glass below half-full on the table and not once did we need to look around or wait for service as she regularly and very politely checked on our table. I would recommend Trellises to any out-of-town guest or local professional looking for classy dining, great service and modest rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice time, bummer they charge for wifi.”
Reviews.Author: LavaCat
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time, dispite the gloomy weather. The staff was nice and the food was good. It was a bummer they charged for wireless. I wouldn't get close to the convention center next time as the loading docks were very noisy (1400). We would go for the bungalows next time. They were charming with the beautiful rose gardens.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: danasignsup
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, poorly decorated, and have very thin walls. We could hear the person next door snooring and they had their tv on at 6 am. The only positive thing is that it is right next to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: penmintex
Reviews.Content: The hotel has many different styles of rooms. We were in the main, largest tower of rooms. The pools were beautiful, and the hotel is very close to a mall and many restaurants. If you have a vehicle, you are close to many places to see - La Jolla, Pacific Beach, Coronado, etc. It was our first time in the area, and the stay was very nice. The only negative is one that is becoming widespread - paying a daily fee for internet!

Reviews.Title: “great service during a shaking time - ie..........earthquake”
Reviews.Author: igottaburna
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the town and country in San Diego for a meeting. Upon arriving there I was greeted by the wonderful staff and check in was flawless. The meetings went great and I enjoyed my room and the service! When I was checking out on Easter Sunday I experienced my first big earthquake! I was staying in the Royal Palm Tower on the 10th floor and it felt like the whole tower was swinging back and forth for almost a minute, my TV even fell off the stand! It was a very shocking experience to say the least. So after it was over I was all ready to go back to my hometown where there are NO earthquakes! But there was a problem! All the elevators were out and there was no way I was going to walk down 10 flights of stairs with all my luggage and items I had acquired over the few days I was there. So I called the front desk and they sent over a bellman. Steve was the bellman that came to my rescue! I canâ€™t say enough good things about the way he went about helping me and informing me about the quake and what had happened at the hotel. I felt bad not being able to carry more than a tiny bag and watching him carry all my heavy bags and what not. But he was very nice and very helpful in getting all my stuff out to my car and getting me on my way. Its people like him and the rest of the wonderful staff at the town and country that will keep me coming back whenever I am in the San Diego area. So if you were thinking about a place to stay when youâ€™re in San Diego, please give town and country a try. You wonâ€™t be disappointed! One Happy Guest! -Sean

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: bwanabob37
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was pleasant and efficient and out three young granddaughters had the time of their life with the "pet" ducks and at the pool. Our breakfast at Trellis' Restaurant was the highlight with friendly service from Pat and the food and ambiance was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Service and beauty are blended here.”
Reviews.Author: marykathleen50
Reviews.Content: Town and Country Resort is on a busy, noisy freeway on hotel row, but its grounds are quiet and elegant, almost with a 1950s feel. I expected to see Janet Leigh in something white sitting poolside. The outstanding service was highlighted by Angelica Stephens, my waitperson at breakfast every morning in The Trellis Restaurant. The morning I presented she slipped me peppermints and an extra muffin "to go", plus promises of prayers. My room, though small, was cozy and quiet with several nice touches. Our conference facilities were excellent and the lunches we were served were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant is an excellent place for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: kpacurar
Reviews.Content: I frequently use Trellises Restaurant at the Town and Country for business meetings. The atmosphere is both quiet and private and the service is outstanding. In particular, Pati Muklevicz, who hands down is one of the best waitresses in San Diego. She always remembers her guests and makes you and your company feel like the most important people sitting in the restaurant.! Great service, quality and price. Kathleen Pacurar

Reviews.Title: “Amazed by the customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: saldude68
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and i have to say I've never enjoyed a hotel as much as this one! From the various dining options to the lush garden views, it was like paradise on the mainland. I have to say the one thing i look for the most is quality customer service. The airport had lost my bags so I was already in a bad mood before I got the hotel. But once I stepped foot into the lobby I was greeted by the wonderful Terry NG at the front desk, who definitely made me day. She immediately welcomed me & took her time explaining all the various accommodations the hotel had to offer. The room itself was clean & made me feel right at home. I actually had forgot my toothbrush so I called the front desk, the lovely Terry NG answered the call and it only took a couple minutes & somebody was already knocking at my door. Now THAT is amazing service I will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Team”
Reviews.Author: nonerightnow
Reviews.Content: Both Lisa and Nancy at the Front Desk treated me with quality service. They tended to my requests with compassion and care and made me feel as though this was one big happy family. Very impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Nick and Dime you all the way”
Reviews.Author: nnjrunner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the town and country for a conference in March 2010. First let me say this hotel is way over priced. They charge 149/night with a discount. The hotel is located fairly close to the airport and does have easy access to the trolly so getting around is easy. I would say that is the only good thing about this place. The hotel has extra charges for everything. The use of their little gym (not many pieces of equipment and gets very hot) was 10/day, parking was $14/day, and internet access costs $9.95/day, and finally a tiny bottle of water in room was $1. The should each be free with price tag on the room and all the hotels in the hotel circle area provide these things. I would have changed to one of these hotels but I was on company time and orders so I had to go where they provided me a room. The room I had got very warm at night and had no window to open and no air conditioning. My final day I had to be at the airport early and took a shower with no hot water. This place was horrible and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Very old and outdated!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: busystateworker
Reviews.Content: Once again, we were not disappointed with our stay at the Town and Country Hotel. Everywhere we went, the staff and other guests were smiling and in a great mood! When you're traveling through the hustle and bustle of airports, car rentals, and crowds, the hotel staff is welcome change! You are never left to feel like you're waiting and waiting to be served. The breakfast meals are hot and the staff frequently stops at your table to refill coffee and ask if they can serve you. The gardens this time of year are absolutely beautiful!!! Walkways are clear accessible to everyone and there are pathways for pleasant strolls in every direction. Restaurants and a fabulous mall are within easy walking distance from a pathway from the hotel and we've heard the golfing is always exceptional. No matter where we went, guests and staff were cheerful and checking in and out was efficient. To companies looking for places to hold staff meetings or conferences, we highly recommend this location!!! We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK--paper thin windows...don't expect sleep”
Reviews.Author: shaundog23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just okay. The absolutey flowers are breathtaking. My room faced the pool which meant heavy traffic--at al hours. If someone was whispering outside I could hear it. The staff was not the most cordial that I have ever encountered. When I checked in the women gave me my key--no map nor did she explain how to get to my room at this very large complex. Internet is 10 bucks a day...ouch! On a more positive note I found the main restaurant to be quite nice and there are lots of things to choose from as far as cafes and such on property. My company paid for the room but I woud not come back if I was paying on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, better choices elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: fredbrian
Reviews.Content: This place was just ok. Very overpriced. I stayed here for 9 days. My room was $147/night at the conference rate, but the TV was super small (25") and there was no fridge in the room. This place nickels and dimes you for everything ($10/night for internet, $5/day for parking, etc). This place is on Hotel Circle, so there are lots of other similarly priced options, including a Crown Plaza that apparently was much nicer. That said, we had a waitress at this on location restaurant called the Trellises. Her name was Angelica and she was awesome. She was very professional and was actually the highlight of my trip. If her supervisor reads these reviews I recommend she get a raise, because having her wait on us for breakfast was a good way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: Nittany&Fargo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country for 3 nights for a convention that was held at the hotel. While the grounds and landscaping are absolutely lovely and well maintained, the resort is sprawling and does, indeed, have a 1950s feel to it. On the plus side, the convention center had nice facilities for the exhibition, including lots of restrooms (not always a given). The hall was well lit and ventilated. The main pool was heated and the jacuzzi was very large and worked well. I do wish parents would not dump their young kids off at the jacuzzi. Town and Country sits on Hotel Circle, and is very convenient to San Diego, the trolley line, a large mall, and Old Town San Diego. I don't mind paying $170/night for a room. I DO, however, mind being nickel and dimed for every extra cost, including: $14/day for parking; $10/day for internet access; $8/day to use the fitness center (and I'm pretty sure that was a discounted rate because I was there with a convention); and 95 cents to use my calling card from the room. There are so many other hotels on Hotel Circle where I could have gotten all of these amenitities for free and at a lower rate per evening. And I could have gotten a free breakfast. The room itself was very clean. The bathroom was tiny, and not particularly well lit. As a female traveler, I absolutely hate outdoor access to rooms (as best as I could tell, none of the rooms had controlled access through a security door or indoor corridors). The balcony was OK, and fairly private (I could not see either of my neighbors, which was nice). However, I did see some rooms at the ends of the corridors where their balcony stared straight out to a brick wall. Just a weird configuration. No flat screen TV, either. How is that possible in California? I ate two dinners at Charlie's, the sports bar. The food was OK, but way overpriced ($11 for a hamburger?). The service here was somewhat surly. The landscaping and cleaning staff all seemed to go out of their way to make me feel welcome. One of the cleaning crew even hustled over to open a door for me when I was lugging a carton into the convention center. Otherwise, the service was unimpressive. I would not recommend this place for the business traveler, especially if you are only staying one night, since the grounds are so massive, it takes forever to get a feel for the lay of the land. I saw one guy wandering aimlessly at 6:00 a.m. looking for the registration desk to check out while I was on my way to the gym. I finally was able to catch up to him and help him with directions. There are too many other business hotels (Courtyard, Residence Inn) on Hotel Circle to pick this place. Even for a resort destination, you can do better. I had some free time Monday morning and was hoping to use the spa. No dice. The spa is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. And how in the 21st century, can the fitness center not have any ellipticals? Fortunately, the bike and stair master that I used worked well. The weight equipment was also in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad elements -- depends upon what you want”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Buff_BL
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some good features, but beware depending upon your expectations. The good features are: fantastic location near mall, train line, freeways to get to all parts of the city. Also good are the incredible landscaping and outdoor settings with pools, patios, trees, foliage, and beautiful scenery on the property. The beds are fantastic -- some of the best sleep of my travels. The bad is that it looks like its best days were in the Frank Sinatra era. Also, the showerheads in the bathroom are at chin level for short people (I was contorted to wash my hair and I'm not tall), and the walls are so thin you can hear every activity of your neighbors. Worse are that the TVs and cable reception are from the 50s too. Finally, we found the service atrocious. They seem to have lots of people about in front desk, bellhop, restaurants, but they don't seem to be intent upon service. I would only recommend this hotel if you are wanting a gorgeous location but don't care about quick service or idiosyncrasies of an older property. I'm recommending this as "no" overall, but it might be good for families or those who have different expectations.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice and clean. The kids loved the pool and the closness to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Pattymansell
Reviews.Content: If you have AAA you can get a great discount. They also offer 2 adult passes to any attraction in San Diego. This is a great benefit. The package also includes a buffet breakfast for the entire family. The service was not so great at the buffet but what do you expect for free.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_traveler101
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, just way overpriced. They charge for everything and no complimentary breakfast was included. Service was ok. Try across the road at the vagabond for better service at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Terry Ng was awsome”
Reviews.Author: BenPlonski
Reviews.Content: Terry Ng the really nice girl behind front desk really went out of her way to make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay There Only if You Have To”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to be convenient to a conference. The place is huge. Plan a 5 minute walk to get to where you need to go at the conference center. Also there are minimal signs, so you get lost a lot. Just try to find your way back to your room at nite. Good luck. We asked for a late check-out and they quickly told us it's $35.00. They don't even check to see if someone is coming into the room. They charge for internet, parking and air (only kidding). Had to waiting 50 minutes to get a bell hop to get our luggage and was late for a conference session. The reason they were so late? They make everyone check out at the same time because no one wants to pay the extra fee. Breakfast is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “town and country is perfect”
Reviews.Author: changocarinos
Reviews.Content: I will recommened this hotel, terry ng , josie rogers, nancy nungaryay,lisa pena,jamie sanders all from front desk very friendly and helpful, they greet us with smile. The room is clean, smell good, the flower is pretty. I will come back to town and country to see your nice and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “town and country is great”
Reviews.Author: perfectguest123
Reviews.Content: The fine dinning Tresseliis is delicious and well plan The room is nice and cool, the ground is pretty Terry NG from the lobby is helpful and resourceful I certainly will come back.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: adamquinnette
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Town and Country for a conference for 3 nights. Paid $159 a night and had Tiny room of Motel 6 quality Furniture and decor out of the 1970s 19 inch tv broken remote shower did not work $1 fee for local calls $10 for internet $35 for 30 minute late check out Surly staff (can't blame them as they must recieve hundreds of complaints a day. $16 breakfast buffet that had moldy fruit $15 to use on site gym I spooke with dozens of others staying here and all (100%) had similar complaints, including: broken window no heat or air musty odor The most frustrating part was the are Best Western, Days Inn, Marriott, and others acrss the highway for $70 a night. Friends staying at those places bragged about free internet and breakfast, flat screen tvs, etc. Save money, avoid a horrible experience. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Grill fantastic for client events”
Reviews.Author: deanridg
Reviews.Content: We had a client breakfast event on 20 February that was fantastic at the Trellises Restaurant. Pati Muklevicz, Emilio and Jesus provided fantastic service and made sure we had everything we needed for a great event. We will do more events at Trellises Restaurant as a result of the courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “town and country is excellent, terry ng from front desk is amazing”
Reviews.Author: batmanSanDiegosd
Reviews.Content: room is wonderful! Service is world class especially from the front desk

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Customer Care”
Reviews.Author: Metzropolitan
Reviews.Content: Very ritzy hotel for the price. Great atmosphere. Lovely work staff. The woman at check-in (Terry NG, I believe) bent over backwards to help us. I would recommend this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nbrecek
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in one of the cottages. The view and atmosphere was beautiful. There was a patio area and water fountain directly outside of my room. The room cost $155, plus $10 for parking, plus $10 for wifi. The room felt small and the decor was outdated. The bathroom was exceptionally small. It rained oned night which was loud on the roof and it was hard to sleep. The staff was very polite and were available to answer questions. The conference center was well organized with several maps & signs. The conference rooms were older and we were tightly packed into many of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this place was wonderful and the staff, to a person, so helpful and gracious!”
Reviews.Author: Ambrose50
Reviews.Content: My professional organization held our convention there and we had our board meeting at the facility one month in advance in preparation. Every person on site was gracious and helpful. The facility is clean, unique, and homey-feeling. Definitely worth your time and money - you will thoroughly enjoy yourself. One other big bonus is the walking distance direct access to great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hewei
Reviews.Content: breakfeast is good, and the view of our room is excellent! you can enjoy the sunshine just a few steps from your room. very friendly stuff. parking is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great respite, multiple pools, jacuzzis, shopping, movies and restaurants near-by.”
Reviews.Author: Belletower
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place in Southern California during the rainy season where I could have a "stay at home" vacation in a hotel where others would do the daily chores. The Town and Country Resort Hotel was the perfect choice. Although a large hotel site with multiple buildings, its service was excellent. We had a room key mix up that was not the hotel's fault and an affable bellman, whose name I think was AJ, came immediately, not once but twice. Room service was excellent as well, rarely taking more than 20 minutes. The rooms were spacious - we had a suite which gave us plenty of room for different activities. Out of the back door of our building is a huge mall, accessible over a foot bridge, with all the major California department stores, including Nordstrom's and Macy's, a large movie theater, and multiple restaurants. I recommend Bing Crosby's Restaurant and Piano Lounge. Food excellent; music varies; not quiet on weekends. Also to the rear of the building where our rooms were located is the light rail system, which means a quick trip to downtown San Diego. Even though this hotel caters to large conventions, we did not seem to be affected in any way (rooms; service) by the various meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great People”
Reviews.Author: BigMikee
Reviews.Content: Just like to say that your Hotel is great. Nice location close to all. Very pleasant personel working. Terry Sobkowial was extremly helpful it locating various places to eat and locations also. Kelly's Steakhouse was great and the waitress Melody was excellent. Will stay at this hotel in the future. Thank all your people as they were great.

Reviews.Title: “You'd better hope that there are no noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: FlightDelayed
Reviews.Content: I've been here nearly a week, for a business meeting. Until today, I would have given them a good review. The place is pleasant and the staff is fantastic, though the buildings and rooms are best described as a bit shabby. They are, however, clean. The prices for food and amenities are ridiculous - they charge for WiFi and they also charge $6.95 for six minutes to use the computers in the business center to print boarding passes (plus another 98 cents to print). Chintzy. However, it is now almost 2 a.m. and there is nonstop noise from a group of people who arrived today - they are according to security, all over 18 but they are acting as though they are 13. They are sitting on the balconies and hanging out in the hallways, conducting very loud conversations. They are roaming up and down the hallways and callling out to one another as they roam the property. Security - all 3 of them - are apparently running from buildling to building answering noise complaints. They obviously can't keep it under control. They refuse to ask these people to leave the property. That is unacceptable. Hotel management should not allow disruptive guests to stay. Apparently, they are so concerned with the almighty buck that they don't care about the other guests. Many of us are leaving tomorrow so apparently it doesn't matter if we are kept awake all night. But I feel sorry for others who will arrive while these uncivilized children are here. They will be up all night calling security.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Pajaro_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a conference package and expected a high quality room with good service. We were placed in a small building off to the side of the compound. As it turned out, it was nothing more than a cheap motel, gussied up with wallpaper and gaudy carpet. No fridge. No microwave. Tiny television with bad reception. Worse, the beds were horribly uncomfortable and when I complained, it took hours for someone to turn up with a pair of blankets which I could then fold up and put under the sheets so that I wouldn't have to sleep on what felt to be a slab of concrete. The pillows were so awful that my husband and I went to a local mall and bought a pair of pillows that we could take back to our room so that we wouldn't torque our necks on the ones provided by the hotel. This is only part of my experience but hopefully sufficient to keep YOU away! BTW, this is the first bad review I've EVER written. It feels like a civic duty to put my experience out there. Stay somewhere else. There are many hotels in Hotel Circle. I'm betting that any or all of them provide better accommodation than Town & Country.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at Trellises Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: roamingbubba
Reviews.Content: We had breakfast with clients at Trellises restaurant on the morning of February 10th. Our waitress, Pati Mulclevicz, provided excellent service to our group. Thank you, Pati.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service. Thanks Terry!”
Reviews.Author: mckaybailey
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with excellent service. Terry Ng answered all of my questions and provided outstanding service. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a large campus-like property conducive to conferences of all sizes.”
Reviews.Author: NancyClaire
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel that appears ideal for conferences of all sizes. The property is beautifully landscaped. My colleagues and I had lunch at the Trellises Restaurant and enjoyed the excellent food and outstanding service. Our waitress, Pati, was extremely helpful and knowledgeable with the hotel information she provided. The Town and Country is located in central San Diego with easy freeway access, has a trolley stop, and is adjacent to Fashion Valley Mall. It is worth checking out for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Terry & Josie!! Ideal location with excellent customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Mansan30
Reviews.Content: Great location near malls, beaches and downtown Old Town/Gas Lamp District. Terry NG and Josie Rogers provided phenomenal service with my two visits to the front desk. They answered all my questions and were very courteous. Highly recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: sstotenbur
Reviews.Content: After a rocky start, this hotel shined! After not being happy with our room we were moved and were delighted. The service at this hotel is exceptional, from Gladys on the cleaning staff, to Pati and Angelica at the Treliss restuarant, and most noteably, Kirk and RJ at the Bell Desk. What amazing folks! They treated us like VIP's and we aren't.

Reviews.Title: “You call this a "resort" hotel?”
Reviews.Author: travelinLeese
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a friend who was attending business in San Diego, CA. We checked into this "resort" hotel that the meeting was being held. We knew is was not looking good when you realize the hotel is planted between two interstates and the sign is the original from when the hotel opened some 20 years+ ago! We literally drove past the hotel twice not wanting to believe the hotel was the one! We checked into the hotel and after some 15 minutes found the room - in a building that appeared to have flooded and was under "repair". The first floor looked like something out of a disaster movie! We headed to the room and when we opened the door was greeted by very old, dirty blue carpet everywhere in the room, including the bathroom. The double beds were harder than boards, and the furniture appeared to be out of something from a "Golden Girls" episode! The bathroom was so tiny, you could not use the toilet without the door literally in your face or the shower curtain hanging off your head! The fixtures were outdated, the TV had little or no signal (of course, 10 years old!), and there were so many stains on the lamp shades that I thought it was a "patterned" shade at first! What hotel still has a "gold chain swag lamp" as it's main lighting? Come on - if you are going to use the word "resort" in your name, at least keep the rooms clean and updated - especially if you charge $147 plus tax per night (govt rate!)! We also went to the "casual" bar for some beers (we had to have them after seeing that room) and ended up spending $100+ for a few beers and an appetizer each! Again, the "bar" looked like we were in a Golden Girls show! Yikes. We would never had checked in, but we were so tired and exhausted from flying across the country. We woke up the next morning and checked out. We stayed the rest of the week at an awesome Marriott Courtyard across the highway for $116 per night! Run from this hotel and if your company or agency puts you up there (or trys to) be a rebel and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: FLcatgirl
Reviews.Content: I have to thank Barbara Whitlock for recommending this hotel to me. The staff went above and beyond to help us when our incoming flight from LA was cancelled and the shuttle abandoned us at San Diego International at 2:00 a.m. The night manager Karen made arrangements for us to be picked up and greeted us with a big smile when we finally arrived. Our driver was friendly and helpful as well. The wait staff at the cafe were extremely friendly and courteous. I was impressed by the size of our room and all of the amenities included. The grounds were beautifully maintained. I found travel around the city to be quite easy from the hotel as I-8 and 163 had easy access on and off right nearby. I would definitely stay at the Town and Country on my next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceMary
Reviews.Content: The decor is our rather large room was exquisite. We appreciated the two sinks - one was outside the bath area. We had many soft white towel and a spotless accomadation. The service, from the check-in until they came to our room to take us to the main lobby in a golf cart, was superb. These two people went out of their way in a happy way to help us in anyway they could. We did not see the maid - we had every thing we needed. However, we were in sunny California and had heavy rain for the three days that we were there!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and elegant”
Reviews.Author: sawdustandcinderella
Reviews.Content: Barbara made a reservation for me when we mentioned we needed a place to stay for the night for my grandfather's funeral. The most important thing about a hotel, is sleep. Considering all that had happened, I doubted I was going to sleep. I've been in other hotels, where the beds were so extremely uncomfortable, to the point that I would rather sleep on the floor. The bed was really comfortable and thankfully I slept well! I'm so glad they didn't have those annoying pillow top memory foam things on the bed. I remember commenting to my husband about the bed furniture, and how I always wanted one just like it. There was an elegant flare to the room. From the wallpaper, to the armoire, to the chair that reminded me so much of my grandfather's favorite chair... Everything in it's place. The ac/heat worked, which, it was raining at the time, so of course, I was very glad it worked!! A beautiful pool, great sights...a nice patio area, hot water. Though, I did drink from the coffee machine with the coffee they give you... it wasn't all that great. I think that's my only complaint. I would stay at the Town and Country again if given the chance. I would just make sure I brought my own coffee. :D Thanks Barbara for reserving a room for me!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: MillieBarr
Reviews.Content: Patti and Jose at the Trellis were GREAT. Happy to share local information for "down time" from the conference. Excellent service and the food was FAB!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, a step back in time”
Reviews.Author: kingsley5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the T&C a few times, for a genetics conference that is held there each year. The property is quite expansive (>40 acres), beautifully landscaped, and if traveling for personal vacation there are a variety of different room options which would be attractive, including cabana-style options near one of the pools. The staff is very friendly; we had a wonderful waitress at one of the breakfast places, named Pati Muklevicz. Overall, a nice place though I should warn that the room decor for the rooms I have stayed in (usually one of the towers) is right out of the 70's, which may or may not be appealing. It is near a golf course as well as a nice, huge mall which has a number of restaurants. Overall a good place to have a conference and take a family as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceperry423
Reviews.Content: The Resort was excellent. It had nice pools, several restaurant options, a fitness center. It was clean and the people were nice. Pati Muklevicz, a server at one of the restaurants (the Trellaces I believe it was called) was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service”
Reviews.Author: pepperUsa
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful especially Pati Muklevics from the Trellises restaurant. I had a special order for my breakfast and she made it happen

Reviews.Title: “International visitors love the Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: SpeakerSanDiegoCA
Reviews.Content: We arrange housing for over 400 international emerging leaders from over 120 countries for the past 30 years and often place them at the Town and Country during their stay in San Diego. They love it! Nice big grounds with lovely vegetaion with a staff that makes them feel at home. -Cath DeStefano, Executive Director, Citizen Diplomacy Council of San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Freindly, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGW
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here during Christmas vacation. The room was clean & spacious. Heating/Air Conditioning worked well (it was warm in the day and cool at night). Staff were friendly and professional. The grounds are well maintained. I had breakfast at the Terrace Cafe each day. Lots of variety. Kelly's steakhouse was disappointing. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “extremely friendly, with rooms that make you feel like home.”
Reviews.Author: bryguy215
Reviews.Content: stepping into the check in area of the resort i was greeted with nothing but smiles. It was extremely easy to find my room on such a large spread of land. The room was super inviting and comfy to simply lounge. The resort itself had tons to offer and even just walking around at night was enjoyable. The late night drink spots were a pleasure to find and the bartenders there were very enjoyable. All around i have no complaints and would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointed this year”
Reviews.Author: 50statestraveler
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel for probably 40 years. I started when I was a child. As a matter of fact I wrote a glowing review last year. We travel to San Diego once a year in December to take in a Chargers game. We were very disappointed with our stay this year. The hotel was virtually empty. Several of their restaurants were closed for renovation and the ones that were open were short staffed. Both of their gift shops were closed. Our room smelled like a skunk and the air conditioning didn't work so the room became quite hot. The decor is outdated but somewhat charming and the grounds are just as beautiful as ever. There was only one person working the front desk for check in and questions. I had other family members stay there as well and they considered the place a "dump" and "over priced for what you got". I'm saddened to say, I am not sure if I will return. As we traveled to the Charger game along the trolley we were checking out other hotels along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Angelica is an angel!!”
Reviews.Author: ladyaya
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Town & Country. The property is pretty and the rooms are nice. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I especially enjoyed having Angelica as a server at Trellisis. She is such a joy. Thanks for your wonderful customer service.

Reviews.Title: “have always stayed at town &country”
Reviews.Author: paperparker1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Town & Country many times in the last several years since we have relatives in San Diego. It is in a great area, walking close to a Macy's mall & Red Trolley station that can take you practically anywhere in San Diego. We have always had excellent service, with several fine restaurants to chose from , not to mention all the great swimming pools! But the thing we love the best about the Town & Country is the grounds, with all the trees, fountains, trellises & the incredible roses! The Town & Country had us from the first visit. We hope to return for years to come! Sincerely, Barry Parker ,Los Angeles Ca.

Reviews.Title: “Pati Muklevicz was a great server!”
Reviews.Author: KABOMAGS
Reviews.Content: We ate at the restaurant within the Town and Country, Trellises, and Pati was wonderful - kind, helpful, calm, and very bubbly and accommodating. Town and Country and Trellises are fortunate to have such a superb professional.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GEM! IT'S NOW MY GO-TO PLACE IN SAN DIEGO!”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYTRAILSLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Not only is the Town & Country very affordable and convenient - I can't believe how nice and helpful every single person on the property was. And it's spotlessly clean. We picked it for it's location (trolly stop and shopping mall right out the back) and were pleasantly surprised by every other detail. The grounds, the view and the service were as good as you'll find anywhere. The price can't be beat either. I can't believe more people don't know about this resort. I can't wait to go back for a family trip so they can all really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, this is a different kind of hotel - GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: nscbanks
Reviews.Content: The poor reviews on this hotel are pretty harsh - I can't speak for the experience of others but we loved the hotel. The grounds are the most captivating... what a releif to be OUTSIDE during a conference instead of trapped inside a modern facility (which are very nice, of course, I just usually never even get to step outside!). I felt like I was actually able toexperience San Diego even while the event was going on plus the access to the trolley is fantastic! Most of our group took advantage of the easy transportation to zip around the city for dinner. The staff is amazing - they keep the place immaculate and gorgeous. The hotel underwent millions of dollars in rennovations in the past year or so and it shows. Yes, it was built in the 1950s and has the architecture of that era. If you want a slick Marriott or Hyatt or Sheraton or such, choose that but if you want a lovely resort experience with flowers and pools and lazy, long walks on the rose garden grounds then definitely come here. Food was great, I thought - we ordered room service daily and it was all tasty (the pizza one night was different but yummy!). GREAT food breaks for our conference participants and it's nice to have five restuarants on site for those who cannot leave the property - lots of options. Many of our staff had the spa experience and it was just the thing to cap off the event - another perk onsite. Most of all for event planners, the T&C sales and event staff were at the top of my list of all people I've had to work with over the past ten years. They were calm, flexible, and kept a sense of humor even as we frantically made changes and additions right up to the last minute. We are all grateful for their patience and generousity - our final session was a spectacular fall fest and a fraction of what we expected to pay. Bonus kudos to the audiovisual staff who worked with us cheerfully and generously as well! I would most definitely bring a group here again. Again, I can't speak for everyone but I think if you change your expectations (again, this is not a sleek modern spot but a fantastic relaxation getaway with lots of perks) then you will be more than pleased. Thank you again to all the staff that made our event just what we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, so-so rooms, ho-hum food”
Reviews.Author: swirlinabc
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at this hotel while attending a meeting on-site. This is a hotel that on the surface is just gorgeous. The landscaping at this site is the real star. Literally, it's quite hard to beat the landscaping for most hotels in the San Diego area. But enough of the landscaping. The hotels are functional but really in need of an update. The furniture is quite dated. For some crazy reason, the bathroom counters were too low for my tastes. The internet access had several problems during my stay. Along with the beautiful landscaping, however, comes an assortment of "critters" wandering about. We spotted several lizards and a few opossums wandering around. This could be unnerving to some. The food on site was fairly average. Pretty much what you would expect from an average hotel...nothing to write home about. Some pluses...very convenient location to Fashion Valley mall and the San Diego Trolley system. I really wanted to give this hotel a much higher rating based on my first impression, but once you get into the details of this hotel, it's hard to ignore the detractors of the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ptownpam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Town & Country twice, most recently with Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's Team In Training to run in the San Diego Rock 'n Roll marathon. Nice property, good amenities, beautiful grounds. I would definately stay here again, in fact I'd probably plan a trip to San Diego specifically to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, will certainly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: gregb1
Reviews.Content: Great experience, beautiful grounds, quite relaxing, Ate at one of the restaraunts and was served by Pati Muklevicz. Wonderful service, would definitely go again

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: LindseyMac
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at for a conference. Usually they are held at really nice places but this was a dump. I felt totally unsafe the entire time I was there. Two strange men approached me and cornered me in broad daylight on the way to my room and I had to threaten them. While at lunch we saw cops running through the grounds and a police helicopter flying above the hotel. It was dirty and looked like it hadn't been renovated since the 1950's. There were rats at the pool and the food was way too overpriced for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “More like a cheap motel than a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mk721
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at the Town and Country because of a business convention being held there. The room in the tower closest to the convention center are more like a motel, with the doors being on the outside of the structure that anyone can access. Problems: --My door was not airtight...I could see daylight all around my door. Consequently, there was a cold draft all night that didn't go away even with the heat on. -- The floor was visibly sloping and the molding around the floor had big gaps. -- The furniture was cracked, chipped, and looked like it came from a garage sale. Nothing matched. --The bed was hard as a rock. --The toilet had rust stains on it. --The shower curtain was stained all over. -- The hair dryer was cracked. -- Lighting was poor and one of the lamps didn't work. -- Housekeeping tried to enter my room at 7:45 am--way too early! After my first night, I checked out and got a MUCH nicer room at the Courtyard Marriott for a lot less money. This "hotel" is a rip off...you can find much nicer accomodations at Hotel Circle!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the room! Better conference accommodations nearby”
Reviews.Author: Neylo
Reviews.Content: The conference facilities weren't bad, but the room was a terrible value. Besides the outdated, tired style, it was also inadequate for business travel; the room didn't have a desk, enough outlets, or a fridge. They charged exorbitantly for every amenity - $10/day for internet that wasn't working properly, $15-ish/day for parking, etc. Also, check ahead before having the hotel handle packages - they charge between $5 and $25 each to receive them or hold them for pick-up (not shipping, just the hotel's handling fee). There are plenty of less expensive, better equipped hotels within close proximity. If you have a conference at this resort, look across the street for lodging. Other conference attendees checked out early (another hefty fee) and moved to the Courtyard or Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Despite visiting for business, I had an enjoyable relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: hothou
Reviews.Content: I loved the spa. My room was very comfortable. The staff was caring and friendly, especially Terry in sales. I was lost in the hallway, and she made sure I found my way to where I was going.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel-Beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: rick053
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel.Beautiful city.Historic sites.Great food.If I have the chance to return, I will.I fully recommend Town and Country resort.

Reviews.Title: “pretty grounds and nice staff but....”
Reviews.Author: travelprof57
Reviews.Content: The roses were beautiful and the grounds well kept. Also, very helpful staff (especially bellman Justin) but overall I thought it a bit pricey considering the condition of the rooms. The rooms looked old and worn out. I wish I had stayed across the road at one of the cheaper hotels where the wi-fi is free. You have to pay $10 a day for wi-fi and it was very unreliable. Service at the onsite restaurants was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, just didn't care for the 'wildlife'.”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandMartini
Reviews.Content: Sonya, of the bell station, was the first person that I encountered, as she helped my grandmother out of the car and escorted her wherever she needed to go to fulfill the check-in process. Everyone at the front desk and bell station demonstrated outstanding customer service, made us feel welcome from the very start. The room was outdated but very clean...a fowl odor was present all throughout the property, was it sewage, mold or what? Stinky in some places, and pleasant in others. *Need to know Spanish to communicate special request or needs to housekeeping staff, but despite the language barrier, Maria I. was very sweet, professional, and courteous to our special needs and privacy. The whirlpool was the highlight of this stay...large, secluded and very hot. I enjoyed a great meal at the Terrazza Restaurant, including the Tiramisu which was to die for...Jamie our server was very nice. One thing that I truly must complain about was the presence of possum, lizards, and small creatures that while I was assured by the grounds department were not mice or rats, their presence were still unsettling...not in the room of course, but outside at the tables in the garden room areas. (I was in room 3534) No one wants to enjoy breakfast or lunch in the San Diego sunshine and see a small mammal/rodent 2 feet from your table outdoors. Overall, I would return after serious room renovations and fewer animals roaming around. Service was outstanding and I do believe that they were making up for the inadequacies this resort has, which is asking a lot from these employees. I plan to send my photos to the general manager of this resort of the 'animals', and see what he/she has to say.

Reviews.Title: “Very Surreal.....this place is a 4 acre DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: drlistener
Reviews.Content: Throughout my 4 days in this hotel, I continually questioned if this was a joke. Surely, there's a punch line, because there's no way conference organizers could possibly think this is an appropriate hotel. Let's start with the positives, the bellman are very courteous and efficient. The check in was quick and easy...I'm still here so can't speak on the check out. That's about where the positives end. MOLDY....MOLDY....MOLDY...seems very unsanitary. Nothing in the room is thouroughly cleaned. The first room, had filthy broken wicker furniture. The comfortable was GROSS....no shame in how dirty it was. I couldn't stay in that room, I was transferred to a different room without hesitation. Much better rm still subpar but much better. This hotel is more like a motel. Dank, moldy smell in rooms. Hauntingly creepy picture of a girl on the wall, remeniscent of Children of the Corn. The beds are NOT comfy AT ALL. I wonder if linens are actually clean. I scracthed all night as I tossed and turned. Worse night ever in a hotel. Odd layout and design, the hotel is confusing to navigate. Went to their "best" restaurant on the property. Felt I had walked into a time warp. Same thing, MOLDY smell. Food was horrible. Very expensive. Since I didn't eat much of the nasty food at the steakhouse...I walked back to the gift shop in hopes for a candy bar to cheer me up. A snickers bar was $2.96!!!!! BEWARE: They make you sign if you check out early you must pay them $50/day that you would have been here. Makes me think they are VERY aware that this hotel is a DUMP! No only would I NOT recommend this place...I can't wait to get the hell out of here.

Reviews.Title: “Good service at the Restaurant trellises”
Reviews.Author: ST448844
Reviews.Content: Pat Muklevicz was very helpful and nothing was too nuch effort Thanks Stan

Reviews.Title: “You won't get the room you reserved, and your room will be full of mold!”
Reviews.Author: shereewolfe
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference September 27-30 at this hotel. I went along for the beautiful sites and weather of southern California. We paid the extra out of pocket for an upgrade to a "premium king bed Royal Palm Tower". When we arrived after a cross-country flight, It was fairly late in the evening. We were told that our room would be 3539..."not in the palm tower...but just as nice". The first thing that hit us as we opened the door, was the unbearable smell of mildew. I mean, it made my eyes water. As we entered the room, ready to collapse from exhaustion, the next thing we realized was that we weren't going to be sleeping anytime soon. I understand being green,,,and not using the AC except when the room is in use, but it was 80 degrees in there. That might have been tolerable, had it not been for rhe fact that due to the extreme need for a dehumidified, every surface in the room..including the sheets and pillowcases, ranged from damp to down right wet. We turned up the AC full blast, and went out for a late dinner. Unfortunately, when we got back, we realized that the AC was on it's last legs... I called the front desk, and told them that the AC needed service. When they sent the maintenance man over, he asked us why we were staying in this section. I explained that we had reserved the palm tower, but were told that these were identical. He looked at me incredulously, and said that we might want to check that out for ourselves...that the hotel was nowhere near full. I immediately called the front desk, and asked why we had been downgraded, and were still paying the same rate. I was told that there were "no king non-smoking rooms available". I explained that I was unhappy with the state of the room. The desk clerk said that she could put me in a queen smoking room in the tower. I reminded her that I PAID for a king NS. At which point she said "sorry, that's all I can do". My husband said we could try the smoking room, but I can't imagine adding smoke to mildew...not a great picture. I waited 20 minutes and picked up my cell phone and called reservations and asked for a king NS in the royal palm tower, for 3 nights...and you guessed it...They could accomodate me... The other things of note....the wall paper has gotten so wet in the dressing area from the humidity, it is peeling off in sheets. The staff in the restaurant are so desperate for good reviews, that they offer free dessert if only you will give them excellent remarks on the website...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: karreras1
Reviews.Content: Roses were beautiful and the grounds were quaint and sweet. Inside of the rooms - the blue shag carpet was gross.. There was no gym.. had to pay extra to use Gym in parking lot and that did not include use of the gym showers..????

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but on the verge of being outdated”
Reviews.Author: criticaltraveler31
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was okay, but the rooms would have to be updated before I'd swear to a return. The hotel sits really close to the freeway so earplugs are a necessity if you're a light sleeper, and the room I stayed in had very little to no soundproofing. Additionally, I could hear the hotel staff in the middle of the night rolling their carts along the outside corridor (again...ear plugs are a necessity). Grounds are very pretty with tons of roses in bloom. In general, the meals were disappointingly below average and extremely expensive (though service was very good). Blue carpeting and brass fixtures along with a polyester comforter made my room look very outdated in comparison to the sleek, simple, modern hotel rooms I usually find as a business traveler. The up/down buttons on my remote didn't work and the bed wasn't all that comfy. Concierge and Bell staff were extremely helpful and maid service was great (except that they kept putting that icky comforter back on the bed every day). And while I could print my boarding pass at the business center, web access requires additional payment (a rather antiquated conccept for the year 2009). I definitely wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay, looking forward to our next visit”
Reviews.Author: IowaDavidE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country in San Diego for two nights to do planning for a conference we're directing between Christmas and New Year's for 400-500 international students. I am very impressed with the facility. We received excellent help and service from Tom Bisesi, Tina Rees, Rhianna Cultrona, Patty Muklevicz and more. We're really looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff-Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mcarew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Town and Country while visiting friends. Overall staff was friendly and I was impressed several had worked at the hotel for 10+ years. Room was slightly dated but very clean and comfortable. Beautiful landscaping thoughout. Loved having a mall and trolley station right behind the hotel. Concierge was very helpful with trolley information and times to the downtown gaslamp area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: KaBa_9
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. The grounds are relaxing and lovely. The rooms were clean and the pool was amazing. We had a few problems with Kellys. One out of four meals had to go back and the Terrace Cafe was not even near Italian (which is what they advertise). We never got to eat at Trellis, but think that would have been good. Craig and Don at Trellises were friendly and very good at their job. We were there with friends and we all agree that we would return.

Reviews.Title: “A resort without valet parking... this first impression set the stage for the stay.”
Reviews.Author: jdlaw21
Reviews.Content: The resort is extremely disorganized and looks more like a patched work amusement park where each year they add on new rides (i.e., buildings). It was surprising that a resort could function without a decent valet service as you find yourself walking a lot to navigate the oddly laid out facilities. An additional charge for the fitness center was not appreciated and parking seemed higher than what was normal for the area. Rooms were in need of a major overhaul and the creepy children paintings in the room were disturbing (e.g., think haunted house). Except for the Trellises Restaurant, the other dining venues were seriously sub-par. Don our waiter at Trellises was probably the best part of our stay as he was friendly and accommodating. Unfortunately I cannot recommend Town & Country as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy and disgusting... I would even say unhealthy!”
Reviews.Author: Tourist100007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so poorly maintained! The first room I was placed in had black mold growing on the walls behind the curtains. The air conditioning did not work. I would describe the air inside my room as a soup of mold and the left over smells of smoke and bug poison. When I was moved to a new room (after a call to the front desk in which they offered to move me if I would pay extra!). The new room was just as bad! It smelled like someone had spilled a bottle of wine and it was left to ferment in the carpet for a decade. That is easily the most disgusting experience I have had in a hotel in the USA! I've traveled extensively in Eastern Europe, Southeast Asia, and Central America and even in these impoverished countries, I rarely had to tolerate the slovenly conditions found at the Town and Country "Resort" Hotel. Avoid this place! Do not book your group for a conference at this place, or the people who attend your conference will hate you for it!

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: gordonelwyn
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay during the Sub Vets Convention. The restruant service that Pat Muklevcz gave us was outstanding. She is to be commended for her outstanding service. Thanks to all. Gordon Holt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food and Service at the Trellises (37147)”
Reviews.Author: rjt8090
Reviews.Content: Robin, Manager of the Trellises, set up a dinner for 10 that exceeded our expectations. Having traveled worldwide, we are used to elegant dinners with fine food and service. What we were served at the Town and Country, was excellent in every regard. The preparation, from appetizers to desert, could not have been improved. The plating was elegant but not pretentious. The service was casual, friendly and completely appropriate for the setting. Robin and Don know how things should be done and it occurs in the most comfortable manner. Also had a great breakfast. Marvelous

Reviews.Title: “Pati Mulclevicz made our stay perfect and personal.”
Reviews.Author: karenspoonbarrett
Reviews.Content: Pati Mulclevicz, one of the waitresses at the Trelliss cafe made my five day stay at this hotel memerable. She was great. Pati is friendly, accomodating and personal. Her fellow employees could learn a lot about the "art" of waitressing from Pati. My negative comments about this hotel is that the Internet service is not free. The hotel charges an unreasonably high rate and the fitness center is also not free at this hotel. So unfortunatley for me, I used neither.

Reviews.Title: “The resturants are excellent”
Reviews.Author: dgklj
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the Town and Country is association with a national convention. I ate often at the Terraces Resturant and was served by a fabulous wait staff. While all servers were exceptional Pati Muklevicz really stood out as pleasent, prompt and pleasent. I would return to the Hotel and resturant just so see Pati. The entire experience was wonderful!!! Thank you so much for the wonderful 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: fitzN
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at T&C for 25 years. Rooms clean and well appointed. Restaurants are very good. Kelly's Steak House always serves very good meals at most reasonable prices. Having breakfast and/or lunch at Trellises Grille is a treat. Food very good, presentation always first rate and if your lucky enough you will have the pleasure of being served by Pati Muklevicz, an excellent server with full knowledge of the menu. Pleasant swift service with the kitchen doing their part. Hotel is right on the freeway giving easy access to anywhere. Trolley located immediately behind the hotel-a short walk to boarding platform. From the front desk, bellmen, and housekeepers, all very professional. A special note for Susie Weber in the Executive Office who always handles our arrangements with swift dispatch, going out of her way to make certain everything is ready upon arrival. Just a great place to stay when away from your home!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location for a conference.”
Reviews.Author: Fremont_GAP
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are lush and well maintained making for a nice area to walk around in and relax in, day or night. The location is very convenient to the I-8 freeway. The staff were all very friendly and the maid service was excellent. The hotel restaurants were good, but a bit more expensive than surrounding restaurants, but that's reasonable. The convention rooms were very nice. The only complaints were that the mattress in my room was too firm for me and I wasn't able to get a good night's sleep during my stay. Also the air conditioning duct blew right down on the bed with no way to redirect the air flow. Even with the fan at low speed, the breeze hitting the bed was annoying. We chose to sleep with the windows open which made for a fair amount of noise due to car traffic and the garbage truck which banged dumpsters around at 5:30 AM. Why the hotel allows garbage pickup at that hour I don't know. A later time when everyone is awake is a much better idea.

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Garden Grille”
Reviews.Author: PeteSteinberg
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was a great experience. The food was excellent and Pati, my wait person, provided outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Always our 1st choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: EquiteClass
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that each year we visit San Diego we stay at the Town and Country and have done so for years. Barbara Whitlock, the Sales & Marketing Coordinator, is simply wonderful. She is always willing to work with us patiently on our reservations and requests. Her follow through on details is commendable. Thanks Barbara!!! The resort grounds and gardens are beautiful. There are many areas to sit and relax while enjoying the scenery. The rooms we have stayed in have been spacious and clean. Be sure to enjoy a few trips to the Bella Tosca Day Spa as well!. Very relaxing! The variety of restaurants on site makes dining with family easy - there is a different option for every day! As a family traveling with children, we love to frequent the sports bar "Charlies". The kids can play games while we relax over appetizers & beverages. Our server many times this summer at Charlie's was Carol and she made our visits fun! She was great. There are many more positives to staying at the Town & Country so give it a try and see for yourself. We truly enjoy our annual stays at the Town and Country!

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure Why This Hotel Exists”
Reviews.Author: KJUW
