Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country for four nights in August for a business conference that was taking place at the convention center on the property. This is a really odd hotel and I'm not quite sure what type of traveler it is built for. Its not in an ideal location to be a relaxing resort, its not nice enough to be a good conference center, and its too expensive to be a budget hotel. First of all you have the location, on I-8 just east of I-5. While you're within a short drive of most of the San Diego area, you aren't really anywhere of interest. You're not downtown, not by the ocean, just kind of out among lots of other hotels. The property is large and spread out. Upon first look, it appears to be something out of 1960's Florida. There are several buildings and each contains different types of rooms. I stayed in the tower, which is at the back end (north end) of the property. It's about eight levels and has exterior corridors. Almost all rooms have a view of the pool below. The room I received was damp and dank, even with the air conditioner running all day. While it wasn't noticeably dirty, everything seemed to be sticky and there was a musty smell to the room. The bed was a murphy bed (pulled down from the wall). The TV cabinet doors would not stay open unless propped. There was a door that joined with the room next door that was paper thin and didn't even reach the floor. I could hear the slightest noise from the room next door, including every time the water was turned on and every footstep on the floor. Fortunately my neighbor was another business traveler, so there wasn't much noise from the room. After speaking with others who were staying in some of the other buildings on the property, it seems the tower offers the largest rooms. My room had a wet bar and mini-fridge as well as a couch and dining table. Rooms in the other buildings apparently did not have these amenities. The tower rooms also have a balcony. Even at the discounted conference rate, this hotel was no deal. Add on a $14 per day parking fee (no reason for it given the location) and a charge for internet, and this hotel is no value whatsoever. I was able to get around the internet fee by connecting to the wireless signal from the cafe below my room. For some reason that access was free and the signal was even stronger than the regular hotel signal. There are some aspects of the resort that were acceptable. The grounds are nice to stroll around (although it's easy to get lost or turned around). There are trees and rose gardens everywhere. There are also a couple pools that looked well maintained. The staff at the convention center was excellent. Fast and attentive. There is also a large shopping mall just north of the property, just across a small river and a street. There are plenty of dining options within the resort as well as a few at the mall, all within easy walking distance. But those aspects don't make up for the drawbacks or the high price. One colleague of mine said she saw a rat on the property one morning. Another checked out upon arrival when his room smelled so bad he couldn't stand it. I didn't find anything so awful I felt I needed to leave, but I certainly won't be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and easy”
Reviews.Author: goodnamesalltaken
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Hotel location makes it easy to get around to any part of San Diego. Enjoyed the outdoor sitting areas adjacent to clean, attractive rooms. Several on-premise restaurants, and Pati Muklevicz was our bubbly, charming server for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “small, smelly, overpriced even when discounted”
Reviews.Author: sunburntinsd
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights through Hotwire and regretted the commitment, even though it was supposed to be a deep discount at $87. They charged us $14 to park a hundred yards away from our room in a badly-lit road-way -- no assigned spot. The room stank like a really old unventilated house, and the bathroom had no fan and no window. The room was on the second floor. As though it weren't hard enough to heft strollers and playpens up a flight of stairs, someone had decided it was a good idea to put planters along the balcony so that we had to turn sideways every few steps to squeeze past the plants on the way to our room. Small room with no fridge, no microwave, no room safe... also no breakfast, no laundry machines, internet was extra. Very poor value for our money, we wish we had gone across the street to the Comfort Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: HockeyVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the middle of Aug for 4 nights. Reservation requested room in the courtyard of one of the pools. I confirmed this at check in. In short the room was down the hall from the pool not a courtyard room and worse the windows backed on to the parking traffic and staff smoking area. Worse yet the pool nearest to us was closed. We asked to move rooms and were given one in the rose garden. Very nice room but a walk across a driveway to the operating pool - not a courtyard (we have a 5 and 7 yearold). Requested to be moved to a courtyard to the pool for the next night. We were told we'd have to wait and call in the morning? Why? I don't know - don't they know who's checking out the nite before? Anyway it was too complicated to try to reason with the front desk. The second nite we were moved to a room in the courtyard to the pool!! We were happy but disappointed when the kids said that pool is freezing - I asked the front desk and she tells me that only the pool we had moved away from was heated. This info may have come in handy had we not just moved to our third room in 2 nights. In the end the kids walked 1/2 a block to the warm pool most nights. The hot water to the tub did not work right - it was extremely finnicky on how to get the magic 11 o'clock angle to get the hot water but after 30 minutes my husband figured it out. The only great thing was the bellmen they were all great and very helpful in moving our luggage from room to room and in suggesting places to eat and go out to.

Reviews.Title: “We come here every year for our Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: mmoreno24
Reviews.Content: Our family loves to stay at Town and Country resort in San Diego. We bring the whole family every year. They have something for everyone the adults have a fine dinning experience at Trellis's. The chef Patrick Kenna is amazing at what he does. Robin is always accomidating and our waiter Don always puts a smile on your face. Our grandchildren enjoy the pool and having pizza at Charleys. We will continue our summer tradition and stay at Town and Country Resort

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a vacation”
Reviews.Author: GVCA
Reviews.Content: We agree w/ the most recent reviewer in terms of being relieved by the hotel after reading some earlier reviews. The grounds are beautiful... really make you feel like you're on vacation rather than just staying in a hotel. Staff was very accommodating. Room was clean and adequate ... nothing plush, but comfortable and we had a nice view of the pool and foothills beyond. The hotel is trying to offer something for everyone ... including a dance band for the older set in the Trellise Garden restaurant and the showing of the movie, Bolt, outside in the rose garden area for the youngsters (w/ blankets, chairs and free popcorn ... they were delighted). Only bummer is the entrance to the hotel, which can be confusing because of the barricades due to the paid parking. Can be a maze to find where you're going ... but not bad once you've figured out the lay of the land. Really give them kudos for maintaining the gardens ... we actually enjoyed out stay, which was aimed at moving our son into his college apartment. Can't review the restaurants as we didn't eat there ... but we did watch some sports in Charlie's, which was a good spot for that. All in all we were quite satisfied and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Town & County...there are much better places”
Reviews.Author: jodilgold
Reviews.Content: We had a business meeting at the Town and County and were stuck there for six terrible nights. The hotel hasn't been updated for decades. The rooms are small and smelly--all our clothes now smell like mold and mildew. The rooms are in a word, awful. Ugly, ugly, and more ugly. No safes, no mini fridge, small TV from the 90s and the room keys don't work consistently. The only thing nice about the rooms is that they have balconies. The restaurants are terrible. The location is just ok. it is nice to have a mall across the street, but I have malls at home and wasn't interested in malls in San Diego. Unfortunately, the mall seemed to be one of the best parts of the trip--gave us something to do within walking distance when there was any free time. Entering the mall or any place outside of this property made us feel like we were back in civilization. The Town & Country is very old and outdated. The grounds are old. Yes there are roses....that's it..rose bushes. The pools are ok. They do blast loud music at night at the pools. For $179/night there are so many better places to stay. Stay away from the Town & Country.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.....but if you stay you'll never shake the feeling you could've done better”
Reviews.Author: TrumpNYC
Reviews.Content: Mixed bag here. The Good: - Staff is incredibly helpful and courteous. Class act all the way - Kelly's Steak House is very good. Recommended - Nice pools - Located adjacent to a trolley stop The Bad: - Decor by your great grandmother - The main restaurant is just standard - should be a little nicer - Sunshine Deli should be avoided at all costs. You're better off finding a 7/11 - Unclear and insufficient signage makes it hard to locate pleces on the property - Hotel sundries shop charges prices like a Brooklyn loan-shark. AWFUL. - No in-room fridge, no free internet access It's an OK place, probably better for families but you can't shake that nagging sense of things going flaky around the edges: a broken lamp in the room, chipped plates in the restaurant, peeling paint in some spots. You can do worse, but you'll feel more comfortable in the DoubleTree across the street I think.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Savannah-Beth
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this place, let me start at the beginning. I book at this hotel 10 months in advance asking for a room with two queen beds and on a high floor. The day I arrived they couldnt give me my booking as they were booked out so we were put in a room with one queen bed on the 4th floor and the bed was a pulldown bed from the wall at 209.00 a night. There was an adjoining door with the room next door and even quiet talk we might as well as of been sitting with each other on the sofa cause you could hear every word said. The bed was really old as were the pillows god knew when they had last been replaced there wasn't much stuffing left in them at all. We did ask for more but they were as bad as the ones we already had. the couple above us like to have sex 100 times a night and there is no insulation so lets just say they might as well be laying beside us we could hear every single movement. It was so noisy at night people running down the hallways etc. One night they rented out one of the rooms for an event and we had to listen to the loud music played there till 10.30pm at night. When we complained was told there was nothing they could do as it was booked out for them till 10.30pm. We had booked for 10 nights but we left two days early as we could just not take the noise the uncomfortable bed anymore. I was charged fully for the room for the two nights we did not stay plus and extra $100.00 per night for leaving early. After 3 international phone calls at my own expensive I am still fighting with them to get this money refunded as they say it is their policy to charge for early departure. They staff were not friendly at all and have been down right rude at trying to get our money back. I keep getting put on hold and told someone will call me back to which this has not happened as of yet. No matter what time of the day I call San Diego time I am told that there is no manager onsite to deal with this issue. Do not stay at this hotel you would do better sleeping on the side of the road. The rooms are old and in need for some furbreeze it is very noisy and they staff don't care and have no customer service at all. It really did spoil part of our holiday to America. To which I am still paying for with the extra charges to my credit card and phone calls. I would never stay here again nor would I recommend this to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: mvf906
Reviews.Content: I must admit I nearly changed hotels after reading some of the reviews on this hotel but I'm glad I didn't. Very friendly staff, beautiful grounds and a stone's throw from a huge shopping mall and tram at the rear, what more could you ask for ! Yes, the room did smell a bit but only because it hadn't been aired for a while, after the first day it had gone and yes, there are some rooms that look onto a brick wall (why they built them like that who knows ! ) but if you don't want a view and just enjoy the resort, these rooms go for peanuts ! I know you can't please everyone but it seems easier to write a review if you've had a bad experience then a good one..........

Reviews.Title: “Dusty, Creepy, Uncomfortable........”
Reviews.Author: dreaCali
Reviews.Content: After a long drive we arrived just after midnight. The front clerk nor the customer ahead of me were in no hurry to complete the check-in..... ! 14$ a day for parking, building wasn't easy to find.. Hallways were creepy with pictures of people from the olden days.. Their eyes followed you as you searched for your room... The hallway and room smelled very old! Got to our room & a pic of a lil girl in blue dress was hanging on the wall same as in hallways! Eyes also seemed to follow you around the room.. We were fine we just put a towel over the picture!!! Barely slept, creepy noises, woke up to looking out my bedroom window & there was caution tape around the pool.... Did I mention all windows open and don't have screens on them???? What happend who knows... But last thing I could do at my stay there was relax!!!!!! Not to mention the $50 fee if you cancel, we were stuck there....

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: chri5t0ph
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in a garden room which was excellent. There were two large beds and the bathroom was also nice. Its a pretty large hotel with i believe three swimmingpools and several restaurants. They are a bit pricey considering what we paid for our meals and beer in Point Loma later that week. The staff was very nice and helpful and there is a golf course next by with great rates for the guests. Also being close by Fashion Valley it is close to several malls and the tram down town or wherever is next to the hotel. All in all nothing unexpected, nice but perhaps a bit impersonal compared to a smaller hotel. You also have to pay for everything there. Wireless, fitness, breakfast, coffee...

Reviews.Title: “ok with flaws”
Reviews.Author: kindnessofstrangers
Reviews.Content: This is on the "hotel circle" which is a bunch of hotels set back from a freeway in mission valley. That sounds not so good but this Hotel has done a good job of isolating what is an extended complex from the freeway. Its a pretty quiet place with plants, palm trees and pools. Staff - they were very friendly, helpful and professional. Room - I was in the first floor of the tower block. The room was kind of elegant and very roomy and had a balcony facing the pool. It had a kitchenette but very lacked essentials like knives and forks. An issue was that the room had a connecting door and you could easily hear people next door though thankfully they werent that noisy. I think my room was part of a two room suite and so my "bed" was a sofa bed which was ok but I could have done with a real one thanks. Location - somewhat out of town but the good news is its right next to a trolley station which is very fast and takes you most places in town and is $5 for a day ticket. There is alot of parking but I came without a car. The main hassle during the stay was internet which was lousy - failed for 24 hours and was not free approximately $10 for 24 hours. There was free internet if you visited some cafe place which was pretty good for service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant tucked into this beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FrankieSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country on business all this week , and tonight had the pleasure of eating at one of the restaurants on the premises, Trellises. The food was delicious, but what really made it a memorable experience was the outstanding service provided by our waiter, Don and the bartender, Craig. Both gentlemen went above and beyond to ensure that we had not only great service, but also a great time. They made us feel so welcome! I can't wait to go back on my next trip to San Diego! F. Swank

Reviews.Title: “Great access to the trolley and Fashion Mall”
Reviews.Author: Margaritamom
Reviews.Content: 1. Check in - no line up, which was nice. We were traveling to attend the San Diego Comic Con and had booked eight months in advance into a room for five nights in the Royal Palm Tower. We showed up at 1:30 pm and were told that our room was not ready but that we could book into a Garden room instead if we wanted. We did not want to do this so my husband and daughter went ahead to Comic Con while I stored the luggage and waited for our room to be done. After sitting there for an hour and watching everyone else get checked into the hotel, I went up at 2:30 and asked if my room was cleaned. Without even looking it up on the computer, I was told that my room was ready and they checked me in. Interesting. It did leave me wondering if they tried to downgrade me and then let me sit there for a while. Either way - an extremely nice concierge (I think his name was Chris) loaded my huge luggage onto a cart and drove me to the Royal Palm Tower and then helped me to drag everything up to the room. 2. Room - We had room 1812 - very clean, excellent a/c, good size. Creepy girl picture on the wall - just like previous reports. It had a balcony that looked over the pool area which was lovely. The decor was slightly flowery for me but I liked the big mirror and the bed was firm but comfy. Great pillows. We were on the eighth floor which seemed to negate any noise from the pool and overall the room was extremely quiet even though the hotel was at capacity with vacationing families and comic con folks. Two thumbs up on the room. 3. Room attendants - good. We had clean towels every day and the toilet paper was replenished as required. 4. Pools - there appeared to be three pools on site and we were lucky enough to have one right outside of the Tower. It was a salt water pool - slightly warm but still refreshing. The hot tub was great after we'd spent a day walking around the Con. One complaint - they ran out of pool towels by the end of the day and didn't restock which made for a wet trip back to the 8th floor after our end-of-day soak. 5. Dining - there is a deli right beside the pool that sells Starbucks and pastries which was lovely in the morning as they made a great non-fat latte. They also sell sandwiches - for $9.95 I got a huge ham/cheese croissant sandwich, potato salad, a bag of potato chips and a pop. Not a bad deal. There's also a store by the pool that sells small items plus pop, chips, etc. Handy. We had pizza from room service the first night - the large family deal includes a large pizza (it'd feed four and still have leftovers) plus six sodas. We thought it was a great and took the extra sodas to Con the next day. 6. Other - one of the best things about the Tower was the proximity to the trolley and the mall. Just walk down the path, cross the bridge, check out the ducks/squirrels, cross the street - and voila. Either continue ahead to go right into the mall or up the stairs to catch the trolley. During comic con the trolley has a 'red line' which is a special trolley that went straight from the Fashion Valley stop (by the hotel) to the Comic Con - very handy. Also VERY crowded - a few times we were on there when it was standing room only. The mall was very nice - we managed to spend some money there plus had dinner at the food court one night before we headed back to our room and the pool. 7. Check out - Just a small line up but it moved fast. Room charges were all a-ok. Overall a great stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel for the proximity to the trolley and mall. The trolley stops at a lot of the touristy spots in San Diego (Gaslamp, Old Town, etc) and is handy to use. We bought a four-day pass for $15.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than sone of the negative reviews suggest - I'd recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: BevFd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful gardens, well kept. The hotel was very clean and all the staff were very friendly and helpful - especially Patti and Jesus in Trellis's Restaurant. Good food and music at Kelley's. Conference facilities excellent. Nice and close to large Mall with a good mix of big stores and smaller specialist shops. Also close to trolley service so getting about was very easy.

Reviews.Title: “could do better!”
Reviews.Author: ljhackett
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, tee-tiny room, (two of us could not pass between end of bed and t.v.) poor lighting, tiny bathroom, tub would not drain, poor, poor service at Charlie's, HUGE sprawling facility and no offer to take our bags to our room which was a ten minute walk away! No concierge on duty when we checked in on a Sunday, With so other choices in San Diego, I would not return to this facility.

Reviews.Title: “You're kidding me.....”
Reviews.Author: dannysera
Reviews.Content: If you're into 60's style rooms and surroundings then this is the place for you. Hopefully you also like dirt, dust, zero service and a COMPLETE lack of "getting it" from the staff. Want to have internet service? $10.00 please! Want to use the treadmill or other health room facilities? $10.00 please...... This place is so out of the loop compared to the vast majority of other hotels...we stay at 18-20 properties per year and this is without a doubt the least desirable hotel we have ever visited. We were stuck here for 3 miserable nights!!

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: stownse123
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference so was assigned to Town and Country. From the moment we got there...to the moment we left, it was a nightmare. Check in and check out was total madness...they don't assign rooms, so you take what you can get. My first room smelled of mold and mildew so bad I asked for a transfer. That took two days and me pitching a fit w/the manager to get a new room. Organization and cleanliness were terrible. The grounds were lovely - but that was it. We ate at The Terrace and it took almost 2 hours to get our food - then they said they ran out of the fish I ordered?! We ate at Charlie's and it took 30 minutes for a waitress to begrudgingly wait on us. It was a horrible experience - I would have left after the first day if I wouldn't have been assigned to the hotel for my conference. The work out room and internet were an extra fee?!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: viking189
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, great variety of restaurants. Friendliest staff of any hotel I've stayed in for years! Virtually every staff member had a smile and greeting everyday for my one week stay. Of particular note was the entire staff of Trellis Restaurant, managed by Robin. While the hotel is getting on in years, rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisBarb
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this hotel. The first room I was in had a horrible odor. Second room had a very tiny bathroom. Had to carry make-up in to room every day. Lighting was very poor. No drapes on side windows. Very noisy. Keys did not work very well. No signs to tell you where to find rooms. Everything was out of date. Food was so-so and very expensive. Staff was friendly but did not help, just smiled and said sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but rooms need MAJOR updating!”
Reviews.Author: kansasteacher84
Reviews.Content: The website gave a great idea of the beauty of the grounds, but the rooms will extremely disappointing. First of all, the decor was extremely outdated with mirrored walls in the rooms, blue carpet, and brass accents everywhere. The same creepy picture of a Victorian-era girl was in each room in our building, along with torn wallpaper in some. There were no refrigerators, microwaves, or vending services in or near the rooms. There were a few machines near the pools, but that was a hassle from the 7th floor. Wi-fi internet was available for $9.95 a day, which was frustrating for a business trip. The gym also cost extra money. The restaurants on site were overpriced, but tasted good. Nothing like being nickeled and dimed the whole time! Our check-in was extremely chaotic, but the staff was very patient, helpful, and calm through the entire process. They even set out coffee and cookies while we waited. Overall, the staff was very friendly, but the amenities were disappointing. The hotel was within walking distance from a trolly and bus station which is what we used to visit Old Town and the Gaslamp district. The Fashion Valley Mall was also very close, which had great shopping and some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “OVERBOOKED....UNDERSTAFFED.....WOW!”
Reviews.Author: flamingo358
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a part of a teachers group. This hotel is not equipped to handle big groups. We checked in late.....after midnight and were told that they did not have a room for us(even though we had reserved and paid for our room a month in advance.) We knew we would be arriving late and when I told that to the lady I made the reservation with she assured me it wouldn't be a problem. After telling me that we did not have a room, I asked what we were supposed to do and the lady at the front desk told me she would put us in a room but we would have to change rooms tomorrow. I didn't get it until the bellboy took us to our room and asked if he could get us anything else when we realized there weren't any beds in the room we were in. I asked him where the beds were and he told us, the sofa is a bed. I refused and he told me he could get my colleague and I rollaway beds. It was very late by this time so we accepted but the next morning we told the manager and he said he would take half off the room. I don't feel like we should have had to pay for the room at all for that night. We tried to eat at the restaurants on the hotel grounds but they were terribly understaffed and after waiting over 20 minutes to be acknowledged at one of the restaurants(Charlie's) and then being told it would be over an hour wait at another(Kelly's), we decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory(which was yummy!) The only bright spot in our stay was once we moved to a room with beds, housekeeping did a very nice job keeping the room clean. Checking out was another fiasco! There weren't enough employees working to keep everything running smoothly. We checked out the night before we were leaving so we could avoid big crowds but we ended up waiting in line for about 45 minutes to check out. Then we were told we had to sign up for a shuttle for the airport and we did but the next morning shuttles were in short supply and there was no one to direct you were to wait, etc. If this hotel wants to host conventions it should be staffed with enough people to do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, relaxing, peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: cew8087
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Town and Country. Everything was clean, quiet and comfortable. The grounds are gorgeous. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Each day at the breakfast buffet we were greeted by Mary Mejia. She treated us like family or honored guests. Her hospitality set the tone for the entire day.

Reviews.Title: “Angelica was heaven sent!”
Reviews.Author: cobalt_330
Reviews.Content: Bengt Samuelson, who oversees all operations at the T&C suggested we eat at the Trellises Restaurant. Besides the fact that the Trellises is beautifully situated among a bed of roses and the food was remarkably magnificent, our server, Angelica Stephens, was an absolute treasure. I noticed the accolade on her name badge only after being charmed by her kindness and willingness to make our table very happy. Her service was swift, attentive and very enthusiastic. She was exceptionally earnest and her food suggestions were spot on. She was able to keep all of us at my table very happy with her service even in the face of a 60 person party happening inside. My appreciation to the Bengt, the staff at the Town & Country, and the wonderfully pleasant Angelica. You've more than amazed all of us!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Melody”
Reviews.Author: wikiSanMarcos_CA
Reviews.Content: Melody @ Kelly's made our 35th Anniversary celebration even more special than it was... With the economy this was a splurge for us and her service was impeccable, delightful and entertaining.. thank you so much Melody.. The evening was great!!! The hotel was great! Clean, comfortable and roomy. The grounds (roses) were beautiful!! Thanks for a great short but sweet night!! Tom & Mary from San Marcos

Reviews.Title: “It's a Tradition!”
Reviews.Author: BosCAgirl
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the TCI several years ago for a women's bible conference and now, I take my children 1-2x a year! I usually take advantage of the AAA 2-night package, which are really great. This has been our first choice for over 9 years now! The grounds are beautiful, and makes for great morning and early evening strolls. There are 5 pools to enjoy! You can hear the drone of the freeway traffic in the distance, however, it is not terribly loud. The small gift shop near the main pool is nice to have handy. The staff is always courteous and accommodating. I cannot say that the food is terrific, however, there are some nice restaurants very close by. Olde Town, Downtown, Seaport Village, Gas lamp district, etc. are just minutes away! It's about 10 minutes to Sea World, also! Their restaurant, Charlies is usually very quiet, but I really like that! They have light fare, a small bar, a few billiard tables, some arcade games and widescreen TVs to enjoy sports or other shows while you are there. We always ask for a balcony room and have stayed in both the Palm Terrace and Regency Towers as well as some of the 2-story accommodations. The rooms are clean, and spacious. The sheets and other bed linens are always clean and fresh. I had a hard time finding the ice machine as the door to the outside landing was not marked, so I wandered a few corridors before I figured it out. Enjoy for yourself! It might become a tradition!

Reviews.Title: “Melody at Kelly's turns a meal into a great dinner!”
Reviews.Author: TinChicken
Reviews.Content: My room was in the Palm Tower. I got the conference rate so I was expecting a terrible room. Although on a low floor, the room was nice and the balcony spacious. We had a drink at Charlies - dead as a post on a Sunday night, but friendly service. The fun to be had was at Kelly's. Our server, Melody, was a hoot! She turned a simple meal into a fun dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Gardenlover3
Reviews.Content: As an academic, I frequently stay at low budget hotels, but occasionally I am treated to real luxury when a conference is able to swing a deal with a hotel. This place is amazing! It has a golf course and a spa (wasn't able to take advantage of these) and a conference center. And it's only 4 miles to the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Gardens. ^_^ The staff were efficient and polite. I had the best sleep ever on the most luxurious king-size bed. And the roses! The resort must have a squadron of gardeners; every edge, sidewalk, building has roses in front - and this is a VERY big place - fabulous gardens, water features, and pools. If I am ever responsible for organzing a convention/meeting, I know this resort will be on the top of the list. ^_^

Reviews.Title: “Get away from it all without leaving civilization”
Reviews.Author: bubbadv
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, despite a snafu with a cancelled corporate credit card. Good food and a great waitress at the on-site steakhouse (ask for Melody and be prepared to be sassed, in the friendliest way possible). Spacious grounds with an Old World vibe and beautiful greenery, plus swimming pools to take full advantage of the San Diego weather. I wish I'd had a couple of extra days for leisure stay, but this trip was all about a technical conference.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: duskglow
Reviews.Content: I came to Town and Country as a presenter to a conference. My first impression of the hotel is that it is somewhat schizophrenic, with some of the rooms looking out onto lush, plantation-style gardens (I thought I was back in the 19th century), and some of the rooms in a high tower structure. The gardens are nice and well kept up, and there are lots of singing birds. There is no way in the room I stayed in, however, to actually open the curtains and enjoy the view. I'm sure that is for privacy reasons and to avoid giving people outside a show, but I would have liked to have been trusted to do the right thing. Seems like a wasted garden. As I mentioned, the decor is, to be charitable, somewhat retro. This, I'm sure, appeals to people who like that sort of thing, but it just seemed quaint and antiquated to me. Frankly, it felt Victorian to the point where I was expecting some woman in a southern-style dress to pop out of the gazebo, say "Ah do declare", and disappear into the mist. That didn't happen, but you never know. Now, all that said, this does not mean I dislike the hotel, far from it. I liked the birds in the morning (and the garden certainly attracts them), the on-site cafe has good food and friendly people (a waitress had such a dazzling smile I tipped her way, way too much), and the value for the price is excellent - with my AAA card I paid a very decent price which included an all-you-can-eat buffet. Contrast that with another San Diego hotel that gave you an omelet (ONE omelet) and some orange juice for $9. This was value. When I stayed here, it was misty and rainy, and for some reason that actually added to the garden vibe. I think this place is best in a light rain. The hotel is literally right next to a freeway. This does detract from the tranquility a little bit, but I guess you cant have it all, and perhaps that helps keep the prices down. Would I recommend this hotel? Certainly. But not to everyone. But if you like Victorian decor, appreciate a good value and friendly people, you won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe what you see”
Reviews.Author: oscaraf70
Reviews.Content: Like most hotels they post pictures they want you to see, however; they forget to mention that they also have a separate building which will exclude you from all their amenities. If we would have know this at the time of check in we would have opted out!, Aside from the 30min check in wait.

Reviews.Title: “Kelly's at the Town and Country Resort, San Diego, ROCKS”
Reviews.Author: DiverDuane
Reviews.Content: Just finished dinner at Kelly's Restaurant at the Town and Country Resort, San Diego, and everything was great. Melody is an awesome server that gave great advice on menu chioces and always seemed to know what I wanted. I ordered Bleu Cheese dressing with my salad and when she brought it she asked if I'd like some Creamy Balsamic Vinnaigrette with it, what a great suggestion. The Prime Rib was awesome, the Veggies were perfectly Al Dente', and the Cole Slaw was to die for. All in all I was amazed that a hotel owned restaurant could be so good. I highly recommend it and Melody too.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - wonderful service - super employees”
Reviews.Author: jpsval
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for a one day conference - but was overly impressed by the cleaniness, service, facitilites and overal appearance. I especailly enjoyed being served by Angelica Stephens - the best waitress in the world!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings, rooms were just decent.”
Reviews.Author: jreelfs
Reviews.Content: I will first start by saying that this hotel wasn't all that bad. I personally would not stay there again just because I don't like the old style decor, and would much rather prefer the modern design, however that's just me. The staff was excellent and extremely helpful with everything I needed, check in was a complete breeze although I was extremely dissappointed that with as many parking spots as this hotel has they still charge for parking.. But it is San Diego and a lot of places outside of the downtown area are starting to charge now. They do have patrolled access gates however in and out so that does add a little security. The first room i was given was called a garden room which sounded nice, it wasn't in one of the large towers so I figured it would have beautiful sceanary and would be very quite. Quite the opposite actually, my scenary outside my window was of an ugly fence and I could hear everything going on outside my room. The worst thing about it though was when i opened the door I actually laughed at how small the room was, basically it was just barely large enough for the bed and the television, which was horribly small also. The bathroom was like a matchbox. I called the front desk and told them I wanted a room that was a little larger and they were quick to accomodate, they placed me in one of the towers on the ground floor so I had a patio. They even sent a bellman to my garden room to deliver my new room keys, he even offered to give us a ride to the new room. Once again excellent service. When i opened the door to the new room I was given I was pleasantly suprised. The bathroom was extremely large, with a second sink and vanity area. The bed was huge and the room itself was rather large, with built-in AC so it was never noisey when it was ran. The television also got much larger to with the new room. So my recommendation to anyone preparing to stay at this hotel is to tell the staff members that you would like a room in one of the two main towers, those rooms do not serve to disappoint, and while I was on the ground floor with many rooms above me I was not disturbed my noise at all. Everything was great, the bed was even really comfortable. Just keep in mind that since this is an older hotel the rooms have older style decors. They did maintain their grounds very well however and all the surroundings were great.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: frommontana
Reviews.Content: Great location! Rooms very large and had space to invite friends over to "hang -out"! Was late for check in but they kept my room without me having to call! Pool area clean and a great treat! Freeway close but you do not know it by how quiet the hotel is! Staff will help locate points of interest to go to! I am a quilter and they found close shop for me!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful little hotels we've stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: Indianhoosier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Town and Country resort while in San Diego for the National School Board convention a couple times now and absolutely LOVE this place!!!Â  They have the best restaurants, the most gorgeous flowers and grounds, and their rooms are so quaint!!Â  We will always stay at this resort when we come to San Diego!!!Â  Pati Muklevicz at the Trellis restaurant was extremely accomodating when she heard we were in a hurry to catch a flight!Â

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful roses”
Reviews.Author: dora6969
Reviews.Content: This trip was to visit family in the San Diego area. My sister works at one of the hotel restaurants. She was my tour guide and as we walked around the grounds to get familiar with the layout I was delighted to see so many roses full of color and Healthy. Lucky for my to be there at the height of the blooming season. The room was very clean, it was quiet and I was very comfortable staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible , Old , Musty , Beware”
Reviews.Author: venturarose
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a recommended pick for a business conference. I looked at the web site and decided to sign up for Town and Country Resortâ€™s Preferred Corporate Program. I travel to San Diego several times per year and thought the web site looked nice and am always willing to try something new. The area is well known to me, having stayed across the street ( really freeway) several times at the Sheraton and the Marriott. I was surprised when a rep. from the hotel called me and regarding the Preferred Club. The woman indicated the â€œclubâ€� wasnâ€™t offered for â€œconvention people.â€� Should have been my first clue. I arrived on a Sunday afternoon and found the outside of the hotel to be clean and well kept with a â€œcountry villageâ€� type atmosphere. There was plenty of parking . Inside the Lobby , a line of about 15 people were waiting to check in, there were 2 front desks clerks. A booth for â€œVIPSâ€� was in the middle of the Lobby , with another clerk talking with a fourth clerk. Neither of these people assisted with what I thought to be quite a long line of travelers waiting to check in. It took 25 minutes to get thru the line. Hotel $ 147.00 a night Internet Fee $10.00 a day Parking fee $ 14.00 a day Fitness Center $10.00 a day Local calls $ 2.50 each Occupancy Tax $ 15.44 a day Change in reservation $50.00 Ok still with me.. Did I mention upon check -in a young person with a back pack sign-ined with an $85 dollar a night rate .. My first room was in the 3300 building, this hotel must have a thousand rooms. It looks like a few 50 year old country motels , with a high tower and a some random buildings. It is quaint, the flowers are nice and there are cute streets and welll â€¦ So I get to the two story building, no elevators. But its all good, I donâ€™t need one. The hallways are inside and dark, first floor is filled with students -the doors are open and its LOUD. A woman is screaming at them to hurry up. ( oh no Iâ€™m thinking) My room is on the second floor. A well dressed older European couple and I offer wary looks. I open the door to the worst MUSTY - OLD carpet smell. The carpet is blue and probably really old , the fabric on the bedspread thread worn. The smell is overwhelming. I phone the front desk. Oh she says , yes some â€œpeople complain about that building â€œ Back to the front desk , back in line and a new key. < I did hear one woman exclaim to another about her four poster bed in the room - I was hopeful) My next room is set at the end of the property . There is an alley way leading to somewhere near the freeway which I can hear very plainly. The out side is kinda funky cute, well worn white paint cute terrace of flowers. I can do funky , even thread worn if its clean.. Inside the room with two double beds smells like old unwashed clothes. Gross. The carpet is really stained , a white chalking smear is on one of the bed covers. A glass on a plastic tray is shining sticky. The fabric lampshades are whiteish grey and dusty. There is a dead bug enclosed in the picture frame directly over the bed. Looks like a tic. I pull back the covers and a black curly hair is laying on the sheet. The other bed looks clean so I fold away the cover and wash my hands. I wish I would have had my camera. On a happy note the bathroom is clean. Except for the wall next to the toilet where there are some dried brown drips. Iâ€™m thinking a spray bottle of cleaner , paper towels and buying some sheets will get me thru the week. In the middle of the night I hear the freeway and the guy next door snoring. Ho hum . I have read the reviews of this place and maybe if you are a VIP , there are better rooms. The Town and Country is a dump as far as I am concerned. Do not stay here if you can help it. If you book rooms for someone - do them a favor and book somewhere else. Right across the street are the Hilton, residence inn , Sheraton , double tree .. I will never recommened this place to anyone. In fact I suggest they stay away. The management is fooling themselves if they think business such as this will carry them thru. I spend about 60 nights a year in hotels and this is the worst i have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel with a very scary painting”
Reviews.Author: chocolateutah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the T & C during the holidays and had a wonderful time. We loved being right across the street from a fabulous mall. Since we were there during the "off" season most of the restaurants were closed so having a mall across the street was very convenient. We did order room service one night and were very impressed. The food and service were great. On the down side we were woken up early one morning by a work crew removing wall paper right outside our room. We also were a litle freaked out by the painting of the girl in the blue dress that is in every room and in many hallways. Her eyes follow you no matter which way you move. We finally had to put a towel over her picture so she would quit watching us sleep. Over all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pati is the Greatest - also Melody at Kelley's”
Reviews.Author: Bullneckmooseface
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent at Trellis' Restaurant. Her suggestion for breakfast was supurb. Service was excellent also. Melody provided excellent service and advice on the menu at kelley's Steak House - also don't miss the Piano Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Let Pati serve you @ The Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Travelcouple156
Reviews.Content: Besides the reunion (Red River Valley Fighter Pilots Association) we attended @ the Town & Country, having Pati Muklevicz serve us @ the Trellises Restaurant was the most enjoyable part of our stay. She was very attentive, friendly and provided several enjoyable food combinations not found on the menu. We looked forward to having "breakfast with Pati."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasBaseball
Reviews.Content: Have stayed many times and always excellent service, friendly staff and convenient food service choices.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good, but not without flaws”
Reviews.Author: deltafan
Reviews.Content: I have to say that it was a nice place with a few pools and restaurants, but I was disappointed in a few things. Mostly, all the extras for which they charged. First, they charged a ridiculous amount for the use of the business center computers. Second, they had a steep parking fee which was not mentioned anywhere on their website-I looked several times. Third, they overcharged me for my room. The service was okay, and they reimbursed me after I realized that I was overcharged (good thing I realized). The room was fine-nothing too amazing. I was really looking forward to staying here, but it was only so so.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid stay”
Reviews.Author: TimLA
Reviews.Content: Reasonable location (just off a major freeway). Nice rooms, recently redecorated - 1950's-60's construction. Excellent service. Pati M in the breakfast restaurant was very nice. Just a little noisy given proximity to freeway. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Planner's Ideal in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ConferencePlannerLQ
Reviews.Content: As a Conference Planner, I would highly recommend the Town and Country (T&C) Hotel and Convention Center. For our yearly week-long conference of 2000 attendees, the T&C is able to accommodate all of meeting space needs, sleeping rooms at a reasonable rate, delicious catering, and onsite AV. We have held our conference at the T&C for the past 15 years, and have come to feel like the T&C extended family. What I find truly amazing (and rare) is that the majority of the staff has been there for many years. This consistency is so nice for a Conference Planner, as the T&C staff understands our mission, and works very hard to help us reach our goals for our attendees. In working closely with the directors of Sales/Marketing, Convention Services, Food and Beverage, and AV, I find them to all be highly professional. They are all approachable, friendly, reliable, experienced, dedicated, and extremely hard workersâ€¦giving over 100% consistently. They are very much a â€œfamilyâ€�, which shows in all their dealings with staff and guests. When I walk around the beautifully landscaped property, every staff member that I meet is friendly and always willing to assist with any needs. I find their attitude to be refreshing, and always sincere. There are several restaurants onsite, which makes it very convenient for the conference attendees. The restaurants choices range from a fun casual sports bar to beautiful fine dining with fabulous food. There is a beautiful Spa onsite with many amenities. I highly recommend the hot stone massage, a truly amazing experience! San Diego is such a beautiful, wonderful city with many attractions, but can be costly at times, and without a car may be challenging for visitors to navigate. However, for a resort, the T&C is an affordable destination in the very convenient location of Hotel Circle, with the trolley station (and Fashion Valley Shopping Mall) in walking distance. On the trolley, you can navigate easily to many parts of the city including San Diegoâ€™s Old Town and the downtown Gaslamp area for lots of fun and good food. The world famous San Diego Zoo, Sea World, and International Airport are each within several miles of the T&Câ€¦all very convenient. If you are considering hosting a conference, training, or meeting in San Diego, I would highly recommend the charming T&C.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this classy resort with exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: AmbersArtistry
Reviews.Content: Just attended an exceptional conference held at the Town and Country in San Diego and not only was the service excellent, it greatly exceeded my expectations for such an event & hotel. This is a hotel with an "older" area of lovely cottages and gardens, plus an additional set of tower rooms. All were in great shape and furnished with great decor - one of the joint rooms in the tower had a fabulous jungle theme with very tasteful and elegant decor. The service was exceptional during all of the events: breakfast (was so much more than continental), presentation dinner (loved the chicken! & my friend loved the salmon), and all the little things in between. I'd like to especially thank Socorro Enriquez for a wonderful stay - each and every day she was there to make all of our dining experiences smooth and we felt spoiled! Thank you again to Town and Country for maintaining a lovely hotel with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Resort”
Reviews.Author: 50andholding
Reviews.Content: My wife was there on business and I wandered around the grounds. The rooms were very comfortable and the resturants were great. Trellises and Kelly's Steak House. Pati at Trellises is allways checking to see if you need anything. Very Professional! Jeff & Kathrin Fowler

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to sever Pati Muklevic”
Reviews.Author: HarrySeattle
Reviews.Content: I had lunch at the resort and was very impressed with server Pati Muklevic. She showed just the right balance between paying attention and respect for privacy, was efficient and, throughout, worked with a good and helpful spirit. John Graham

Reviews.Title: “Conference in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SactoCA2Rovers
Reviews.Content: The resort is a bit spread out, but the grounds are beautiful and it's conveniently located close to the mall and the trolley which can take you into San Diego easily. The staff in the different restaurants were very friendly and helpful --especially Mary at the Terrace Cafe, Karen at Kelly's Steak House, and Angelica at the poolside restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Mostlly good points, but some bad”
Reviews.Author: Tassie09
Reviews.Content: good: the hotel is conveniently located off of I-8 near I-5 (PCH). It has a spectacular mall across a little foot-bridge from the parking lot; it has about every store you would want (it is called Fashion Mall), there are also plenty of restaurants there including a Cheesecake Factory! The restaurants on the resort property are very nice too; great wait staff, larger and great servings, lots of variety. Pools seem nice, but it was too cold to take advantage. The staff (everyone from check-in to grounds) were pleasant. Most of the conference/meeting rooms were nice. Bad: there seemed to be a "musty/sewage" smell (I was fore-warned by someone else about this, but thought I would render my own opinion, and unfortunately I agree) in the floor above the ballroom. The bed in my room was very uncomfortable (and I am not picky about beds), it just made me feel like I was going to roll off, even when I was almost in the middle of the bed. The wall paper should be removed/replaced; the pattern makes it look like has water stains, and it is very out-dated. There was no free business center.

Reviews.Title: “check out the Trellis”
Reviews.Author: DrSam_9
Reviews.Content: Although it is much more elegant and gracious, the prices in the Trellis resturant are comperable with those in the Terrace cafe. And the Trellis service staff (particularly Pati M.) make the meal more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Dir of Sales & Dir of F&B are the GREATEST!”
Reviews.Author: rdeanstone
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed at T&C many times but this time was the best. Awesome room. The hotel grounds are beautiful. I can't speak more highly of the Hotel employees especially in Sales and Food and Beverage. If you ever think of having a meeting in beautiful San Diego, do it at Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “Are you Freakin' Kidding Me?”
Reviews.Author: FraserValleyal
Reviews.Content: If there were a zero, that would be my ranking. We stay at hotels around 75 days per year, for business and pleasure, and we have rarely if ever found a more customer not-friendly hotel outside of Russia. What do you mean you cannot guarantee a certain room? You cannot guarantee a non-smoking room, even if I book 5 months in advance? What do you mean, Kinkos 5 miles away when there is a business center at the conference center on site? What do you mean, 'we are a conference center, we cannot guarantee that service?" Is there a single hotelier on staff? What do you mean, the Sea World rate is cheaper than the conference rate, and I cannot get the Sea World rate because you now know that I am at the conference? I have never experienced a staff more trained at knowing nothing in all my travels. They were very well trained at being polite and not answering questions. While I am sure this is not their fault, who the heck is running this operation? Motel 6 is more customer friendly than this place, and less than half the price. The location is nice, the rooms are fine, the property is impressaive in many ways, but the brain is missing. I have already not recommended this hotel to several friends and business aquaintences.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDarla
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in the Town and Country Resort and I was very pleased. I was traveling for a business conference (CPC). Everything from reception, the room and coference areas were nice. I did find locating a couple of the rooms for speakers were a challenge to find. A couple more signs would be great! My room was in the back of the resort (the Royal Palm I believe). Very clean. The four poster king bed was wonderful. It is probable time for some updating - carpets, linens. I had a great view of the pool & was far enough away so I didn't hear extra noise. I was on the second floor near the elevator. The room was gereally quiet but I could here the neighboring room & they were just talking. Some more sound proofing may be in order. I ate breakfast each day in the Trellis Restaurant. Pati M. was wonderful! She greeted me each morning with a warm smile & friendly welcome. My service was excellent & prompt. The food was very good & with big portions. I felt like a valued patron. Great job Trellis Staff - keep up the good work! I will definitely come back. Walking through the resort - I was greeted with a smile & hello by all staff members. It was very refreshing. I was very happy with my stay at the Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Shelly057
Reviews.Content: While staying at the resort I was very pleased with the friendliness of the staff and their prompt service. We used the in room dining and our food arrived hot, on time and with a smile. The grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Would try to find better value for you dollar, but nice”
Reviews.Author: joyceinks
Reviews.Content: Nice Place, conviently placed- close to everything- clean but dated. Good customer service, polite staff. Grounds are beautiful, lots of trees and plants and flowers- lots of outdoor seating and gazebos. the Terrace Cafe had great cheesecake and polite servers, quick service. I had a pleasant stay. Had to pay for local calls, had to pay for internet- you may even have to pay for parking - might want to know that !

Reviews.Title: “Been here two times for a conference”
Reviews.Author: thedzoo
Reviews.Content: This a a great setting for a conference. Kind of cool wide open layout. Room were good. Clean and basic. Grounds were very well kept. Large variety of eating on site and a large mall next door wit hgood restaurants. If Coming for a conference you dont need a rental car unless you want to go out into SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant Service and room service”
Reviews.Author: JandJCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good location spread out with a variety of restaurants and things to do. The service from the waitress, Melody, at Kelly's steakhouse was great. She was very vibrant, energetic, and polite. We went back to that restaurant for a 2nd night to eat because the service and the food was so great.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated, but good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLucyLucy
Reviews.Content: Its a decent hotel, a little dated in decor. Good mall next door. Nice swimming pool. Had good service at the restaurant with friendly waitress Pati Muklevicz.... Definitely not a bad experience at all, just not the most fabulous hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: vegastosd
Reviews.Content: We stay at Town and Country between five and ten times a year and absolutely love it there. Lori in reservations is the absolute best and has always made sure our room is perfect and our reservations are handled in a very professional manner. Lori recommended Kelly's restaurant, the steak house on property and Karen at Kelly's waited on us and was absolutely super as a waitress/foodserver. We will absolutely book again and will also visit Kelly's and ask for Karen on our next visit. We were there on January 29, 2009, on our most recent visit and brought our friends from Scotland, UK to introduce them to this wonderful place :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, just HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of a conference for work and this was the designated hotel for employees. Read the reviews on here but still decided to book here because it was the company's choice so I thought it must be OK. Arrived at the hotel only to be told that the hotel was overbooked (even after calling them the day before to confirm the room which I always do to make sure) and that they had a spare room w/a roll-away bed. Asked the staff if I would be given a discount if I stayed in this "spare room" for the night & was told "NO". They made no prior arrangements evening knowing that there would be others coming who booked the hotel. There were at least 3 others who were told the same thing that they overbooked and we had to look for other accommodations. Staff said to check the following day which I did only to be told again that they still do not have vacant rooms, this was at 130p just 30mins shy of actual check-in time. Missed the first day of my conference because I had to look for hotels that had a vacancy for 5 days. The hotel made no efforts in helping with locating other hotels. HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great value and beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spice-O-Life
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine recommended this place to me and I was pleased to find it exactly what I was hoping for! My boyfriend and I needed a place in San Diego with a central location to visit Sea world and the gaslamp downtown as well. This worked out perfectly, and a cheap, quick cab ride got us to both. The hotel was very nice and with palm trees and flowers everywhere, pools and fountains, and so on. The room as well as the hotel grounds were clean and spacious. We had the room service breakfast which was speedy and hit the spot. Overall the hotel was a great value, we were surprised it was such a big place! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great and relaxing stay - as always”
Reviews.Author: jeffke999
Reviews.Content: Just finishd up a greaty conference and stay at the hotel. Each year is is enjoyable and the service provided at the Trellis by Angelica Stephens is worth the visit alone. My kids look forward th the trip each year and always look forward to the stay, the weather, th hotel and the wonderful friendly breakfasts with Angelica at the Trellis by the pool. Can't wait for next year!! Not looking forward to returning to -20 weather back home ;-(

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: enophile28
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay for a week in January every year at the Town and Country for the last 10 years (the Plant and Animal Genome Meeting). The grounds are absolutely beautiful! Rooms are comfortable and the hotel staff are very warm and friendly. I must especially commend the staff at Trellis' restaurant. My friend and I have an annual 'brunch' on the patio and have had the pleasure of getting to know the staff over the years. Angelica Stephens and Pati Muklevic, always have a welcoming smile and treat us like family. Jacinto Baez makes the best Bloody Mary in town. The light rail station at the T&C makes traveling in town extremely convenient. I know I'll be back next year and am already looking forward to it. Thanks T&C!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: cgb2191
Reviews.Content: We recently attended a professional convention held at the Town & Country Resort & Convention Center and were delighted to find the facilities tailor-made for the conference and for guest comfort. Our room in the tower was spotless and nicely-appointed (sumptuous Egyptian cotton sheets, too); the grounds were immaculate and abounding in gorgeous rose gardens. Everywhere--from the parking lot attendants to desk staff to restaurant workers--we were greeted and helped by genuinely friendly folks. I especially commend Pati Muklevicz at Trellises Restaurant, who waited on us for breakfast at our first visit, and again at lunch, when we decided to return to enjoy more of the great food and wonderful hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service- Never again”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoBigFrank
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about the accomodations at this hotel, because I never made it that far. I reserved a room in this hotel for the sole purpose of attending the Charger game at Qualcomm. Had it all planned out...arrive a little early and relax with the family, jump on the trolly to the stadium, tailgate with friends and go to the game. So we arrive at the hotel, and the front desk clerk tells me that they overbooked and they want to ship us off to another hotel 20 minutes away in the opposite direction. She wasn't even that nice about it-- not really rude, but very cold and matter of fact. She didn't really appologize for their error. I guess empathy training is not required at this hotel. She told me that if I didn't want to relocate they would cancel my reservation and I would have to find another hotel. While I'm arguing with the clerk (who doubles as a the manager, so escalation was pointless) other people are checking in. Why they got rooms and I didn't she couldn't explain. At this point of our 20 minute inmovable object vs. the irrestible force exercise, she relents and says she would give us a "walk over" to another hotel . She disappears for 10 minutes then hands me a note and says we have a reservation at another hotel. By now she is rude, but little do I care. I have a room. Or at least I thought I did. 30 minutes later (the stadium traffic was terrible) I'm standing numbly in the lobby of the new place, as I am told they are sold out too, and didn't have a room for us. Well, it seems they printed the wrong hotel on my 'walk over' letter and my new, new hotel was back in the other direction. I won't bore you with the rest of my ordeal, but suffice it to say the folks at the C*urtyard by M*rriot in Mission Valley are super nice, and they indeed have attended empathy training (ya gotta love freebies). I won't be recommending the Town and Country to anyone anytime soon (ever actually)

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: jarbra15
Reviews.Content: This is one huge hotel. You need a map just to find your way around. I stayed in one of the older motel quality rooms which was extremely small and across from a conference center. The beds were comfortable, the TV was horrible. The decor was really old fashioned. The hotel staff could give a darn if you are sleeping at 5:30 in the morning as they are banging stuff around, whistling ect. This happened every morning. There is no complimentary breakfast but there are restaurants on the premises. The price is high for what you get. You pay for parking and internet which makes the price of a room considerably more. The location is convienient especially to the San Diego Transit system a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Party Ever”
Reviews.Author: sdepascl
Reviews.Content: My husband's company holiday party was held at the Town and Country hotel this past Saturday evening in Trellises and it was the best party ever, from the room, decor, bar service, entertainment, delicious food and friendly staff - everything was perfect!! Our server Pati was always there when we needed her and Robin Davis & Chef Patrick saw to it that everyone had an unsurpassed holiday event. Everyone left talking about the details of an exceptional evening!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: flattop1950
Reviews.Content: The Town and Country Resort .was the Auto Clubs choice to stay for a romantic night. I wish we would have stayed longer.. We were in a delightful cottage atmosphere room 3506 surrounded by a beautiful garden of flowers and fountains by the pool. We had checked in at 2:30 and had some trouble with the front desk staff. The were unconcerned and rude. They told us our room number and told us to go wait in our car for 30 minutes, at that time my husband took our luggage to the bench outside our room to find out that someone else was in that room. I asked a maid to check the front desk for me and she returned and told me they said I needed to walk all the way over there to ask them what my room number was and they were aware I was on oxygen. We finally got in our room at 3:30 which is unexceptable to me. I felt as though they were not going to let us in 1 minute before 3pm, which was check in time which also propted me to me sure and exit by 11am as to not stir them up. So it was rush, rush rush. After that we had made a dinner choice and our choice was this restaurant a few feet from our room. Trellises on the property and it was wonderful. the food was the best ever and we just returned from a cruise ship, but most of all was the service. Our server Don Andrew made outr stay a positive one after the check in experience.. He is a Gem at the restaurant, with his wonderful personality, wit and attentive call to details. He made out dining experience so great, I can't wait to return to the San Diego.. Town & Country resort you made a very good choice when you employeed Don Andrew and having the best food in town. And by the way the Christmas decor was delightful and got us in the spirit of Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Town and Country Resort in beautiful San Diego”
Reviews.Author: bhakti
Reviews.Content: A great hotel and resort in beautiful sunny San Diego. Golf course, huge outdoor mall, and light rail transportation all within walking distance. Pati Muklevicz in the dining room was wonderful. Will definitely be back......

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug Alert!!!”
Reviews.Author: Costazul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a computer conference week of Nov 8th in the big tower in room 1319. Received bites on legs and arms during my whole stay. I thought I was allergic to a detergent or something but it was a row of bites. Years ago I had an encounter with bedbugs so I know how it looks like. Informed the front desk but they weren't to receptive. Nice clean hotel in good location but unfortunately it turned out to be a very unpleasant experience due to the infestation :(

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Service”
Reviews.Author: VictorEmanual
Reviews.Content: JesusCentral.com staff and affiliates would like to sincerely thank, Ms. Angelica Stephens for delightful services rendered during our stay at the Town & Country Resort. Our stay in room 3518 was all that we expected and beyond. Ms. Stephens conducted her self in an extremely professional manner and we would like to recommend her services to any and all who stay at the Town & Country Resort. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: NYdweller7
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine, Pati Muklevicz referred me to this fine establishment and she did not let me down. The service was great and the food was wonderful. This experience made my CA stay a whole lot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: BritGirlNJ
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort. Also the staff who went above and beyond to help me. I nominate Pati Muklevicz at the Trellises Restaurant for special mention.

Reviews.Title: “Average room in an oversized, sprawling complex”
Reviews.Author: TravelingManSpokane
Reviews.Content: The Town and Country Resort hotel is a sprawling mess of a hotel complex. There are modern towers and quaint bungalows spread out across the vast acreage. There are also some extremely average old, apartment-style rooms sprinkled into the mix. Unfortunately, I got one of those rooms in October 2008. For the privilege of staying in room #3714, I paid $169 for a Saturday night and $189 for a Sunday night. One earlier reviewer said this was "Motel rooms at hotel prices" and I think that nails it on the head. The hotel complex is so huge that you need a printed map to figure out where you are and where you're going and there are also maps with the familiar "you are here" arrow spread out over the grounds. My room was quite difficult to find, due mainly to the fact that the well-meaning but clueless young woman on the front desk who checked me in told me the room was on the first floor when it was indeed on the SECOND FLOOR instead. Whoops! Strike one. The room, once I found it, was very average. The bedroom and bathroom felt small and cramped. The bed was very comfortable, though although the bedspread and room decorations were old and tired. It had an old, small TV and the balcony looked out to the back side of one of the many meeting and convention facilities on the "Resort" property. I put "Resort" in quotes because, even though there are a few nice areas of the hotel complex, I felt that the room I got stuck with dispelled the notion that I was at a resort. The "view" was a joke, unless you like looking at the back side of another building ten feet away. I heard a great deal of noise from the rooms next door and below me, and even more noise from the hotel's maintenance, landscaping and housekeeping staffs wheeling their carts right outside. I had stayed at this hotel several years ago and stayed in one of the Towers, which made a great deal of difference. I enjoyed that stay a lot more than I enjoyed this one. This is not to say my stay this year was a total loss. The T&C is quite close to the Trolley line that runs east-west and is quite convenient to travel around San Diego. There's a mediocre but serviceable golf course next door and a great deal of shopping available in Mission Valley. The T&C property does have a couple of pools, but some of them are much nicer than others. The one near the lobby and one of the resort's restaurants is decent, but the one outside one of the towers is quite noisy, and there's another small pool in the courtyard of one series of rooms that reminded me of a Motel 6. Not all was average here: I enjoyed two wonderful breakfasts sitting in the San Diego sunshine outside the Trellises restaurant. If I ever stay here again, I'll have a better idea which area of the property I'd aim for and which is to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Hotel with 2 star quality....”
Reviews.Author: MyLucretia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Town & Country and all I can say is never again will I stay at Town & Country. The beds were EXTREMELY uncomfortable & hard, the maid service was not up to par (only supply towels but never really cleans the room-just dumps the trash can) , the restaurants were so overpriced & not affordable when you have children, and finally the internet is soooo overpriced..(my spouse & I had both our laptops and we were charged twice) Sorry Town & Country but your lovely flower gardens do make up for lack of up keep and quality.

Reviews.Title: “The room decor will certainly please the Victorian and flowered bedspread crowd”
Reviews.Author: travel47Seattle
Reviews.Content: The T&C is a mixed bag. I stayed there two nights for a company related function. Our organization used the meeting facilities. Overall, the rooms, restaurants and most facilities seem older and dated. The room decor will certainly please the Victorian and flowered bedspread crowd.... think of your grandmother. While my room was clean, a coworker complained to the office of black mold in the tub. It was cleaned. The banquet facilities are dated with the room lighting being only acceptable. The meeting staff was helpful and the catered lunches met our expectations. We had several questions and requests and the meeting and catering staff were responsive. Our company presentation for 80 one day and 200 the next went well. The restaurants were a mixed bag. The brunch at the cafe was $14 and below par for a Marriott Courtyard. The Steak House on this large property was a bit pricy and dowdy in appearance. One coworker liked her prime rib very much while other entrees were okay. The wait staff was helpful and accommodating. The health club was up to date and new. It only lacked an elliptical trainer. Unfortunately, admission was $8 even for registered guests. A mixed bag...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gardens”
Reviews.Author: OC_BBALL_MOM
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Town and Country Resort in July for my son's baseball tournament. We traveled to baseball tournament games during our stay in La Mesa and Vista and the hotel was centrally located. The grounds are lovely. Every morning I had coffee in different sitting areas of the hotel. The staff customer service was excellent. They were attentive and very friendly. Margaret made our reservations for the team and we were happy with her quick response to our requests. The room we stayed in was clean and comfortable. We stayed in the Regency Tower. We had dinner in Kelly's Restaurant and had breakfast in Trellises. The food and atmosphere in both restaurants was delicious! I'd recommend this hotel for families too! We walked to the trolley and had dinner in Old Town and one night walked to the mall to see a movie.

Reviews.Title: “Town and country resort great.”
Reviews.Author: ejm0808
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this great location. 40 acres of grounds, 4 restaurtants, including one fine dining that was quite reasonable. A short walk to the cable car tram which can take you downtown in 10 minutes. Golf course attached. Room was priced right and very Large, right off the beautiful pool. I believe it was a calif king bed, four poster. Great. TV could be larger than 19 inch. We expected noise from the pool but it was little used and a great place to sit for coffee or cocktails. The grounds, especially the Roses were spectacular. The Trellis restaurant , and especially their manager Robin was the nicest feature. Great meal and service for our group, and correctly priced as well. Excellent menu, you could not do better really. Fresh, on property baked goods were really great. conf no. was 18880415.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, FAR past its prime, a lot of money for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Traveler345_8
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference, and was very disappointed in the property. It's a huge facility, very poorly maintained and seriously overpriced. I only ate there for one meal, and it was barely edible. And they even charge for parking! A rip off. My room was in the high rise, and each night they had parties by the pool below, with loud music. The remote control from the TV had a dying battery, and there was a drippy faucet, and the upholstery was OLD. It was once a very nice place but poor maintenance is apparent everywhere you look. The whole place is planted with thousands of rose bushes, but the flowers were all wilting and drooping. If they are going to try to do a 'Disneyland' type of decor, they need to put a whole lot more effort into maintenance. There was junk all over the place... Stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be dissuaded... NICE!”
Reviews.Author: Rambler989
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the T&C for a conference in September '08 and was a little worried based on previous reviews. Don't worry--I had a great stay!! Although the property is a little old (I described it to friends as the resort in Dirty Dancing but I couldn't find the cool party to bring my watermelon to) but it is totally clean. I checked the usual places for bed bugs and the place came up clean. The restaurants were also really good (Kelly's was the best for steaks) The housekeeping staff was prompt and good. My only complaints are the (and they are minimal) following: -Cable was crappy (very few channels) -Drinks were VERY expensive - Comforters and top blankets were gross

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: pc_cruising
Reviews.Content: We arrived for vacation the week after labor day - as a side note, apparently this is not a busy time for hotels, and it was very peaceful and quiet there. Our room was in the towers, was clean and quiet, and was close to public transportation. The concierge made an excellent recommendation for a dinner dance cruise, saving us some money and providing a much better experience. Customer service was friendly and efficient, and the restuarants were decent.
