This is not really a resort by any modern standards-- there is no green space, just a mass of confusing blacktop roads leading to the practically unmarked buildings. There was a few small pools, and overgrown plants and shrubs everywhere. Every room I saw looked like poor colonial-style decor from the late 70's/early 80's, with loud floral prints, tons of ugly wallpaper, and loud teal carpet. The food was not real appealing either. Parking was expensive. (So was everything else, and it all cost extra) The only good thing was the trolley stopped just a block away. Overall, unless you are looking for that retro throwback experience, stay somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “This was a nice place during the Reagan administration”
Reviews.Author: Schiltkraut
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place -- about 20 years ago. There was a permanent musty odor in the elevators and hallways of the tower in which I stayed. The climate controls in the rooms are apparently there solely for the purpose of keeping the occupant distracted. No matter what thermostat setting you choose, you get a humid 75 degrees of something blowing out the vent. The grounds are huge and there are a number of swimming pools and restaurants on the property. The overall effect of the outdoor setting is actually charming. Unfortunately, there are no consumer alternatives within walking distance: i.e. no convenience markets or family restaurants to visit. Without a car, you are stuck entirely at the mercy of the establishment. It's like being trapped in Disneyland without the rides. Every beverage costs you an hour's pay. The restaurant portions were both skimpy and expensive. A club sandwhich, which consisted of four corners that appeared to have been snatched off of an hors d'oeuvres tray, was about $11 at one of the "casual" restaurants. In the way of toiletries, your room comes only with soap, body lotion and shampoo. In order to expedite my way through airport security, I decided to buy toothpaste, mouthwash and deodorant at my destination. That was a mistake. When I stayed at the Hampton Inn in Stockton, the room included a basket containing mouthwash, deodorant, shaving cream, shampoo, a razor and a comb. The Town and Country had just such a package for sale in their gift shop -- for twelve bucks! Many places have free high-speed internet access. Not so at this place. Their WiFi costs you $2.95 and hour or $9.95 per day. This is not the kind of place that nickels and dimes you -- instead, they take it out of you in $5 and $10 clumps. I stayed at this place because it was the site of a professional conference which I attended. That won't happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent Tourist Location”
Reviews.Author: jhitch
Reviews.Content: Convienent location near mall and transportation for downtown sight seeing. Courteous staff and above average accomodations. Execellent conference hotel for a corporate size gathering.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bigmomma23
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were on a college visit and were looking for a comfortable, nice place to stay that was centrally located to the Freeway. SDSU had recommended this hotel and we were really suprised at how nice it was. The landscaping was beautiful and although it is billed as a convention center, it was a lovely resort with a nice pool. The room had been recently renovated and we had a wonderful view. It was close to public transportation and within walking distance to a large mall and movie theater. It was a great value for the money. There were really nice restaurants on the property as well. The hotel employees were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: callsmart
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a travel seminar in April 07. Our stay was great. Food service in main restrurant was a little slow but they had a very large group to accomodate and I thought they did pretty well. The steak house was wonderful. There is something for everyone--a mall on one side of the property and a golf course on the other. Will definately go again when we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TheFranci
Reviews.Content: This hotel is designed very well for large conferences, but lacks any of the charm, views or convenience of downtown or coastal hotels. If you are traveling with family or on a pleasure trip, many other hotels offer much more in the San Diego area without having to worry that 10,000 conventioneers might come clogging up the lobby or restaurants around you. For the rooms at the hotel, they were always very clean, but not top quality. The sheets and bed, the towels and customer service were no better than a Motel 6 (about 100 less a night on the same block). The hotel has two major types of rooms - tower and garden rooms. The tower rooms have the advantage of being larger and having balconies. The balconies, because there is not much to look at outside the hotel all face in toward the pools so everyone can look at each other - not my preference. There is a large mall that is within walking distance, but not much else. Everything seems to be within a short drive - downtown, SeaWorld and Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it - This is a Motel”
Reviews.Author: Brownie69
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a Dump and I am not sure where these pictures come from that are on Expedia's website. I stayed here for one night based on what I saw on the website but, the Hotel is a Motel at best. I paid $155 a night for the room and when I got in the room (Rm 3664) I couldn't believe what I seen. Deem and smelly room, Old bedspread, pop or coffee strains the wall, old stinky carpet. I could've died! I was there with my 3 children and call the front desk, Kanisha was very helpful and move me to a different location of the hotel/Motel. If Expedia doesnâ€™t post this it was be by tripadvisor.com

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, not web friendly”
Reviews.Author: dtsmith
Reviews.Content: Good: nice grounds keeping, staff reasonably friendly Bad: (1) Standard rooms are below standards for a "luxury" hotel, far below. (2) front desk explained that travelocity reservations are not for luxury rooms therefore a loud room, room with poor accessibility or near the ice machine was what I should expect. (3) only one heated pool, many many children (4) Old hotel, I guess the initial construction is from the 60's. Some rooms are more modern but I did not get to see one of those. It appeared that the hotel caters to weddings and business meetings on a budget. This is not the quality of Marriott, Hilton or Hyatt. For that matter, it is not the quality of Holiday Inn Express. In summary: San Diego is a nice city. You deserve a nice accommodation to enjoy your trip. I will not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not much to love”
Reviews.Author: STCali
Reviews.Content: When you think of a balcony, you think of a view of some kind. Well, how about a view of the side of a building about 10 feet away! The other building completely blocked sunlight to our room (done in dark blue, carpet and wallpaper) so we needed to keep all the room lights on even midday. We complained and got changed to a "better" room which had the same view but beige wallpaper! The noise level was surprising and in the mornings construction crews started hammering and drilling on the floor below at 7:45am. During a lull in consturction, you could hear anyone walking on the outside corridor especially women in heels. Now to one of the resturants. We had breakfast at the Terraces Cafe. Sort of cute with white wicker furniture and celling fans. The food was average to bad, with greasy, heavy waffles and rubber eggs. Needless to say, we found other places for lunch and dinner. The pools varied in condition and temperature. Only one seemed to be heated and had gangs of loud kids splashing around. The one whirlpool was aging and the water was cloudy. We will never go back, hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to stay unless someone else is paying”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Roz
Reviews.Content: To chime in with the rest of my fellow reviewers, do pick a better place for your stay in San Diego unless someone else is paying. My employer sponsored a seminar, so I had no other option but to stay at the Town and County Resort. My room on the second floor of a two-story building must have had zero insulation, since I could hear my next door neighbor on his cell phone at all hours of the morning and evening (I was not in the room during the day). The room was terribly dated with a well-worn, navy carpeting, old bed linens and covers, all of the above of questionable cleanliness. On the day that I was to check out, I called the front desk several times to inquire regarding any additional charges and was placed on hold for what seemed like 10 minutes at a time to be told that no one could help me at that time and that there were "many other guests" who needed assistance. In short, poor service coupled with mediocre amenities equals zero appeal for any future consideration.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: teacupmama
Reviews.Content: Most uncomfortable beds I have ever stayed in. Some things can be overlooked but when you are paying for a place to sleep the beds should at least be comfortable enought to sleep in. These bed you can feel the springs and as you toss and turn the short flat sheets come out and pretty soon you are laying on the matress and the sheets are on the floor. If you do stay here bring your own bed as you will not be able to sleep on these. Other than that the grounds are nice, the onsite restraunt is terrible and pricey. They do not bother to heat the pool so it is so cold the kids turned blue as they insisted on going in no matter what. The room was reasonably clean but dated. I would recommed another place to stay. The Marriott or Doubletree or the Hyatt is a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible on so many levels!”
Reviews.Author: lkm55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 day trade show. The rooms are dated, wallpaper was peeling and they had caulked over mold in the bathroom. The carpets were stained, and dirty room service dishes sat on a table in the hall for the entire 3 days. the waiters were rude, and you have to pay for everything (internet access, workout room, toll free calls,) etc. Food was over priced, and room service takes 1 1/2 hours to arrive cold. This hotel was probably something in the 70's when it was built, but other than really pretty landscaping, it has nothing to offer business travellers or vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bindak
Reviews.Content: Summary: this hotel is not worth the price. I felt nickeled and dimed every time I turned around. I do not recommend staying there. * The "decor" seemed to be a 70's acid trip gone awry. My curtains, bedspread, and the bedskirt that was above the bed on the ceiling (? what in the world is this called?) were a green floral paisley pattern. It was tired, old, and icky. * Room service expected tips on top of the service charge and 18% mandatory tip. The food wasn't that great either. * Paying for internet connection on a daily basis. I don't understand why this isn't rolled into the price of the room?????? * The front lobby hotel staff weren't all that friendly - there were three of them standing there. I was not even given a courtesy, "we'll be right with you" acknowledgment.

Reviews.Title: “RESORT???”
Reviews.Author: sailfish13
Reviews.Content: Wow. My mom had a conference to go to here in San Diego so she booked a room at the same site. Only problem is that there was only a room available the FIRST night of the conference and the LAST night. We decided to stay the first night and go elsewhere for the rest of the time here. After reading about 50 other reviews on trip advisor I was surprised the place was packed out. But honestly most people are here for conferences and don't know any better. About a week prior to our arrival, we got an email from the hotel asking us if we would like to stay on the property for the duration of the conference. (I guess other people read the reviews too--and booked elsewhere.) After all the scary reviews were read, I was afraid to stay even the one night. But it wasn't that bad. The place DEFINITELY has a 1970's touch and SOMEONE has spent numerous hours wall-papering the place to death. I was also not a fan of the parking situation--it's like they are trying to keep track of you. First of all you have to PAY to park there and every time you leave, you have to sign out. The whole system they have for that is ridiculous. Oh yeah, you also have to pay extra for the internet. At least it's wireless. Just don't forget to get your password at the front desk when you check in. I understand the name "hotel" affixed to "Town and Country" but a RESORT it is not. Absolutely not. More like a compound. A concrete jungle. But my mom said the conference center is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler beware...there's bunnies in there!”
Reviews.Author: Minnice
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a 5 day conference and would not recommend this facility to others. ANY others! The accomidations were extremely dated and beyond dirty! There were numerous stains on the carpet and walls, the bedspreads were faded and pilled, the tiolet had stains, there was mold growing on the underside of the soap dish and the nastiest part was the light switch cover near the toilet that was wrapped with the matching wallpaper of the rest of the room and lets just say less than sanitary! The vent filter that was overhead at the doorway was so dirty that it appeared to need a shave! The docor within the room was just plain creepy. Each room was adorn with an oversized painting of a young girl in a blue dress, with staring eyes. Accompaning the girl on the creepy theme was a large white ceramic bunny with beaded yellow eyes that was adhered to the top of the entertainment center. You couldn't move it if you tried. To add to the charm, the wallpaper was coming off in several places throughout the room, and the strange curtians that were mounted to wooden blocks above each bed were covered in dust. Food on site was marginal and extremely pricey. The overall look of the "compound" was that of an institution. The service at the front desk was a disaster from start to finish and when I called for bellboy service upon check out, they never came. I ended up walking for several blocks while dragging all my bags. Security seemed to be lurking around, but the overall feel was unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: feijoa19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a work conference, so fortunately, we did not have to pay for the trip. However, I wouldn't choose this place for a holiday. The decor is very outdated, you have to pay for everything you use and often the room is not cleaned properly (lipstick on glasses). A tiny coffee maker is all you have in the room (no fridge for milk etc). However, we received friendly service and the restaurants were OK. If you're looking for a getaway, DO NOT come here. This is stricly for business.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: declanon
Reviews.Content: Im actually staying here at the moment, its a complete rip off, $10 for a sandwich and coke, $12 for parking, $13 for breakfast, $11 for wifi internet connection, which is terrible I would have a quicker connection using dial up. you have to also pay for the Gym. The decor in the rooms is dated, the outside looks like a prison, the showers are built for a 4ft person. Do not stay here the its a complete rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is expensive but the Cockroaches are free!”
Reviews.Author: Broncofan046
Reviews.Content: The ridiculous $12 per day parking fee should be used for pest control. Unless of course you enjoy the company of roaches in your evening bath. Our overall impression however was good. The room was nice, the personal courtyard outside of our room was a relaxing affect. The close proximity to our golf and football destinations was perfect. Watch out for the San Diego cabbies. We spent $25 to get to the gaslamp district and $15 to return??? And yes, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: wrecklesss1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for two days for a weekend business convention. We were located on the 8th floor of the Royal Palm Tower. The hallways are located outside(a bit of vertigo) but you get used to it. Our room was very nice and comfortable and quiet, too. For large meetings, it was great. The Convention Center was right next door (very convenient). The staff was friendly and helpful.The only thing that bugged us was a painting on the wall facing the bed of a little girl in a blue dress. Her eyes seemed to be following us everywhere in the room. It made our intimate moments a little awkward, but thankfully a medium size towel took care of that. Our suggestion for the painting would be to relocate her to the lobby where she can watch everyone. On the whole, a very pleasant experience. (PS-maybe an ice machine on every floor)

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: bigd85743
Reviews.Content: Over priced restraunts with less than average food, Our room was practically under the freeway with no sound damping windows or walls made us feel like we were sleeping on the freeway! $12.00/day just to park? The total expereince was horrible. We'll never return.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service and Old, Unkept Grounds Puts this One at the Bottom”
Reviews.Author: TAdvisorTraveler
Reviews.Content: When booking we asked for a crib and refrigerator. Confirmed this on check-in and the hotel staff said they would "bring it right up" Several hours later we still had nothing. After calling we finally received the crib. Still waiting for the refrigerator (four days after checkout!). Other notes: Parking here used to be free. It is now $14 per day. There is not a good system for collecting parking funds, so if you leave at a popular time (like dinner) expect to wait in a traffic line for 5-10 minutes. Don't believe the pictures the resort has posted on TripAdvisor. The pool has been patched multiple times leaving a rough and uneven surface. The rest of the grounds need help too. The main restaurant was very good, some of the best food I've eaten at a hotel. But, I don't stay at the hotel for the food. The rooms were musky smelling. The decorating in guest rooms is old-fashioned, but in good condition. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “forget it! much better choices..”
Reviews.Author: M0MMY
Reviews.Content: we booked months ago, asked for two rooms connecting and was confirmed by email.. when we arrived they don't even have attached rooms! and the best they could do was 5th-6th floor! we arrived early am and only one room was ready.. when one of our party's went into their room it was occupied! fortunalty we didn't walk in on anything other than someones clothes spread out all over the room.. now our (side by side attached ) rooms are 4 floors apart.. our room was not really too bad but it did smell of smoke.. you have to flush the toliet 3 times to get a flush.. Internet was 10.00 per day and only one computer allowed.. parking is a joke... the food was bad.. the only good thing about this place was the maids.. hard working and did the best they could.. FORGET IT!

Reviews.Title: “Extensive grounds, rooms have problems”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: The grounds are nice and are extensive- landscaped with flowers, plants, and trees, swimming pools, and benches. Service is only so- so - and spotty. The concierge desk was helpful. But my tray from room-service breakfast, left outside the door of my room, was not removed all day -- even with a call made for service. The room (mine) was worn - and furnithsings need replacement. People staying here are booked primarily through conferences/conventions -- and actually, the meeting rooms can be nice, and the food served in the meetings beats that ordered through room service. If you have an option, if would be better to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Run for the hills! This place is horrible!”
Reviews.Author: vacationhereIcome
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I must agree with the terrible reviews of this place. It has got to be one of THE worst "hotels" I have ever had the displeasure of staying. Out of no choice of my own, our school district booked it for a conference that I was attending in July. (The conference hall, which is part of the Town and Country, is a step up from the rest of the hotel). I'll begin with the total disorganization in the lobby during check-in... Granted, there were a zillion teachers and other guests swarmed in the lobby, but one would think that by now management would have implemented some sort of organized procedure for handling guests at such high volumes. No one seemed to know what was going on and the times we were told our rooms would be ready varied from one staff person to another. As we trekked through the overgrown jungle-like walkways to get to a restaurant for breakfast, we landed upon a low-class version of a cafe. It looked like some sort of side of the highway Jerry's Restaurant from the 1960s. After standing in a line that went out the door, we were seated at separate tables (not a big deal, since there were 9 of us). However, after waiting forever I was hoping for a meal that was at least somewhat palatable. I'm not sure how you go wrong with a cheese omlet and potatoes, but they managed to. The potatoes were charred and the omlet was grey - everything tasted like a piece of charcoal! Yuck!! After two bites, I paid my twelve dollars and easily convinced the rest of our group never to dine here again. I've never paid so much for such a disgusting meal. Several hours later we had a room. With all of the money that they get from ripping people off, I don't see how they can't afford to update the place. The rooms were dark, dirty, old, and just plain old creepy. They have this bizarre old Victorian thing going on as their decor. The bathrooms have peeling wall paper and the shower doesn't seem to have been scrubbed since they built the hotel. There were special hairs in my bed and on a few "clean" towels. Yes, the special kind that you keep down under. The toilet backed up even after having someone come in and "fix" it. The walls are paper thin. We could hear our neighbors brushing their teeth and unfortunately for us, we got to smell their cigarette smoke all night and morning while in the room. Haven't they heard of separating smoking floors from non-smoking floors??? I've read several reviews about the beautiful grounds and pools. Not true... Unless you consider gardens littered in trash and worn down pools littered with seedy characters everywhere beautiful. This "hotel" couldn't have gotten things more wrong. They need to shut down and renovate every inch of this property. Perhaps back in the 1950s or 60s this place was of resort quality, but it has since been flushed to sewer quality. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone. There are by far nicer hotels to enjoy while staying in San Diego. The only plus to this experience was that I didn't have to pay for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: John D.M.
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Town and Country and thought this hotel was fine. My only negative experience was that I had to wait a half and hour for my room even though I arrived at 4:30. Much of this property dates from the `60s but it seemed very well maintained to me and my room was very nicely furnished. I liked the landscaping, my very large balcony and the overall atmosphere. I should say that had I driven I would not have been very happy with the charge for parking -- that's something I'd only expect to see from a hotel downtown. It does seem to be geared primarily to business people on expense accounts. I would have preferred something downtown but that's just a 15 minute trip using the adjacent trolley station. If you bring your car I suppose that it's located somewhat close to several San Diego tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out just fine for us...a nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline and I was very suprised and concerned that we would get a non-brand name hotel. But despite calling Priceline, they would not cancel it. When we arrived, it was just fine. We had a tower room. Clean, good size, two sinks, well designed bathroom. We also had a great view of the two pools which we enjoyed later. Did not spend much time on the grounds, but overall, they were fine. I was ready to write a negative review, but really can't. The place worked out fine for us. Very convenient to San Diego downtown, Seaworld, affordable restaurants, La Jolla. We were traveling with two kids, grandma, etc. I guess my only nits would be that the rooms could be better insulated for noice, but that could happen anywhere. The other would be the charge for parking. Overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “no, no run away...”
Reviews.Author: ricky1
Reviews.Content: Stayed aug 13-17. 2006 Never again. Traveled with my husband & 8 yrs son. got elevator which got stuck, firedept all night, 700 teenagers, no cable changed room next night after a long day at sea world to a room with NO BED!! No cable. changed rooms again next day Hotel room had power cut off I was on the 8th floor with No elec, no elevator. mainteance guy told me the hotel knew! they were renovating. I wish someone told my family. fighting to get 1/2 my money back for 1/2 my vacation moving from room to room. poor front desk personal their manager ran out right when things got bad seen her with my own eyes just left them. managers name Brittney. so sad. so unprofessional. I will be writting the owner, he should know. If you want a hotel go else where this is a 1960's motel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: XRD
Reviews.Content: After staying in SD several times over the years at nice hotels, a friend convinced me to try this place. Going to SD for a convention and work, I booked their nicest room on the web site three weeks ahead, and confirmed it a week before on the phone. My work has me traveling the world 100-200 days a year. After a long dayâ€™s work, and making it through the extra traffic to get there, I find they've sold my room out from under me. Explanation was "First come, first served." After doing a Seinfeld reservation routine with someone who had canned answers, I figured they really didn't care. As I made other reservations in the parking lot I heard there were a thousand rooms there. I guess quantity makes up for quality? Last time I go through the grist mill on hotel circle. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “great location and vacation”
Reviews.Author: laxplayer123
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this resort for 2 nights, 3 days. When we first arrived we cringed up because it was right near the highway. One member of the family thought that it was just a small motel but she was definitly wrong. It is a huge complex with many restuarants and 4 pools which are great. When we really got into the resort part it was amazing you couldnt even see the highway or hear it. It was like a little secluded place. The food was ok...not the greatest but a not horrible. There is a great spa which is very elegant inside. All the staff were very efficient. And worked in a fast manner to measure up to our needs. The grounds are beautiful with palms, bird houses and gorgeous gardens and gazebos. The only real turn off to me is that the trolley is right behind the hotel and just random people can get off the trolley and walk right into the hotel and use all their facielities. I thought there should be guards and key cards for you to get into the pools and buildings. Our san diego experience was very good....although it may be a little to much of a convension center it still made our vacation meet our expectations

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: UFTAMU
Reviews.Content: We were vey skeptical of this hotel due to the number of negative comments but had no other choices since all other hotels under $200.00/niight were sold out for our weekend travel date. If you prefer the modern, sterile hotels, this place is not for you. The property is a "throw-back" to the family resorts of the 1960's and '70's with tremendous class and character. When we arrived, we were given a room in the older 2-story section of the property - definitely ask for these rooms vs the high rise "towers." Great location near, but not too close to the swimming pools and surrounded by the gorgeous flower beds. As we feared after reading the reviews, the A/C unit in our room barely gave out a whisper of cold air on a day of a record heat wave. We called the front desk and within 30 minutes, maintenace had replaced the entire window unit instead of trying to fix it. All of the staff we encountered were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The only negative we experienced was our arrival by the trolley (we wanted to avoid the hassle and high cost of parking). The trolley stops at the back of the hotel's property and there are no signs leading you to the registration desk. The property is huge so be prepared for a long, circuitous walk to the lobby if you arrive by the trolley. I am one of the most critical travelers and expect a great facility and great service when paying over $100.00/nite for any hotel. As noted in the title of this review, we were pleasantly surprised and will definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Most horrific experience- think twice before booking!”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer12345
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed here for a conference and it was awful! When we checked in it took at least 15 minutes to check in. We had reserved a non-smoking room in a renovated building. Upon entering the building we waited over 20 minutes for the elevator because one was down. The hallways were covered with filth ( including gum, toilet paper, trash, etc.) They looked like they were never cleaned! Lights in the hallway were blinking on and off. A small child looked at us in the elevator and said "these rooms are disgusting". We entered our room and it was filled with cigarette smoke, dark, dirty ( either a thumb print of blood or ketchup on our wall). We immediatly called the front desk and were told " there is nothing we can do, we are oversold tonight). Why a hotel would oversell is beyond me, but upon insisting to talk to a manager, a room magically opened up. The next room was a "suite" that included a couch, but no bed. Once of us slept on the couch and the other on a cot. The next day we were promised the room we had orgainally requested in a renovated building. The room was not cleaned in time ( after 3:30 pm) despite being promised it would be ready by 12:00 ( we were driving around all day with our computers, etc. in the car) so we were put into "their best room". That was a joke. This room had outdated decor and peeling paint. We asked to move again and we're put into a room that looked okay ( a relative okay by this point). That night we woke up to our neighboor jiggling the door between the rooms. The door was so thin that his light was shining through all night ( like a giant night light) and could hear him eating chips!!!!! No sound proofing! Worst of all, our beds felt cold and wet. We realized the a/c was pumping out cold wet air. The comforter was wet, the curtains were wet, our clothes were wet. The next day we checked out and found a much much nicer hotel in Old Town. We were concerned for our health at that point due to the poor air quality. Many people at our confrence felt the same way about the rooms. While the grounds here are pretty, they are not clean. There was trash all over at 7:00 am. Cups, beer cans, etc. left out all night. Elevators were disgusting and front desk staff seems trained to lie. We were told so many mistruths in our short 48 hour stay. After 4 rooms in 48 hours, we had to give up. In addition, people spotted rats running across walkways. You can find a much nicer hotel in San Diego. I have never stayed in such a nasty place ( I am sure that even motel 6 must be nicer).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our balcony”
Reviews.Author: TZK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Royal Palm Tower for 7 nights. I chose a room in the Royal Palm Tower because most of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor seemed to be about rooms in other parts of the hotel. We stayed at this hotel several years ago so I was prepared this time for the dark, dated rooms. (The walls & carpets are a fairly dark shade of blue.) I'm not sure if the bathroom had been updated but it was bright & cheery. There was a sink in the actual bathroom area & an additional vanity/sink right outside the bathroom - it was handy having 2 sinks. Our room was large & our air conditioning worked fine . All the rooms in the Royal Palm Towers have balconies - most look out at the resort but a few just look at concrete walls. We were on the 2nd floor & enjoyed our balcony a lot because it was shaded by the ground level trees. Parking is definitely a problem but because we never got back in the late evening, we could always find a decent parking space. We ate breakfast & a couple of dinners in the attractive Terrace Cafe - food is ok. The nearby mall (walking distance) has a food court and several popular chain restaurants: California Pizza Kitchen, P.F. Chang's, The Cheesecake Factory & Uno Chicago Grill. It is very convenient to take the Trolley to downtown - we took it to Petco Park. As other reviewers have mentioned, the grounds are very attractive with lots of beautiful plants.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Ever..Buyer Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I made reservations for a two queen bed room. I called the day of check in to let them know that we would be arriving after midnight and I was told that was just fine. We get there and a big group of people attending a conference was checking in. My husband stood in line behind a couple that apparently did not have a room. The front clerk said he would give them someone else's room that had not checked in. He gave them a two queen bed room. Then my husband goes to check in and they have no rooms. I had to argue with them for over 30 minutes and wouldn't you know it...they found us a room. However, the front clerk referred to the people who had reserved that room as "poor bastards." Very Distasteful. This is how they see their customers. They told me that even though I held the conformation in my hand for a two queen bed room (I had already paid as well) they could not guarantee me a room or the specified accomodations. It is a first come first serve faciltiy. And I could not get reimbursed for the money I paid should I be put in a cheaper room. The front clerks did not know how to run the computer and they were very rude. They almost put us in a room that was already occupied!!!! I could not believe it. TOP THAT OFF with $12.00 a day parking fees that is not posted anywhere. We stayed three nights and paid $390.00 for the room and parking. There was no microwave or refrigerator. Parking was awful and overcrowded. All the employees were rude and seemed to HATE their job and the people who chose to stay there. I would never recommend this place to anyone. As the front clerk told me, "We get our business mostly from conventions and that is who we cater too. So we can never guarantee a reservation because someone may need the room before you." There are so many other BETTER hotels right next to this hotel. THIS PLACE SUCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with Charm”
Reviews.Author: Ewa Beach
Reviews.Content: Roses are the theme at this resort. Roses that are beautiful, multi-colored and "Humongous". My wife and I live in Ewa Beach and just returned from a four night stay at the Town and Country during the month of June. I've read many reviews about this hotel, many good, many bad, which made us a little skeptical. However, we thought, (1) the Town and Country had an excellent location to the areas we wanted to see, (2) we had never stayed at this hotel prior to this visit, and (3) everyone has different opinions about different thngs, so, why not, "Chance Um". We checked in on a Wednesday night after ten-thirty and was greeted by Brian, a courteous and very friendly gentleman. Brian informed us from the Get-Go that there would be a $12.00 a day parking fee, I guess other guests had complained about this surprise expense, but remember, I've read all of the prior traveler reviews, so I was "ready". After locating our building, you could tell that it looked like any other fifty-three year old hotel, showing signs of maturity, but still maintaining that graceful look. All of the parking stalls were taken. Vehicles were also parked out of stalls and anywhere you could squeeze a vehicle into, with no assigned parking stalls, the parking lot theme was "Park Where-Ever". Another "Challenge" to staying at this hotel, but we found our special parking space right next to our room, "Be Creative". We stayed on the second floor of a two story building in Room #3381. No elevators, so we had to hump our luggage up the stairs and carry our sleeping six year old grandson. The room was "quaint" with nothing to brag about. However, the room looked "Beautiful" especially after a long flight from Honolulu and a hassel with Dollar Rent a Car, but that's another story. Finding a place to eat dinner after eleven is another challenge. The parking lot attendant was courteous and informative. He suggested Denny's which we happily agreed to, hot cakes, over-easy eggs and link sausage never tasted so good. The next day, we toured the hotel grounds. Beautiful surroundings, day or night. Prices at the hotel are what you would expect at any other place, "High, Higher, and Highest". However, we had the use of a Dodge Charger, and there are a plethora of choices surrounding the Town and Country. There is even a Trolley, a short walk behind of the hotel, just before you reach the Fashion Valley Shopping Center, which can take you to Old town or Downtown for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Sleeping at night can be a problem if you are a light sleeper. On several occasions, I could hear people talking or walking "heavily" by our room. Adjacent "Neighbors" can be heard talking due to thin walls. Air Conditioning. If you like to have an instant cold air conditioning, this place is not for you. However, the room does get cold, but it slowly creeps up on you. So as you leave for your daily itinerary, leave the air conditioner on "High", and you will be rewarded upon your return to your room. Housekeeping was excellent. After informing the maid that there were three people staying in the room and not two people, we were never lacking in towels or amenities. Upon returning, our room was always squared away and since we stayed out to almost midnight every night, we were never bothered by the maid as long as you place the "Do Not Disturb" sign in your electronic key slot. There were always hotel security roaming the grounds, especially at night, and this fact alone is the reason why I would choose Town and Country, again and again. Mahalo nui loa

Reviews.Title: “find a better value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a conference. We spent five nights at the Town & Country. I would not recommend this hotel. The grounds are lovely. They have some of the most beautiful roses. The pool areas are nice as well. However, I do not know if the rooms have been updated since 1985. The hotel has outdated wallpaper, faded bedding, and worn out furniture. I also did not find it to be secure. It seems anyone could wander in and out. While we were there we encountered issues with the air conditioner, shower (not draining) and toilet (leaking). I would recommend checking out the Doubletree that is within a couple of blocks. Aside from the beautiful landscaping, the hotel is a short walk from the Fashion Valley Mall and the trolley station. It is a convenient location within minutes of area attractions. However, I believe you could find a better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a few days at the Town & Country Resort in San Diego,CA. It is rather nice. The service of the front desk is wonderful and efficient. Instantly the property is pretty big in parameters. The decor at the front desk needs updating. They have security which is nice for parking etc. Parking is very limited though. They have construction and renovations that are taking up the parking spaces so that was a hassle. Great for the renovations not so great for parking! Our room was nice and spacious but the decor again has got to be updated carpet and all - whew! Not sure what design theme was colonial ? something don't know? Felt like we stepped back into the 60-70s. The bathroom shutter door (which limits privacy) stuck to the floor. The bathroom is very spacious. The wallpaper has to go. There was mold and water buildup around the showers and the sink was multiple cracked. They had a really nice linen closet for extra linen/towels etc. The bed was wonderful great pillows. Sleeping was good! They have multiple pools on the property which ducks enjoy too! Our room was centrally located to restaurant/cafes and near the convention center. Not good when it rained though. The restaurant was really good. Breakfast was excellent! Service was excellent! Dinner/late night eating had unlimited options for late dining but very limited service and wasn't sure we'd get our food but once we did it was good. We ate only at the Terrace Cafe. They have multiple levels of eateries sitdown table cloth, family cafe, deli to go. Which was really nice. Had room service one morning only - it was horrible. Everything was cold! Overall this is a average good hotel/resort it was very, very convenient for shopping there is a mall maybe 5 mins away. Grocery store 5-7 mins away including post office and other conveniences. Restaurants very close 5 mins (Cheesecake factory, Joe's Crab shack, a bunch others worth perusing) Its location is very central to all your needs. We can recommend this property for accommodations but they really need to look at updating their location. Check them out! This is great for couples and families with kids!

Reviews.Title: “Town & Country Is Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Town & Country is overpriced for what you get. We could have stayed at a budget hotel and got the same type room (or maybe more updated). It's not a bad hotel, just overpriced for what it is. There's no benefit or discount for River Walk Golf, right across the road. It is close to a nice mall that you can walk to. But as far as hotels, it was more of a motel style w/o anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: carribeanfreak
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day conference at this resort. I found the resort old, run down, in need of desperate updating. The staff here not helpful and almost acted ashamed. The Bellmen seemed to be the only ones who knew what was going on. I arrived at 1:30 in the afternoon to find my room not ready. Not a resturant open or even a bar to have a drink while I waited. Odd? I purchased a post card in the meantime and was told they had no postage stamps and didnt know when they would get any. She had to put her phone conversation on hold while she took my money in the gift shop. After waiting 3 1/2 hours my room was ready. Not in the tower requested but I was placed in the farthest from the convention center. The housekeeping was terrible. I watched as it took 3 days to pick up a dinner roll under the table in the hallway. The light bulbs in the light fixtures in the hallways are too stong a wattage so they have left burn marks on the ceilings as they are too hot. A fire hazard. They did not replace drinking glasses in my room one day. I waited 2 1/2 hours for them to bring them to my room. Don't expect to use the sauna or hot tub. This is the only resort I know where you have to pay $9 a day to use the health club which includes the sauna and hot tub. This resort is poorly managed. It is a shame as the location is fantastic. I would not recommend anyone stay here who is under Bing Crosby or Bob Hope's age.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (spouse, 3 year-old, 5 month-old, and I) stayed at this hotel during a conference. We stayed for 5 nights and six days. The hotel was paid for by the company, so, luckily, that was not an issue. Despite some of the other previous reviews, we enjoyed the hotel even with very small children. Positve Aspects: Right (smack dab) in the middle of Hotel Circle. Very near the zoo, balboa park, sea world, and the freeway. WHile my husband was at the conference, I was easily able to navigate around by myself. Very near to a freeway exit/enterance A large shopping mall is directly behind the hotel parking lot. City trolley station directly behind the hotel parking lot. I rode the trolley by myself with my 3 year old and my 5 month and I did not feel unsafe. At one point I did get on the wrong trolley, but easily corrected my mistake. I think there are 3 different pools on the resort lot. My children and I tried 2 of them. There was not a children's pool (which I would have liked), but the pools we did try were clean, well stocked with towels, very close to the hotel rooms, and surrounded by many tables and lounge chairs. One of the pools we tried was not heated, but the main pool in the center of the resort was. I don't know if this is normal for the hotel or not. Nice sized television with free cable channels. Nice view from the front (door) and back (balcony) of our hotel room. Negative Aspects: Nothing extra is free. For us, we usually stay at less expensive hotels (Comfort Inn, Best Western, etc.) and it is nice to wake up to free breakfast and coffee- even if it is a bowl of cereal and a banana. This hotel has restaurants on site, the price for breakfast was approx. $7-8 per person. I do think that children were able to eat free with paid adult at breakfast though. Dial up internet is charged. Local calls were charged. ( we brought our cell phone and used it while we were there for free). Movies and video game usage are extremely expensive. The walls are fairly thin, you can hear the toilet in the next room being used. The staff was not always friendly (but that is bound to happen at any business).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading the reviews but I was very please. This is a quiet and charming oasis of old-fashioned calm. The prices are good, especially if you are careful with add-ons. The gardens and grounds are wonderful and the staff was always friendly. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: spidermom3
Reviews.Content: After much research to find a nice place to stay in San Diego we came up with the Town and Country Resort. We read what different people had written about it on TripAdvisor and decided it probably wouldn't be too bad. I noticed the overall score for them was approximately 3.7 or something around there, be decided on taking a chance. We reserved a king, smoking room in the tower. When we arrived we verified with the gentleman at the counter that this is what we were getting. We got up to the room which was a very typical older hotel room. Definitely not a big deal. We were about to unpack when I noticed a sign on the door saying that this was a non-smoking room. I called the desk to say there was a problem and that this was a non-smoking room, they came back saying that was all they had and that maybe the next day they might have one (that would be night two of our two night stay). Be reminded that the gentleman at the front desk verified this is what we had asked for. To make a long story short, we decided we would find a room at another hotel that would definitely give us what we wanted (which we did. The Doubletree was new, beautiful, accomodating and less expensive). The kicker is when we went down to the desk to give the key back a lady was at the counter almost in tears. It seems she was attending a convention at the Convention Center at the hotel. She had arrived earlier that morning and they told her that her room wasn't ready and to come back later in the day. It was 5:30 p.m. and they had GIVEN HER ROOM AWAY!! She had made her reservation a month in advance, had her confirmation in hand, and all they could do was apologize, they had no rooms left!! I couldn't believe it! When they "went back to check" I told her that we had a room that we had been in for just 10 minutes and were leaving because it wasn't what we wanted or needed...it was exactly what she had a confirmation for. When they came back to her to again apologize that they had nothing we told them we were leaving and that our room was available....it ended up we were all happy, we left and she got a room! Very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Town & Country Resort - big resort but not all that”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is more for convention, conferences, i wouldnt reccomended for personal stay. The grounds is too big and I wouldnt say their grounds are arent that nice and pretty which their site said it is because of their "many gardens". there are many trees tho, palm trees near around the pool area. Their rooms, hallways, and even most of their buildings are somewhat old, not that old, but yeah they are remodelign the place. their service was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: EliteClass
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town & Country Resort on Hotel Circle Drive. It is very well maintained: the rooms were excellent; grounds were always clean; staff was plentiful; the food and service was great. And, although the resort was doing some renovations, the noise was kept to a minimal level. The weather was sunny and warm every day (Jan 4-8). I visited Old Towne, Gaslamp, and the Fashion Valley Mall (which is walking distance from the hotel). Old Towne and Gaslamp are communities close by. We took the trolley. Only a few minutes ride. Great trip, great weather, great resort, great city -- great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for business. Depends on what you get....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the little cottage rooms for three nights. The room was cute though a little outdated. It felt a little dusty actually. The 'resort' is a weird collection of buildings - each one different. We stayed in one of the single floor cottages - which was very cute but Im not sure I would have enjoyed staying in the bigger buildings (some of which look like motels). We had our own little patio and rose garden. The hotel is known for its roses - they're everywhere. There are pools and little food places in every nook and cranny - its odd but cute. Theres a good dinner/cafe with reasonably priced food. Its an easy walk to a large open air mall and the train service. We had a perfectly comfortable stay - only complaint - our key didnt work and it literally took 30 minutes for someone to come and open the door - this with a one year old after a flight from NY - we werent amused. The property is also a little dated.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Several co-workers and I stayed there for a week during a conference. It was a decent hotel--nothing extraordinary. The staff was very accomodating and the rooms (ours were in the towers) were quite spacious (although a little outdated). We had a room and a suite on the ground floor with patios--very nice! I agree that the restaurants on the campus are not great and pretty expensive, but the food at Trellises was quite good (although the hostess at this restaurant was unbearably stuffy!!!). One things that stood out to me about this hotel was the gardens/pools/decks. It really does look and feel like a resort. Overall, I would give this hotel an okay rating.

Reviews.Title: “Still remodeling - and still needs it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When the week-long conference location was announced, I was hopeful that the remodeling the hotel had started a year ago would be completed, and it would be a pleasant stay. When we arrived, the two bed, non-smoking room we had reserved was 'taken' while we were doing the paperwork. Eventually they found a room in 'The Tower', and directed us through the road construction to the parking 'out back'. The room was old, outdated, no insulation so you could hear the inhabitants of the next room using the toilet - as well as other activities. On four occasions, we had to contact the front desk to get towels, and 'complimentary coffee', since housekeeping had left none in the room. On the last night we returned to find the dirty towels and sheets from the room in a pile outside of the door. To our surprise the beds were made, but there were no towels, and no 'complimentary coffee'. It took an hour to get them. There were loud parties going on on the patios well after midnight, which the hotel 'could not do anything about'. The restaurants on the property are mediocre, the food overpriced, and the staff rude- consistent with the rest of the property. The wireless internet service is $9.95 for 24 hours, but was out for the first day. The hotel did set up a complimentary router for the conference use to compensate for it - but with 400+ people trying to use it the bandwidth and number of connections were ineadequate. Oh - and for dial-up, they charge for it. When booking beware: The rates the second week of september were $49+. The third week they were $169+. The last week, $119+. Bottom line: The Staff are there for the convenience of the staff, not the customer. The conference has booked the same place next year. I wont be staying there: There are many better accomodations just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: lahainaluna
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to hear the bad reviews of this hotel. I booked through Priceline and got it for $90 per night. Check in time was 3:00pm but I stopped by at 11:00am and was happily surprised they could check me in then. My room was on the 2nd floor of a 2 story building and overlooked a very beautiful and lush courtyard. Parking was $12 per day but was close to the room. The complex is huge and the gardens are lovely. My room was very comfortable, clean and quiet and the furnishings were above average. Very "un-hotel-like". Lots of pools too. I'll be back the next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought it would be -- not good at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Didn't get off to a good start -- we booked a "Garden View Room" with two double beds (there were 4 of us, two adults and 2 kids)... we checked in and were told we were going to be in a "comparable" room - well that was a joke! They stuck us in some tower building (by the way, this is a "convention" place, and unless you have a name tag hanging around your neck you really don't fit in and could get lost in this complex) we opened the door to the room and it had ONE bed, yes one bed... and it was a small room. When I called to complain the manager told me "you only "requested" a garden room with a double bed, that didn't mean you would get that". At that point I demanded my money back. They then "found" an available Garden Room and moved us... but it wasn't worth it. The onsite restaurants are expensive and not worth it (5.50 for a bagel at breakfast) -- the pools were nice and the grounds were fine, but did they mention the 12.00 a day to park your rental car there when you made your reservation? No, I'm sure they didn't. It was definitely not worth it. Not really happy with it -- wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ewwww Ugly Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashlynnsie
Reviews.Content: We styed there in July of 2005. Looks wonderful on the webpage, anything but. The first room we got was so old and dirty and hot, we called the front desk to ask about our air conditioning and they said we cant control it! It will turn on when it gets hot out! What?? That makes no sense what about the comfort of the people inside. We asked to be moved to a new room which they did for a 20 per night fee. Whatever. That room wasnt much better. Old Dirty Disgusting and the walls were so bad and thin we could hear our neighboors going pee!!! On top of this they charge 12.00 a day to park! Total Rip off and Gross! Do not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Just plain Awful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple this hotel is not worth it. Booked two rooms wanted to make sure My sister and I were next to one another verified this twice before coming to the hotel and still did not get rooms together my sister at the time was pregnant they gave her a smoking room it took her 5 hours to get into a new room and we got a room all the way at the back of the hotel because I overheard them talking at the desk because I had a 4 year old so lets stick them at the back. Go figure we were there for my sons birthday. I would have rather went to the motel 6 maybe its changed since then but as I see some of the reviews I guess not. I also wrote a letter to this hotel and I never heard back from anyone I guess I wasn't surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I wanted to go to San Diego for our anniversany and had no idea where to stay, after a lot of web searching I came across the Town and Country. When I looked at the pictures on-line it looked , ok . However once we got there, checked in, found our room (the place is huge, we where stopped by an employee who showed us where to go we must have looked very lost :) ) and started to walk around the grounds we where blown away. It is so beauitful there are gazebo's throughout and roses everywhere . They have everything onsite you never have to leave, the staff is very helpful, there are 5 resturants so whatever you craving they will have it there . I would recommend the Town and Country if you want somewhere to relax, take in the landscape and take time to smell the roses.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Grounds But Other Problems”
Reviews.Author: colt123
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a 5-day conference at the Town and Country, along with other coworkers. Before leaving home I read the previous tripadvisor reviews and knew some of the concerns. I stayed with a coworker in a "bungalow" facing one of the 4 swimming pools, and at first was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room (included sitting area), vaulted ceiling, dark colonial styled furniture, and colorful wallpaper (although dated). We had a lovely view of the pool and tropical vegetation if we kept the drapes open, although people could then look into the room. The bathroom wallpaper was pealing in places, but not bad. The room was clean, and well-supplied with towels, etc. The handle on the bathroom sink kept coming unscrewed. The room clock/radio periodically made loud humming noises, so we finally unplugged it. The mattresses were VERY firm, too firm for me. The walls were somewhat thin, as we could hear the doors slamming closed next door, the service personnel rolling their carts back and forth over the cobbled walkway outside, and people talking as they walked by. After the first night we turned the room AC fan up on full to help drown out the noises. There is a charge for all calls outside the resort, including 1-800 calling cards and local calls, and you have to pay by the day to use the exercise facilities. We got parking included with the conference fees, but other people staying there had to pay. There were billing problems for many of the folks from our group, which still weren't resolved when we left. A PO had been issued by our employer to cover room costs, but the front desk hotel personnel (usually "interns") insisted upon billing someone for each room. Some of our group got angry and refused to give them a credit card #. One supervisor was told her credit card would be billed for the total cost of the group. Two of my coworkers said they had problems with their rooms, and called for maintanence, who promised to be right there and never showed up. The food at the restaurants onsite was overpriced, so most of us went to the mall next door to eat, or drove to other San Diego locations. The tram system is right behind the resort, and very handy to travel about town. It even goes all the way to Tijuana. I wouldn't stay at the T & C again, especially at the rates our employer was charged. The best things about the T & C are the grounds (lovely tropical flowers, vines and roses everywhere with gazebos, trellises, benches, and the pools), and the location next to the trolley system and mall. It's worth walking through to see the resort grounds, but stay somewhere else if you have the choice, unless you get a super deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference in late July. When we first checked in the staff was not in a hurry to help us. We had to talk loudly to the desk clerk because a janitor was using the vaccum behind the front desk. The first room we got was not very clean. Also, the decor is straight out of 1978. We asked to change rooms are were aloud to do so. The first room was dirty and the carpet was badly stained. It also smelled moldly. The second room was not much better than the first. The air conditioning did not work properly. This made things pretty uncomfortable with the hot summer weather. The hotel has beautiful grounds, however, the rooms are in bad need of a remodel. The conference rooms were large, but are also in need of a remodel. The hotel is very close to the freeway and downtown San Diego. This whole area needs an update however. Most of the hotels on North and South Hotel Drive are older and look like they were in their prime in the 1970's.

Reviews.Title: “When there is no other choice STAY HOME!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where to even begin, let's start with the $12.00 a day parking fee that they throw at you when you check-in.. Has anybody ever heard of getting charged to park in a hotel parking lot in which you have reservations for? On top of that they charge $15.00 per day occupancy tax yet again adding more to the bottom line when checking in. We decided to rent a movie off of the service that is provided in the room which was a great movie but did not expect to pay $11.00 for it and the $2.00 movie tax they charge on top of that. So what ever your quote is to stay at this hole go ahead and tack on $54.00 and an additional $13 if you rent a movie. I won't even go into how over priced room service was. So if you like staying in a tiny room with paper thin walls and enjoy paying the inflated prices they charge by all means enjoy your stay!!.

Reviews.Title: “Okay older property”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandcris
Reviews.Content: My family of wife and two teenagers spent two nights at this sprawling, old-fashioned property just off Highway 8 on Hotel Circle. The front desk was friendly, but when we informed them that we needed a roll-away, we were told that it would not fit in a Tower Room, so we were given a "bungalow" room. The room itself was clean, but we felt closed-in because you needed to close the drapes. Plus, with a lot of foot traffic outside, you constantly hear the conversations of people walking by well into the night. We requested a room change the next day and the staff was friendly and accomodating about moving us to a Tower Room. The Tower room was a vast improvement. It was almost as big as the bungalow, (and it easily could have handled a roll-away!). It also had a nice balconey with a view of the pool...a great place to relax and have a cold one. Again, room was clean, bed okay, pillows a bit firm, but otherwise very nice. We had complimentary breakfast buffet tickets one morning (a $48.00 value) for a nice breakfast somewhat similar to the fare at an Embassy Suites. We paid $129.00 for the room (via a deal through SDSU>) Had to pay $9.00 for parking, which is nothing but a gouge. The new lite-rail line can get you to SDSU in about 15 minutes, which is extremely convenient. The Fashion Valley Mall is adjacent to the property and also very convenient for shopping and food. I didn't use the fitness center due to an additional fee, so I never saw it. I saw some runners using Hotel Circle as a 2-3 mile loop, but unless sucking car exhaust is cool with you, I wouldn't count on finding a close by running area. The pools (I think there are 3 or 4 on the grounds) were busy, with extra towels handy, and add to an old fasioned look (when was the last time a hotel pool was built with a 12 foot deep end?) My summation is "okay for the price I paid, but I'll look for newer and nicer next time."

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: sylbro
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and the hotel was very very clean. It was cozy we felt like we were staying at someones house in their bedroom. We booked 2 rooms as our son & his family of 5 also went. Both rooms were clean there were no complaints from any of us. Our rooms had 2 double beds. Our stay included free breakfest buffet each morning and 4 adult tickets to Legoland. The breakfest was good. We booked to nights in this hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent. Close to restaurants, mall, and freeway. We all felt we would stay here again. When we go to San Diego hotel circle is our favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at the Town and Country!”
Reviews.Author: lilypad53
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days, 3 nights at this hotel and I must say after reading many negative reviews on this site I was not expecting much, and I was very pleasantly surprised! We got a triple room in the Royal Palm Towers (I think) for $159/nt. It was in the building at the back of the resort. The room was on the bottom floor, had a beautiful outdoor patio accessible via sliding glass door from the room. Room was quite spacious with 2 queen beds, very clean, and beds were turned down in the evening with chocolates left on the pillows! We ordered pizza from room service and it was delicious and reasonably priced for a hotel room service. Staff was helpful, friendly and courteous. As stated in other reviews, the grounds on this resort are beautifully landscaped. There are 4 pools, and only one seemed to have mainly kids at it. Even for a busy weekend, adults could find a relatively quiet pool to relax at. Sea World is very easily accessed via a short freeway drive, and the trolly stop behind the hotel is great to get around San Diego. My daughter loved having the mall right behind the hotel as well. As some other reviews stated, the hotel does seem to cater to large groups and conventions, and several were present during the weekend of our stay as well. However, I did not find the hotel service to me or my family compromised due to this. The coffee shop had good food for breakfast/lunch, but didn't try any other hotel restaurants. There were periods of times of loud partying, etc, that could be heard either from your room or various parts of the property, however, by the time I was ready to hit the pillow (btw, the pillows were not very comfortable, the only negative of this place I can really state) and turn out the lights, it was a quiet night well into 8 or 9 am the next morning. My husband and daughter used the Spa for massages, facial and manicure and pedicure, and they had a wonderful experience there as well!! As stated before, this is not the Ritz, but in my experience for the price and location it is an excellent value. From reading the negative reviews on here I think perhaps your experience may depend on which room you get and where. I'd highly recommend a ground floor room in the tower at the rear of the property. My family and I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, centrally located, clean & cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how much we actually paid per night for the room, since we got a great package price on Travelocity (round-trip tickets on American Airlines from St. Louis to San Diego including 6 nights hotel for about $453 per person) -- maybe free! The hotel grounds were gorgeous - palm trees, enormous blooming bird of paradise plants, hundreds of varieties of roses in bloom. We had read the reviews and expected the outdated decor, but the room was freshly painted, remodeled, and immaculately clean. Sure, we had to pay $12 per day to park our car in the lot, but it wasn't a big deal. The heated salt water pool and whirlpool were a wonderful relaxer in the evening. Trellises restaurant had delicious pancakes and hot coffee for breakfast. The hotel is centrally located on Hotel Circle. The trolley stop at Fashion Valley Mall is convenience; my sister & her teenage daughter returned home on the trolley after a concert at the House of Blues and were just fine. We had no complaints; in fact, I would stay here again rather than staying where I've stayed before (Hotel Del and Loews on Coronado at #200+ per night).

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Run-Down, and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were extremely dirty and shabby; linens and towels were worn and stained, and carpets were filthy. The rooms make any Motel 6 look palatial and classy. What a dump! The prices they charged were completely ridiculous. Stay anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: *Dirty, ugly rooms with flea market furniture and decorations *Roaches in rooms *Had to pay to park the car we rented from the hotel *Rude staff in restaurants, front desk, front gate and spa *Lousy food for outrageous prices -- doubled Starbuck's prices for a lousy cup of coffee *Lots of foot traffic in front of rooms *Dirty windows that wouldn't close all the way, so we heard screaming children and (-) *Air-conditioner had no discernable controls, just a knob with an arrow written in magic marker *No pay channels (HBO, Cinemax, Showtime, etc.) -- When we tried to purchase a movie, it charged the room twice, but we only got static. When we called the front desk for help, they said they'd "send someone right away." Two hours later, when no one had shown up yet, we called back to learn, "Oh, yeah. We can't get some of the movies in tonight." *Broken remote control *Beds were so hard they hurt our bones, had to fold comforter and place on the bed to give it some semblance of cushion *Shower was abnormally narrow and had NO water pressure *Noisy pool activities ALL day *No in-room refrigerator *Electrical outlet in bathroom was on the other side of the toilet, so we had to wrap the cord around the toilet to prevent from possibly being electrocuted *Meager counter space in bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: aerostef
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a conference in San Diego and we used this hotel for our annual meeting as well. The meeting room was fine with a nice patio overlooking the gardens and pool. The pools were fine, hotel facilities too with a good choice of restaurants. Rooms are ok, they could do with a little revamp as the decor might seem a bit dated. The location of the resort is great with the trolley stop right there.

Reviews.Title: “Average... out of date hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My spouse and 9 month old son stayed at the hotel b/c it was the last hotel on the conference list that was not already booked. Overall, it was OK, but the hotel is outdated in the decor. We had a nice view of the pool (which is not heated). It was clean and service was OK. We brought our own play pen which was good b/c we saw them wheel out one in the hall and it looked like an old white metal cage with full -bed sheet used (and tucked underneath- not safe!). It is close to restaurants and walking distance to the mall. We had to pay for parking, but could go in and out as much as we wanted. It usually does not rain much in San Diego, but it rained most of the time when we were there. We enjoyed the San Diego Zoo and seeing the pandas! If we had a choice, we would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Return!”
Reviews.Author: Maruka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home early from our honeymoon at the Town and Country. Where oh where to begin? When we arrived, the lady checking us in was very friendly and gave us free breakfast and drink coupons as well as one of the cottage rooms by the pool. The grounds are fantastic, with gardens everywhere you look, but that's about as far as the amenities extend. The room was marginal. Tiny bathroom (inhabited by ants), semi-clean, hard bed. A room at the Quality Inn is comparable. The prices at the restaurants on site are way overpriced and serve pretty lousy food. The waitresses at the Terrace Cafe (where the breakfast buffet is held) were scarce and often rude. But the worst part was when the hotel was invaded by the international aquatic fitness convention. They took over every pool for six hours a day, starting at 7:30 in the morning. We tried to find a quiet spot to relax, but their booming music could be heard everywhere on the grounds. The hotel staff offered to move us to one of the tower rooms (where the music was still loud) and said they could do nothing about the problem. We finally gave up and flew home early. Overall, I would not reccomend this hotel for anyone who wants a relaxing, peaceful vacation. This hotel gets their money from the big conventions in town and are not concerned with the comfort of their other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: LVSaint
Reviews.Content: Stayed here not out of choice. After reading reviews on here and seeing website, opted for Garden rooms since they were the cheapest and possibling were going to be the nicest. Rather pleasantly suprised when we saw our room (close to check in, just down path, side of lobby). Seemed to be recently decorated, not at all shabby, clean and generally nice (although colonial decor a bit OTT and unneccessary). Looked out onto garden and pool and close enough to where we parked car. Bed seemed to be new, very firm (maybe too firm) Some of the bad... There is no guarantee that if you order a king online you'll get it (I booked via their website where you'll get a cheaper room than calling them directly). It's first come first serve. It's true, they will nickel and dime you! $10 extra for each of the following - cot, fridge, parking ($12) - cheap or what! Possibly many other things that'll be extra if you ask. Very little water pressure to shower. Room and bathroom although clean, were small. In a 3000 room hotel, to offer no coin operated laundry facilities is madness. Had to venture under freeway to Best Western. All in all, would not return. There are so many of this kind of place to stay in town. This resort seems dated and it's charging policies suck. Location is fine for some attractions but to be just off the freeway isn't the prettiest of locations.

Reviews.Title: “Bad business travel choice”
Reviews.Author: Garrideb
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at the Town and Country, and stayed at the hotel for the convenience. The grounds are nice enough, but the hotel is showing its age--little to no sound insulation in the "bungalow" rooms, skimpy curtains that can't quite block the security light shining outside, budget-class linens. The hotel provides few business travel amenities. Yes, there's a gym, but you need to purchase a $10 per day spa membership to use the gym. In-room internet access is $5 a day, with no wireless capability. There's nowhere to lock down a computer, either. Conference facilities are dreary--everything is a bit faded, the exhibit space feels like the basement that it is, and there are no indoor venues for grabbing a quick snack. The hotel food was overpriced and bland. You'll do much better at the mall, or driving up the hill near the medical school. My family stayed in the area shortly before. We rented a "family" sized room at a more pedestrian motel, which gave us twice as much space as the Town and Country at half the price. Unless you're planning on hanging around your hotel and lounging poolside while waiting for a relative to finish up at the conference center, there's no point in staying at the Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “Not one of my favorites.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every three or four years I have a conference in San Diego; it has been held at the Town & Country the last three times. The first time I attended one of these, I stayed at the Town & Country and swore never to do it again. My room was in one of their towers. It was a cinder-block hell hole. It just felt oppressive. If you have to be down at Hotel Circle in San Diego, there are a lot better options.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, run down and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First the bad: Room carpet was stained (carpet cleaning was needed prior to my checking in), bed linens were rough (no fabric softener used), balcony was not private, and the elevators were quite noisy. Glad I brought earplugs. The bathroom had mold stains. The wicker chair in the room was uncomfortable, but was good for holding paperwork. The room AC/Heat didn't seem to respond to controls, but the fan worked. Food at the local restaurants was overpiced, but tasty. The grounds were not as beautiful as described as there was equipment, machinery, cars, storage sheds and workers everywhere. Not too relaxing. The pools were cold, so maybe they don't heat them, but rely upon solar energy. I saw two friends daring each other to jump in all the way. One did and screamed as she quickly climbed out. It takes more than 5 minutes to walk from one side of the grounds to the other. The good: The "Fashion Valley" mall just one block away was fun to walk, shop and eat. Paid $131.00 per night

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and the decor out of style, but even worse the rooms are in very poor condition. The wallpaper is falling off, the capet dirty, stained, and worn. The plumbing is very bad condition. This should be a $39 hotel, not a $119 hotel. I travel a lot for business and the Town & Country goes down as the absolute worst dump I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased....”
Reviews.Author: travelwhere
Reviews.Content: We went to the Town and Country on a work related trip. We stayed in "the bungalows" which by all accounts are superior to the towers. As long as you realize that they are not "bungalows" you will be fine. They must just be a newer wing of the hotel. I would gladly go back to stay in the bungalow rooms. The most important thing would be to make sure to ask for a downstairs room. The downstairs rooms have a small clean courtyard with tables. It would have been nice to sit out there to sip coffee or read. The upstairs were we stayed was like any other hotel room. The room was clean, well maintained and nicely furnished. Our room cost included a daily breakfast buffet which was really great. The trolly is located at the rear of the property. The trolly can go north as far as the San Diego Misson and south to the TJ border/Mexico. There were at least 2 grand malls, Gaslamp district, Seaport village and Old Town San Diego accessible by this inexpensive trolly. We took a cab to have ocean view dining at Pacific Beach. The round trip cab ride was $30. Although our conference was somewhere else, the convention center at the Town and Country was lovely. The grounds were very beautiful with roses galore. We did not use room service and the ill fitting sheets were not a problem to us. I would definately return to this place.

HotelInfo.Name: Town and Country Resort Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 500 Hotel Circle North, San Diego, CA 92108
